Name: Track All Your Visual Bug Reports From Slack
Article Content: Help Scout - Log In Help Scout Please login to view the requested page Log In Remember me for 30 days Log In or Sign in with Google Loading‚Ä¶ Forgot your password? Sign in with Help Scout credentials 2025 Fall Seasonal Release Collecting and Connecting Dots See What Shipped Help Scout requires JavaScript Follow these steps to enable it in your browser Google Chrome (Windows & Mac) Find the three vertical dot option in the top-right corner of your browser, and open the Settings section from there. Click the "Security and Privacy" link in the left-hand sidebar. Click the "Site Settings" option. Click the "JavaScript" option. Select "Sites can use JavaScript." Firefox (Windows & Mac) In your browser, type "about:config" in the address bar and click enter. A warning message will display on your browser; click "Accept the Risk and Continue" button to proceed. Enter "javascript.enabled" in the search box. Locate the option labeled "javascript.enabled" on the search result and select toggle to turn on JavaScript. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Microsoft Edge On the More menu (‚Ä¶), select Settings. Click the "Site permissions" option in the left-hand sidebar. Select the "JavaScript" option. Toggle the "Allow (recommended)" option to enable it. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Internet Explorer 11+ is required Upgrade For a faster, more secure browsing experience, we highly recommend installing Google Chrome or Firefox . Looking for a better way to talk with customers? Try Help Scout

Name: What Is A Project Phase
Article Content: What is a Project Phase? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is a Project Phase? The project phase defines the stage in which the work is presently progressing. For example, they are terms like "ideation"; "design", "development", etc. A phase can also be defined for different stages of tasks too. For example, they can be "to-do", "currently doing", "pending review" etc, but instead of stages of product development, they are stages of various tasks through a scrum. Below is an example of our phases in one of our projects on zipboard. How to create a project phase? You can create an unlimited number of project phases on zipBoard. You can easily view different phases of your project on the kanban board: Learn more about what you can do on Kanban Board . Did this answer your question? Name: How Do I Create A Project Phase
Article Content: How do I create a Project Phase? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I create a Project Phase? A project phase can be created by clicking on the ‚ÄòAdd Phase‚Äô button from the Phases tab. You can then add a name, description, and estimated completion date for the project phase. The last two are optional to fill. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: What Is Project Phase Status
Article Content: What is Project Phase Status? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is Project Phase Status? The project phase status appears towards the appear right hand corner of the project phase layout. You can set the status for a project phase by clicking on the ‚ÄòEdit‚Äô icon(that‚Äôs the one that looks like a pencil), which is on the right side of the project phase name. Project phase status is by default set to ‚Äú Not started ‚Äù when a phase is created. Other than this, its values can be set to: ‚Äú Active ‚Äù, ‚Äú Completed ‚Äù, and ‚Äú On Hold ‚Äù. Name: What Is Completion Date In A Project Phase
Article Content: What is Completion Date in a Project Phase? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is Completion Date in a Project Phase? You can set an estimated completion date for your project phase, as a marker for when it should be finished by. It shown on the upper left hand corner of the project phase layout. If you don‚Äôt enter a value when creating the project phase, this field will be empty by default. You can always edit it later by clicking on the ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù icon on the right side of the project phase name. Did this answer your question? Name: How Many Project Phases Can I Create
Article Content: How Many Project Phases Can I Create? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Many Project Phases Can I Create? Phases are only available for our enterprise or custom plans. You can create as many project phases within a project as you would like. There is no limit on the number of phases. Name: How Do I Assign Files Tasks And Comments To A Project Phase
Article Content: How do I assign Files, Tasks and Comments to a project phase? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I assign Files, Tasks and Comments to a project phase? üìå For new updates , please read Simplify Task Management with AI-Powered Task Types Add new files, tasks and comments to a project phase: You can add new files, tasks and comments directly to a project phase. Select the project phase you have in mind. To add any of three things mentioned above, click on their respective "Add" buttons in the project phase. Add existing files and tasks to a project phase: You can add existing files and tasks to a project phase. To add an existing file to a phase, select the file. Click on the "Edit" icon in the top right hand corner. Now select the phase from the drop down menu and click on "Save File". Similarly, to add an existing task to a phase, click on the "Edit" icon for the task: Click on the "Select" button next to "Change Phase": Did this answer your question? Name: Who Can Create A Project Phase
Article Content: Who Can Create a Project Phase? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Who Can Create a Project Phase? Only project owners can create a project phase. Reviewers and guest collaborators do not have the option to either create or edit a project phase. Did this answer your question? Name: How Do I Install Zipboards Internet Explorer Extension
Article Content: How do I install zipBoard's Internet Explorer extension? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I install zipBoard's Internet Explorer extension? You can install zipBoard's extension in Internet Explorer by watching the steps in the video below or following the steps written here: 1. When you click on the 'Review' button in your project, you'll be taken to the review tab, where you'll see a button to 'Download IE extension'. Click on this button. 2. Click on 'Run' button to run the 'zipBoardPlugin.exe' file. 3. Click 'Install' when you see the zipBoard Plugin Setup Wizard. 4. Use settings button to go to 'Manage add-ons' in Internet Explorer. 5. Select 'zipBoard plugin' and click on the Enable button, if it is not already enabled. 6. Close the old tab for review and open a new window. Launch project review by clicking on the 'Review' button. You should now be able to use zipBoard's Internet Explorer extension. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Signing Up For Zipboard
Article Content: How to Sign Up for zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Sign Up for zipBoard Getting started with zipBoard is quick and easy, and the best part is, it‚Äôs completely free to sign up! Follow these simple steps to create your account: Visit the Sign-Up Page Go to the zipBoard app by clicking on the following link: https://app.zipboard.co/signUp Enter Your Details Provide your email address , name , and desired password . Make sure to choose a strong password for your account. Create Your Account After filling out the information, click on the ‚ÄòCreate Account‚Äô button. Congratulations, you‚Äôre now a part of zipBoard! üéâ Alternative Sign-Up Options If you'd prefer to skip entering details manually, you can also sign up using your existing Microsoft or Google account by selecting the respective option on the sign-up page. This streamlines the process for you! Single Sign-On (SSO) for Enterprise Users For Enterprise accounts : ZipBoard supports Single Sign-On (SSO) , allowing you to use your organization‚Äôs credentials to access zipBoard. If your organization uses SSO, you can sign in seamlessly with your existing enterprise credentials. How to enable SSO If you'd like to use SSO for your organization, simply contact our support team, and we‚Äôll guide you through the setup process. Once you've successfully signed up, you're ready to dive into your first project! Follow our guide to get started and explore the powerful features zipBoard has to offer. üëâNext... Name: Log In To Zipboard
Article Content: How to Log In to zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Log In to zipBoard Getting started with zipBoard is simple. Follow these steps to log in or create an account: Step 1: Visit the Login Page Click this link to access the zipBoard login page: https://app.zipboard.co/ Step 2: Enter Your Credentials On the login screen, enter the email and password you used when signing up for zipBoard. Click the Login button to access your account. Step 3: Forgot Your Password? If you can‚Äôt remember your password: Click the 'Forgot Password' button. Follow the instructions to reset your password and regain access to your account. Step 4: Don‚Äôt Have an Account Yet? No worries! Click ' Create an Account ' to sign up and get started with zipBoard. Step 5: Start Your First Project Once you're logged in, you can create your first project. Click here to learn how to set up your first zipBoard project! Enjoy reviewing and collaborating efficiently with zipBoard! Did this answer your question? Follow these steps to log in or create an account: Step 1: Visit the Login Page Click this link to access the zipBoard login page: https://app.zipboard.co/ Step 2: Enter Your Credentials On the login screen, enter the email and password you used when signing up for zipBoard. Click the Login button to access your account. Step 3: Forgot Your Password? If you can‚Äôt remember your password: Click the 'Forgot Password' button. Follow the instructions to reset your password and regain access to your account. Step 4: Don‚Äôt Have an Account Yet? No worries! Click ' Create an Account ' to sign up and get started with zipBoard. Step 5: Start Your First Project Once you're logged in, you can create your first project. Click here to learn how to set up your first zipBoard project! Enjoy reviewing and collaborating efficiently with zipBoard! Did this answer your question? Name: Recover Account Or Forgotten Password
Article Content: Recover Account or Forgotten Password - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Recover Account or Forgotten Password If you forget your password, you can recover the account by selecting the ‚ÄúForgot Password‚Äù link on the Login page( https://app.zipboard.co/ ). If you ever forget your password, you should be able to recover your created account on zipBoard with these few easy steps. Go to the following link: https://app.zipboard.co/ and click on 'Forgot Password?' 2. You will be redirected to the Forgot Password page. Here you have to enter the email id that was associated with your account. 3. After entering the email id and clicking on 'Forgot Password', you will receive a password reset link from us. 4. When you click the link in the email, you will be redirected to a page where you will get an option to create a new password. 5. Enter your new password and confirm by typing it again. Now, click on the 'Reset Password', and your password will be updated to the new one! Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Adding A Collaborator Or Reviewer Account
Article Content: Adding a collaborator or reviewer account - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Adding a collaborator or reviewer account üìåFor new updates, please read How to Invite Collaborators to a Project? As a project owner (the user who has created the project) you can add a team member as a ‚Äò Reviewer/Collaborator ‚Äô. Reviewers only have access to the project to which they have been added or invited. Developers, illustrators, scriptwriters, designers or even clients can be added as reviewers. In order to add a reviewer to the project, you have to follow these few simple steps: 1. Select the project in which you want to add a reviewer/collaborator. 2. Click on the Collaborators tab either from the project menu bar that appears on the left or from the tiles displayed in the project dashboard. You can also click on the ‚Äò+‚Äô icon in the top right to add reviewers/collaborators. 3. Click on 'Add Collaborators' option in the modal that appears. 4. This displays the ‚ÄúAdd Collaborators‚Äù dialog box. Here, you can enter the email address of the person you want to invite as a collaborator and also send him a custom message with the details of the invite. You can add multiple collaborators at once just by clicking add many at once 5. The invitee will receive an email from zipBoard containing the instructions on how to log in to the application, register, connect, and access the project that he has been invited to. Name: Adding A Manager Account
Article Content: Adding a Manager Account - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Adding a Manager Account You can only add managers if you are the project owner for an organization (this feature is only available for Team/Business/Enterprise plan users) and you need to upgrade your account with managers first. Manager accounts are created at the organization level. To create a Manager account, you need to follow these simple steps: 1. Log in from your Team/Business/Enterprise admin account. 2. Click on the Organization dashboard. 5. invite a new member by entering their email address. 6.¬†Now click 'Enter' to add a new manager. 7. You can also change the Role of existing users - who have already been added to the organization but currently are not designated as managers - into managers by clicking the¬†drop-down in the member's table and clicking on the "Manager" option 8.¬†Once you have added a manager to your organization, you can add them to the desired project (like you add collaborators to any project) and they will automatically be added as a manager for that particular project. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Creating A Project
Article Content: Creating a Project in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Creating a Project in zipBoard Creating a project in zipBoard is quick and flexible ‚Äî you can either use a Custom Project Template tailored to your industry, or build your project from scratch . The setup process allows you to add resources to the project and upload related ZIP files, PDFs, images or enter a URL. You can add project plan documents, project scope specifications, design assets etc. as resources. üß© Option 1: Use a Custom Project Template zipBoard‚Äôs Custom Project Templates help you save time by preloading your project with relevant settings and tools for your specific industry. These templates automatically customize your project interface, so you don‚Äôt have to start from scratch. Available Templates: üèóÔ∏è Construction Template ‚Äì for document reviews in construction üé® Web Design Template ‚Äì for design and QA feedback üéì Learning Design Template ‚Äì for eLearning content reviews ‚úçÔ∏è Content Development Template ‚Äì for editorial and content collaboration During project creation, simply select your preferred template from the list ‚Äî and you're ready to go. üõ†Ô∏è Option 2: Build Your Project from Scratch If you‚Äôd rather start fresh and customize everything yourself, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your zipBoard account. This directs you to your zipBoard account dashboard or explorer. In case you are already logged in, click on the zipBoard logo in the upper left corner. It directs you to the account dashboard. 2. Select ‚ÄòStart from Scratch‚Äô. This opens the ‚ÄòNew Project‚Äô dialogue box. 3. Set up your project : Enter a name for your project. Optionally, edit the project ID or use the default. Add a project description. Skip the template selection if you want to build from scratch. 4. Click ‚ÄòSave‚Äô to create the project. 5. Next, you will see the option to ‚Äò Invite Your Team ‚Äô. You can choose to invite team members¬†by entering their email ID or zipBoard username, or you can do this later and skip the step. 6. You will now get the option to add files or a URL to your project. You can choose to enter a URL or upload a ZIP file, PDF, audio, or image. You can upload HTML prototypes or SCORM content by selecting the ZIP file option. For image files, you can upload JPEG and PNG images. 7. Next, you will have the option to add a task (optional): Create a bug, feature request, enhancement, or general task. Assign it, set priority, and attach files. Or add tasks later. After the task has been added, you will see this screen. This is where you can modify and control the task . üéâ That‚Äôs it ‚Äî your project is ready! Whether you used a template or built it from scratch, you can now continue collaborating with your team in zipBoard. üëâ Up next: Learn about the zipBoard account dashboard. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Working In The Zipboard Account Dashboard
Article Content: Working in the zipBoard Account Dashboard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Working in the zipBoard Account Dashboard The visual layout of zipBoard‚Äôs interface allows you to get a quick overview of your projects and their details such as resources, open bugs, tasks , enhancements, and information. The account dashboard is the screen displayed whenever you login; it displays options to create a new project, and project ‚Äúcards‚Äù that you have been granted access to, or that you have created. The grey bar along the top of the window displaying the zipBoard icon is the dashboard menu bar. You can access the following functions from here: Search : The search function indexes and searches through project names and project level tags. Help : Accesses the zipBoard Knowledge Base. Clicking the help button you will be notified to enter a search keyword, to direct you to the related help article or guide. Notifications : The number on the bell indicates modified tasks that you have been assigned to, or have elected to watch. Properties : Here, you can update your profile, change your password, and log out. The main area on the application dashboard is the project cards and the ‚ÄúCreate New Project‚Äù card. In the bottom right corner, there is an option for customer support to ping zipBoard‚Äôs team for assistance. In the next guide you will learn how to manage your projects in zipBoard using our Project Dashboard! Did this answer your question? Name: Managing The Project Dashboard
Article Content: Managing the Project Dashboard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Managing the Project Dashboard üìå For new updates, please watch this video. The Project Dashboard in zipBoard provides a comprehensive view of your project, enabling you to manage tasks, content, and collaborate with your team effectively. Here‚Äôs how to navigate and utilize the various features available on the dashboard: Overview of the Project Dashboard When you click on any project, you will be directed to the Task Manager , where the left-side menu displays the following categories: Tasks Contents Projects This menu provides quick access to all links related to tasks and content management. Project Menu Bar Categories Home The default project screen showing project properties and an overview of your project‚Äôs status. Tasks Displays a list of tasks within the task manager. You can open existing tasks or create new ones. Sort tasks based on priority, ID, screen, status, and other properties to streamline your workflow. External Feedback Add issues, directions, questions, or version update data as project comments. Feedback registered as comments will not appear in the task manager but can be converted into tasks later on. Messages Use the Message Board to efficiently communicate or post information for collaborators and clients. Uploads Displays all files and URLs added to the project along with details like file type, who added the file, and the number of screenshots and tasks. Clicking on any of the files or links takes you to the review session to share feedback and create associated tasks. Collaborators Shows a list of team members with access to the project. If permitted by your account settings, you can add additional reviewers using the ‚ÄúAdd Collaborators‚Äù function. Phases Add different project life cycle milestones or stages, along with their current status and expected deadlines. Use these phases to mark checkpoints or track iterations during the development lifecycle of your project plan. Activity Feed Shows a running history of actions taken, including who performed them and what modifications were made. Settings Displays project properties, allowing you to edit settings depending on your account type. Next Steps Now that you are familiar with the functionalities of the project dashboard, you‚Äôre ready to create and manage tasks effectively. Head over to our next guide to learn how to create your very first task! Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Parts Of A Zipboard Project
Article Content: Parts of a zipBoard project - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Parts of a zipBoard project Activity Feed The ‚ÄúActivity‚Äù section is a running history of all modifications made to the project. The application captures the following information: Date of change Who made the change A brief description of the change Uploads The ‚ÄúUploads‚Äù section contains all the assets and resources attached to the project. Accessing this section also gives you the option to select a file or link for review. In this section, you can Add a new file/link to the project. Filter through files and links based on their type and phase. Search for project resources across all files based on the file name. Access file/link properties to open, delete or share a particular file or link. Opening any file takes you to the Review Panel ; which shows the following information and options: The file name/link is shown at the top of the Review panel (#1). Edit, delete and download options are available at the top right corner of the review panel (#2). The file/link content is launched when you click the ‚ÄòReview‚Äô button (#3). The date and person who added the file or link is displayed in the lower-left corner of the Review panel (#4). The 'Share' button enables you to generate a custom link that can be shared with others to get feedback from external reviewers (#5). As the project life cycle progresses and issues are reported, there could be numerous screen captures as issues are identified. The bottom table of the Review panel keeps a running tab for the number of screens captured, and the number of tasks and comments added (#6). Tasks All bugs, issues, feature requests, enhancements, or communication that needs to be tracked can be added as a comment in projects. Tasks can be associated with either a file or just the overall project. Tasks can be created by all collaborators on a project. They can be used as implementation reminders, emphasize a process to be followed, or document style or format requirements from the client style guide. Selecting Tasks from the project menu bar displays the project task manager where you can: View and access all the tasks added to the project. Filter the tasks table according to phases, files, reporter, assignee, priority, status, type or screen resolution. Sort the tasks table either according to the creation/update date or in an alphabetical manner. By default, the last created task appears at the top of the task manager. Search a task by entering task title, keywords or any of the other task properties. Add a new generic task to the project. External Feedback The comment is a part of project communication that does not need to be tracked as tasks. They are accessible by clicking on the ‚ÄòExternal Feedback‚Äô tab in the menu bar on the left. Comments are especially useful for collecting reviews and comments from external reviewers and collaborators. All comments gathered from the custom share link is displayed in the ‚ÄòComment‚Äô section.¬†This Comments can always be converted to tasks if needed. However, it cannot be converted back to comment. Selecting to add a comment opens a basic dialog panel similar to a Task modal. The information added to the text field, however, is the full content of the comment. Unlike tasks, comments do not have a title field. can also tag someone using the @name format. Anyone related to the project can view and respond to feedback. Running communication within comments can be easily followed as well. As replies are entered, the comment summary shows that there is an ongoing thread. Phases Project progression across different stages or milestones can be identified by defining different phases in your project. Selecting the Phase option from the project menu bar enables you to set up such a phase for your project. To set up project phases, follow these steps: 1. Open the project. 2. Select the ‚ÄòPhases‚Äô option from the project menu that appears on the left. 3. Click on the ‚ÄòAdd Phase‚Äô button. Enter the phase name, description, status, and estimated completion date. Click on the ‚ÄòAdd‚Äô button. Once you have set up a phase, you can directly add files, tasks, and comments to it. You can also assign existing files and tasks to a phase by modifying their properties. However, you cannot assign existing comments to a phase. Captures All screenshots taken when reviewing a file can be seen in the ‚ÄòImages/videos‚Äô section. Each screen card displays a thumbnail image, along with a limited set of property values displayed on the bottom of each card. The property values include the date the screen was captured, who captured it, and the title for the screen. You can search through the screens based on the 'on-screen' title and even can filter them based on who captured the screen and for which file the screen was captured. To quickly review bugs or issues, selecting the ‚ÄúScreens‚Äù option allows you to quickly view the slide or section where issues have been noted. Selecting the thumbnail displays the capture and any associated pointers/annotations. Selecting a pointer immediately directs you to the bug or enhancement request. Settings Selecting the settings option from the project menu bar opens an edit setting modal. As a project owner, you can update general project settings at any time during the project life cycle. You can modify the Project ID, Title, and Description, as desired. Select Save to retain any changes; select Cancel to retain existing content. Integrations If you wish to integrate your zipBoard project with your team‚Äôs Slack or JIRA account you can do that right from the edit project settings modal. JIRA Integration With¬†JIRA integration, all the tasks that you add to your zipBoard project are automatically reflected in your mapped(selected) JIRA project. zipBoard tasks appear in JIRA. Click on the JIRA icon at the bottom of the project settings modal, to proceed with JIRA integration. Once Jira integration is done, mapping can be done by clicking on the Jira icon. now you need to map the zipBoard project to one of your JIRA projects to continue. A step-by-step guide for this can be found here . Slack Integration The Slack integration allows all team members to view on-going project activity on a Slack channel, which makes tracking things easy. The Slack communication too is a one-way function from zipBoard to Slack, which means that issues and communication from zipBoard will appear in Slack but not the other way round. On the project properties panel, scroll to the bottom of the panel and select the Add to Slack option. The Slack integration properties panel will be displayed. On the Slack properties panel, select the appropriate channel as the ‚ÄúPost to‚Äù location. Select ‚ÄòSave‚Äô changes. zipBoard will establish a connection with Slack. Setting the integration for a particular project does not impact the integration with other zipBoard projects and Slack. You can see a step-by-step guide here . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Cleaned Article Content: Parts of a zipBoard project - zipBoard Help Parts of a zipBoard project Activity Feed The ‚ÄúActivity‚Äù section is a running history of all modifications made to the project. The application captures the following information: Date of change Who made the change A brief description of the change Uploads The ‚ÄúUploads‚Äù section contains all the assets and resources attached to the project. Accessing this section also gives you the option to select a file or link for review. In this section, you can Add a new file/link to the project. Filter through files and links based on their type and phase. Search for project resources across all files based on the file name. Access file/link properties to open, delete or share a particular file or link. Opening any file takes you to the Review Panel ; which shows the following information and options: The file name/link is shown at the top of the Review panel (#1). Edit, delete and download options are available at the top right corner of the review panel (#2). The file/link content is launched when you click the ‚ÄòReview‚Äô button (#3). The date and person who added the file or link is displayed in the lower-left corner of the Review panel (#4). The 'Share' button enables you to generate a custom link that can be shared with others to get feedback from external reviewers (#5). As the project life cycle progresses and issues are reported, there could be numerous screen captures as issues are identified. The bottom table of the Review panel keeps a running tab for the number of screens captured, and the number of tasks and comments added (#6). Tasks All bugs, issues, feature requests, enhancements, or communication that needs to be tracked can be added as a comment in projects. Tasks can be associated with either a file or just the overall project. Tasks can be created by all collaborators on a project. They can be used as implementation reminders, emphasize a process to be followed, or document style or format requirements from the client style guide. Selecting Tasks from the project menu bar displays the project task manager where you can: View and access all the tasks added to the project. Filter the tasks table according to phases, files, reporter, assignee, priority, status, type or screen resolution. Sort the tasks table either according to the creation/update date or in an alphabetical manner. By default, the last created task appears at the top of the task manager. Search a task by entering task title, keywords or any of the other task properties. Add a new generic task to the project. External Feedback The comment is a part of project communication that does not need to be tracked as tasks. They are accessible by clicking on the ‚ÄòExternal Feedback‚Äô tab in the menu bar on the left. Comments are especially useful for collecting reviews and comments from external reviewers and collaborators. All comments gathered from the custom share link is displayed in the ‚ÄòComment‚Äô section.¬†This Comments can always be converted to tasks if needed. However, it cannot be converted back to comment. Selecting to add a comment opens a basic dialog panel similar to a Task modal. The information added to the text field, however, is the full content of the comment. Unlike tasks, comments do not have a title field. can also tag someone using the @name format. Anyone related to the project can view and respond to feedback. Running communication within comments can be easily followed as well. As replies are entered, the comment summary shows that there is an ongoing thread. Phases Project progression across different stages or milestones can be identified by defining different phases in your project. Selecting the Phase option from the project menu bar enables you to set up such a phase for your project. To set up project phases, follow these steps: 1. Open the project. 2. Select the ‚ÄòPhases‚Äô option from the project menu that appears on the left. 3. Click on the ‚ÄòAdd Phase‚Äô button. Enter the phase name, description, status, and estimated completion date. Click on the ‚ÄòAdd‚Äô button. Once you have set up a phase, you can directly add files, tasks, and comments to it. You can also assign existing files and tasks to a phase by modifying their properties. However, you cannot assign existing comments to a phase. Captures All screenshots taken when reviewing a file can be seen in the ‚ÄòImages/videos‚Äô section. Each screen card displays a thumbnail image, along with a limited set of property values displayed on the bottom of each card. The property values include the date the screen was captured, who captured it, and the title for the screen. You can search through the screens based on the 'on-screen' title and even can filter them based on who captured the screen and for which file the screen was captured. To quickly review bugs or issues, selecting the ‚ÄúScreens‚Äù option allows you to quickly view the slide or section where issues have been noted. Selecting the thumbnail displays the capture and any associated pointers/annotations. Selecting a pointer immediately directs you to the bug or enhancement request. Settings Selecting the settings option from the project menu bar opens an edit setting modal. As a project owner, you can update general project settings at any time during the project life cycle. You can modify the Project ID, Title, and Description, as desired. Select Save to retain any changes; select Cancel to retain existing content. Integrations If you wish to integrate your zipBoard project with your team‚Äôs Slack or JIRA account you can do that right from the edit project settings modal. JIRA Integration With¬†JIRA integration, all the tasks that you add to your zipBoard project are automatically reflected in your mapped(selected) JIRA project. zipBoard tasks appear in JIRA. Click on the JIRA icon at the bottom of the project settings modal, to proceed with JIRA integration. Once Jira integration is done, mapping can be done by clicking on the Jira icon. now you need to map the zipBoard project to one of your JIRA projects to continue. A step-by-step guide for this can be found here . Slack Integration The Slack integration allows all team members to view on-going project activity on a Slack channel, which makes tracking things easy. The Slack communication too is a one-way function from zipBoard to Slack, which means that issues and communication from zipBoard will appear in Slack but not the other way round. On the project properties panel, scroll to the bottom of the panel and select the Add to Slack option. The Slack integration properties panel will be displayed. On the Slack properties panel, select the appropriate channel as the ‚ÄúPost to‚Äù location. Select ‚ÄòSave‚Äô changes. zipBoard will establish a connection with Slack. Setting the integration for a particular project does not impact the integration with other zipBoard projects and Slack. You can see a step-by-step guide here . Did this answer your question? Name: Create And Modify A Task
Article Content: How to Create or Modify a Task? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Create or Modify a Task? Tasks allow project-specific actions or requirements to be identified and accountable. For any task on a project, you can assign it a "Type" value to indicate a general task, bug, enhancement, or feature. There are various ways of adding a task to your zipBoard project. Adding a task from the task manager Follow these steps to create a task in your zipBoard project from the task manager: Log in to the zipBoard application. Select the project for which the task needs to be added. 3. Click on the Task tile from the left menu bar. 4. To add a new task, click on the ‚ÄòAdd Task‚Äô button. 5. Once you have entered the information for your task, click on ‚ÄòAdd‚Äô. 6. The task properties panel will be displayed; here you can add/update the following information: Field What to enter Add Description You can elaborate on the action that needs to be taken. Click on the tick button once you have added all the information to store it. Add Comments You can add additional pointers for your team to make things clear and understandable. Follow up discussions and communication regarding the task can be carried out in the comments. Type You can select the type of task to create - a general Task, or a specific Bug, Enhancement, or Feature. Priority Set the appropriate priority level for the reported task: Low, Medium, High, or Critical Status Here you can¬†select/update the appropriate status for the task: Open Open - Client Input In Progress In Progress ‚Äì Defer Resolved Closed Closed ‚Äì Won‚Äôt Fix Closed ‚Äì Duplicate Re-open Phase Select the relevant project stage or milestone to register the issue or task Watchers Any team members that need to get automatic updates on the task can be added as watchers. Tags You can set up keywords or labels to index and organize tasks by adding tags to them. Attach Files You can attach files and documents related to a task by uploading them. These can be images, word documents, ZIP files etc. Attachments on a task can provide additional information to clarify actions for team members tracking the task of resolving it. These can be a sample reference image, a spec doc etc. Other systems important information like the reporter, creation date last updated date, browser and OS info are also available on the task properties panel for reviewer‚Äôs reference. 7. After ensuring the description and other information has been added correctly, you may select to close the task panel by selecting the X in the upper right corner. Adding a task during review You can also create a task on a particular file during the review. Follow these steps to create a task in your zipBoard project on a specific file: 1. Log in to the zipBoard application. 2.¬†Select the project¬†for which the task needs to be added. 3. Click on the Uploads from the left menu bar. 4. Click on a 'Review' of the file Select an annotation tool (Comment, Pencil, Arrow, or Rectangle) and click on the desired area to highlight a¬†specific issue in the screenshot and¬†add your task. You can now edit task properties in the same way as mentioned in 'Adding a Task from Task Manager.' Modify an existing task 1. Access the project from the zipBoard dashboard. 2. Access the ‚ÄúTasks‚Äù option from the project menu bar. 3. Click on the task you want to modify from the task manager. 4. Modify the properties of the selected task as required. Learn how to convert comments to tasks in our next guide ! Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Converting Comments To Tasks
Article Content: Converting Feedback to Tasks - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Converting Feedback to Tasks Comments can be converted from a Comment to a task by selecting the 'Add as Task' on the right-hand side of the comment/feedback in the Comments dashboard. Once selected, a dialog is displayed informing you that the Feedback can be converted to a task,¬†but once converted it cannot be undone. Select Yes if you agree to this conversion. Once the Feedback has been converted to a task, you can add the task description, type, priority and can assign to it to the concerned collaborator. Did this answer your question? Name: Can My Clients Be External Collaborators For My Zipboard Project
Article Content: Can my clients be external collaborators for my zipBoard project? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can my clients be external collaborators for my zipBoard project? Yes, you can share your project files with your clients by simply sharing a link.¬†With the shared link, your clients can review your work and can share their feedback. Your clients would not have any access to the activity of your internal team but still, you can keep them posted for all important updates and can ask for their reviews at any phase of the project lifecycle with the share link. To know the stepwise process and different share options visit here . If you just wish your client to have access to the feedback and permission to approve or reject it. Then you can add your clients as 'Client' to the zipBoard¬†project. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: How To Use Zipboard For Beta Testing
Article Content: zipBoard for Beta testing - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact zipBoard for Beta testing zipBoard is great for testing out products during the beta phase in a software development cycle. The aim of the beta phase is to let a small group of the target audience sample the product and collect feedback from their reviews. When the Beta version of your product is ready, then you can easily collate feedback from your beta users using zipBoard. zipBoard environments let you generate a sharable link that you can share with all your Beta users over any communication media of your choice. With this link, users can not only view the BETA file/URL but can also add their feedback, for which they don‚Äôt even need to login to zipBoard. To start Beta testing with zipBoard, follow the steps below : Create a new project You can set up your file/URL for beta testing in a fresh project in zipBoard. Login to zipBoard and click the ‚ÄòCreate New Project‚Äô card on the dashboard. When setting up the project, enter a name for the project. You can choose to edit the default project ID and description. Click the ‚ÄòSave‚Äô button to create the project. NOTE: If you have an existing project in zipBoard for your ongoing work, you can skip creating a new project and can directly proceed to step 2.] 2. Add the Beta version URL/file to the zipBoard project. Select the appropriate zipBoard project. From the project dashboard, select Add Files and URLs option. From the options to choose file type, select URL/the appropriate file type. Add the Beta URL/ file along with other details as required. Click ADD button to proceed. 3. Generate the shareable link. Click the options icon corresponding to the URL/file which needs to be reviewed by the Beta users. Select the ‚ÄòShare File‚Äô option from the dropdown. From the share file modal, allow for ‚ÄòCollaborators/Guest Review‚Äô. NOTE: This link enables the users to view the shared URL, click screenshots wherever required and add annotations and comments to specify an issue they are facing. You need not allow for ‚ÄòRequire Signup/Login‚Äô as this would impose the users with the link with the restriction to log in to the system, in order to review the file. For Beta testing, it‚Äôs not recommended. 4. Share the link You can share the generated link via any medium either mail, Slack, Skype‚Ä¶ with the beta users. You can copy the obtained link and can share it using any media of your choice or simply email the beta users directly using the interface. For that just add the email ID and your message(If required) and click send. 5. View and analyze the feedback Open the project and select ‚ÄòComments‚Äô from the project menu bar on the left. Review all incoming Feedback Go through all the comments one by one and decide on further action for each one of them. Make the actionable items as tasks Click on the 'Add as task ' corresponding to the comment you need to make a task 2. Click ‚ÄòYes‚Äô to convert. 3. Add a description, set task type, priority, and assign it to the concerned team member. Reply to questions and remarks Select the comment you need to reply for and add the reply text on the comment modal. Click the ‚ÄòReply‚Äô button. Track/View/Update the Task status Select the ‚ÄòTasks‚Äô option from the project menu bar on the left. Select the Task and choose the action to either edit, view or delete the task. Note:¬†Delete option is available only if you have created the task or you happen to be the project owner Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: How To Share A File In Zipboard
Article Content: How to Get Feedback from Guests in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Get Feedback from Guests in zipBoard? Collecting feedback from guests and external reviewers in zipBoard is quick and effortless. You can share a file using a link and control permissions to ensure the right level of access. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Generating a Shareable Link for Guests To allow guests to review and provide feedback on a file: Open the file you want to share in zipBoard. Click the "Share File" button on the review page . In the "Share Review with Guest" modal, configure the permissions based on what level of access you want to grant. Copy the generated share link and send it to your guest reviewers. üìå Guests do not need a zipBoard account to provide feedback, making collaboration seamless! 2Ô∏è‚É£ Setting Permissions for Guest Feedback When sharing a file, you can control guest permissions to tailor access: ‚úî View Only ‚Äì Guests can only see the file but cannot add feedback . ‚úî Commenting Enabled ‚Äì Guests can add comments but not annotations . ‚úî Full Feedback Access ‚Äì Guests can add comments, annotations, and mark changes . ‚úÖ Choose the appropriate permissions before sharing to ensure security and controlled access. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Reviewing Guest Feedback Once a guest reviews the file, their comments and annotations will appear in the project review board. üîπ You can: ‚úî Reply to their comments in real-time. ‚úî Resolve or take action on feedback. ‚úî Manage permissions if you need to revoke or change access. üìå Need to track all shared links? Learn how to Manage Share Links . Next Steps üöÄ Want to learn more? Check out these related articles below ‚¨áÔ∏è üîπ Try zipBoard Today! Ready to streamline your client collaboration? Name: How To Track And Prioritise The Feddback From Guest In Zipboard
Article Content: How to Track and Prioritise the Feedback from Guest in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Track and Prioritise the Feedback from Guest in zipBoard? The feedback shared by the guests will appear as 'Feedback' in zipBoard. To access these feedback comments open the project and Select ‚ÄòFeedback‚Äô from the project menu bar on the left. Here you can review¬†all incoming feedback comments. You can go through all the feedback comments one by one and decide on further action for each one of them. Take the actionable items as tasks Click "Add Tasks" button Click "Yes" to convert. Add the description, set task type, priority and assign it to the concerned team member. Reply to questions and remarks Select the feedback comment you need to reply for and add the reply text on the feedback comment modal. Click the "Reply" button. Track/View/Update the Task status Select the "Task List" option from the project menu bar on the left. Select the Task and choose the action to either edit, view or delete the task. Note:¬†Delete option is available only if you have created the task or you happen to be the project owner Did this answer your question? Name: How Are Guest Collaborators Different From Guest Reviewers
Article Content: How are Guest Collaborators different from Guest Reviewers? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How are Guest Collaborators different from Guest Reviewers? Let's differentiate the two! Guest Collaborators Guest Reviewers Guest Collaborators: Anyone who collaborates on your zipBoard project using the login required¬†share link is referred to as a guest collaborator. Guest collaborators when invited to collaborate, need to signup and then they can review the file they are invited to collaborate on. Collaborators within zipBoard are individuals invited directly through the platform using the ‚Äúadd collaborator‚Äù button. They have full access to the project and its assets, allowing them to contribute feedback, comments, and annotations throughout the review process. In contrast, guest collaborators have a more limited role. They can only review an asset once a shared link has been granted to them. Unlike collaborators, guest collaborators do not have access to the project interface and cannot interact directly within zipBoard. Instead, they are directed to the specific file being reviewed via the shared link. This ensures that guest collaborators can provide feedback on the relevant content without accessing the broader project environment. Workflow for Guest Collaborators Receive a Link from the Project Manager The external reviewer will receive a shared link from the project manager. Their access and permissions will depend on the settings configured for the shared link. üîó View Share Link Settings Sign In or Sign Up to zipBoard ‚Ä¢ If they already have a zipBoard account, they can sign in directly. ‚Ä¢ If they don‚Äôt have an account, they‚Äôll need to sign up to access the project. üîó How to Sign Up for zipBoard Start Reviewing the Content Once logged in, reviewers can begin reviewing the shared content by adding comments or annotations. üîó How to Add and Review Content Share Feedback with the Internal Team All feedback added by external reviewers will be automatically visible to the internal team for further action. Guest Reviewers : Anyone who reviews your zipBoard project using the no login required¬†share link is referred to as a guest¬†reviewer. Guest reviewers when invited to review, doesn't need to signup to zipBoard . They can directly review the files they are invited to review. Importantly, guest reviewers do not have access to the project as a whole; rather, they are limited to accessing and providing feedback on the specific file being reviewed. Workflow for Guest Reviewers Watch More Tutorials on How Guest Reviewers Can Review Files in zipBoard: üîó How to Review a PDF üîó How to Review a URL/Web Page üîó How to Review a Video üîó How to Review a ZIP File Access the Shared Link External reviewers will receive a shared link from the project manager. The content and permissions they see will depend on the settings of the shared link. üîó Learn about Share Link Settings Start the Review Process Once they access the file, reviewers can begin adding comments, annotations, or markups directly on the content. üîó How to Add and Review Content Feedback is Shared with the Internal Team All feedback submitted by external reviewers will automatically be visible to the internal team for action and follow-up. Need More Help? Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Or start your 14-day Free Trial! Name: Do I Have A Keyboard Shortcut To Click Screens In Zipboard
Article Content: Do I have a keyboard shortcut to click screens in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Do I have a keyboard shortcut to click screens in zipBoard? To¬†take¬†a quick¬†screenshot while reviewing,¬†use¬†the¬†keyboard shortcut For Windows(Web URL file Type) 1. Cntrl+Shift + 1. For visible page screenshot 2. Cntrl+shift+2: For Full page screenshot. For Mac 1. Command+Shift + 1. For visible page screenshot 2. Command+shift+2: For Full page screenshot. For other File types, you can use Ctrl+shift+1/Command+Shift+1 for taking a screenshot This will snap your currently active review mode screen and add it as a screenshot to the screens list. Now you can annotate it share feedback. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Email Alerts Zipboard
Article Content: Email Alerts for Tasks in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Email Alerts for Tasks in zipBoard By default, every user's account is set up to receive email notifications for every task that they have been assigned to, or for any updates in the tasks created by them. You also get notified in email, if you have been set as a watcher for the particular task . For owners or managers, an email notification is also sent every time a new task or feedback is created in their project. For any user to change the frequency of emails, they can simply go to their profile and chose between Instant, daily, weekly or monthly updates from their projects in zipBoard. Name: Why Should I Go For An Enterprise Plan
Article Content: Why Should I go for an Enterprise Plan? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Why Should I go for an Enterprise Plan? Enterprise plan will allow you to customise zipBoard very specifically to your needs. You can check out the features of the Enterprise plan here . Apart from getting all the features that we offer in Business Plan or Team plan, you will also get: 1. Custom branding and URL 2. Custom tags 3. Custom Integrations 4. Archiving projects 5. Manage user roles 6. Track storage space utilisation Learn how Enterprise plan can help your organisation with improved workflow with our visual review and bug tracking solution. If you on the fence, no worries, you can talk to us and we will gladly help you out. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: How Can I Manage User Roles Better With Enterprise Accounts
Article Content: How can I manage user roles better with enterprise accounts? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How can I manage user roles better with enterprise accounts? zipBoard Enterprise lets teams create advanced roles to separate internal and external functions. An organization, project, or a specific link can have 5 primary roles: Org Admin/Super Admin : The org admin is the overall owner of the org responsible for adding other users in the org, creating tags, has visibility and control over the entire organization, customization, and project reports, and all projects. Admin : Admin will have the same permissions as super admin, Except billing and manage org members Managers : Managers are independent project managers who can create and manage their own projects, add collaborators to the projects, customize their projects, add integrations, and view reports. Collaborator/Member : Collaborators are your internal team members, who are participants in your projects, they can upload content, can be assigned tasks, review feedback and manage and organize tasks. Collaborators can be invited for individual projects. Clients : Clients are only available for enterprise accounts. Clients are external stakeholders responsible for reviewing and approving content and comments from guest reviewers. They can also send and receive messages from the project team and they can approve feedback from guest reviewers to convert feedback into tasks. Guest reviewers : These are external stakeholders or guest reviewers responsible for reviewing content. Guest reviewers have access to only the links that are explicitly shared with them. That access can be invoked by deleting a link at any point of time. Guest links can also be configured at individual versions and with different access levels ( view only, view and comment, view all reviews and comments). Once feedback is received by internal team members or clients, that feedback can be converted into tasks by either clients or the internal team. With an enterprise plan, you can add managers to your organization. Managers can create and/or delete new projects within your organization. Thus you can add up a level of hierarchy with enterprise accounts. Moreover, you can switch roles of any of you organization member with just a single click. Did this answer your question? Name: How Can Tags Be Managed Better With Enterprise Account
Article Content: How Can Tags be Managed Better with Enterprise Account? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Can Tags be Managed Better with Enterprise Account? With an enterprise account, owners have an extra level of control while defining organization tags. They can choose if they wish only the tags created by them to be used across the organization. Otherwise, all the org members would have the permission to add new tags. The choice can be made using the toggle switch available on the Manage org page. You can access manage org page using the dropdown adjacent to your profile image on explorer screen. Did this answer your question? Name: What Options Does The Custom Pricing Plan Offers
Article Content: What Options Does the Custom Pricing Plan Offers? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What Options Does the Custom Pricing Plan Offers? You can opt for either enterprise plan or private cloud. Both of them enjoy the same benefits other than the hosting. For enterprise plan, your zipBoard account will be hosted on a public zipBoard service instance whereas, for private cloud customers, their zipBoard account will be hosted on a separate instance which would be private to them only. If you need to know any further details you can reach out to us at support@zipboard.co . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Im Unable To Delete The Annotations How Can I Do That
Article Content: I'm unable to delete the annotations. How can I do that? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I'm unable to delete the annotations. How can I do that? You can delete an annotation only if have created it. You cannot delete anyone else's annotations. To delete the annotation first select the eraser icon from the toolbar and next hover the cursor over the annotation. When you see the hand icon, click to delete. An alert popup will appear. Click yes to confirm the deletion. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: How Can I Get My Web Hosted Content Reviewed With Zipboard
Article Content: How can I get my web hosted content reviewed with zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How can I get my web hosted content reviewed with zipBoard? For new updates, visit here . Any of your web-hosted resource, be it your website or some assets uploaded on your Drive or Dropbox¬†you can get feedback on it easily with zipBoard. To get the web content reviewed, 1. Navigate to the desired project. 2.¬†Click the 'files and urls' tab on the left-hand side menu. 3. Click the ADD link. 4. Choose the URL option and add the required details. 5. Click 'Add' to proceed. 6. Now you have two options: a. You can click the 'Start Review' button to browse the content on the review board . The content¬†is available to all¬†your¬†project¬†collaborators. They¬†can¬†start a review session anytime to¬†share¬†their feedback. b. You can also share the content with the external¬†audience. Clicking the share button you get a shareable¬†link with chosen¬†permissions . You can share this link with anyone using any social media.¬†Anyone with this link would be able to browse and review the URL content. Did this answer your question? Name: How To Upload And Review Scorm Valid HTML Content With Zipboard
Article Content: How to Upload and Review SCORM or Valid HTML Content with zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Upload and Review SCORM or Valid HTML Content with zipBoard? You can upload any Valid HTML/SCORM content to zipBoard. To upload and review content follow the steps below. Navigate to the desired project. Click the tile with the "add content". Choose the ZIP file option and add the required details. Before uploading the zip file please ensure that the start file (index.html) is at root level in the folder hierarchy.¬†If start file is not at the root level then please¬†add it at the root level and zip the package again and then proceed to upload the zip file. Click "Add" to proceed. In most cases, the next view shows "Start Review" option. But sometimes when zipBoard might not be able to locate the start file; it might ask to 'add start file'. If you have uploaded a wrong file by mistake then you choose to upload the zip file again. In case you need to add the start file manually, please verify that the added start file is at root level. After successful¬†addition of start file, it shows you the "Start Review" screen. Clicking the"Start Review" button you can browse the content on the review board . The content¬†is available to all¬†your¬†project¬†collaborators. They¬†can¬†start a review session anytime to¬†share¬†their feedback. On "Start Review" screen you have another option called 'Share'.¬†Clicking the share button you get a shareable¬†link with chosen¬†permissions . You can share this link with anyone using any social media. Anyone with this link would be able to browse and review the zip file you uploaded. Cleaned Article Content: How to Upload and Review SCORM or Valid HTML Content with zipBoard? - zipBoard Help How to Upload and Review SCORM or Valid HTML Content with zipBoard? You can upload any Valid HTML/SCORM content to zipBoard. To upload and review content follow the steps below. Navigate to the desired project. Click the tile with the "add content". Choose the ZIP file option and add the required details. Before uploading the zip file please ensure that the start file (index.html) is at root level in the folder hierarchy.¬†If start file is not at the root level then please¬†add it at the root level and zip the package again and then proceed to upload the zip file. Click "Add" to proceed. In most cases, the next view shows "Start Review" option. But sometimes when zipBoard might not be able to locate the start file; it might ask to 'add start file'. If you have uploaded a wrong file by mistake then you choose to upload the zip file again. In case you need to add the start file manually, please verify that the added start file is at root level. After successful¬†addition of start file, it shows you the "Start Review" screen. Clicking the"Start Review" button you can browse the content on the review board . The content¬†is available to all¬†your¬†project¬†collaborators. They¬†can¬†start a review session anytime to¬†share¬†their feedback. On "Start Review" screen you have another option called 'Share'.¬†Clicking the share button you get a shareable¬†link with chosen¬†permissions . You can share this link with anyone using any social media. Anyone with this link would be able to browse and review the zip file you uploaded. Next... ‚úÖ If your file asked for a start file, please go here [ How to Add a Start File? ] ‚úÖ Best Practices for Creating SCORM Courses / HTML that Work in zipBoard ‚úÖ Review All Types of Content in One Place ‚úÖ How to Share your Files? Name: How To Upload And Review Image Files With Zipboard
Article Content: How to Upload and Review Image Files with zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Upload and Review Image Files with zipBoard? Easily enhance your collaboration process by uploading image files to your zipBoard projects. Whether you're working on web design, graphics, or any visual project, zipBoard allows you to effortlessly share your ideas and gather valuable feedback. Supported image formats include JPEG and PNG. Start utilizing the power of visual communication to refine and elevate your projects with zipBoard! 1. Navigate to the desired project. 2.¬†Click the files and urls tab on the left-hand side menu. 3. Click the ADD link. 4. Choose the images option and add the required details. If you wish to upload multiple images then simply select all files(pressing ctrl key) while uploading. All your images would be uploaded to zipBoard. 5. Click 'Add' to proceed. 6. Now you have two options: a. You can click 'Start Review' button to review the images on the review board . All the images uploaded by you are available as different screens. You can view them on the screens panel on the right-hand side on reviewboard. Uploaded images are available to all¬†your¬†project¬†collaborators. They¬†can¬†start a review session anytime to¬†share¬†their feedback. b. You can also share the images with the external¬†audience. Clicking the share button you get a shareable¬†link with chosen¬†permissions . You can share this link with anyone using any social media.¬†Anyone with this link would be able to browse and review the images. Did this answer your question? Name: How To Upload And Review Video Files With Zipboard
Article Content: How to Upload and Review Videos - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Upload and Review Videos Hey there! You'll be glad to know that zipBoard projects now support the upload of mp4 video files. This feature allows you to easily share and gather feedback on your video content. To make the most of this functionality, follow these simple steps: 1. Navigate to the desired project. 2.¬†Click on Uploads in the¬†project dashboard. 3. Click on the ADD link--> select video to upload MP4 videos. 4. Choose the file that you want to upload and give it a Name and Description. 5. As soon as the file is uploaded, it will be visible in the¬†Uploads tab. Click on Review from the popup or you can review it from the uploads tab. 6. In this particular screenshot, the red arrows at the bottom¬†edge¬†display the¬†play/pause¬†button, and the duration of the video file. You can check out the annotation tools guide for more information on the toolbar present at the top. 7. To start adding comments, select your tool of choice from the toolbar. 8. Now you can click anywhere on the video and start adding annotations! Anyone who is part of the zipBoard project, can open the file for review and can add comments and annotations and view others' annotations. You can also share the content with the external¬†audience. Clicking the share button, you get a shareable¬†link with chosen¬†permissions . You can share this link with anyone using any social media or email platform.¬†Anyone with this link would be able to browse and review the video content. You can also check out this article on getting feedback on videos for additional details. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: How Can I Work On Diffrent Versions Of My Files With Zipboard
Article Content: How can I Work on Different Versions of my files with zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How can I Work on Different Versions of my files with zipBoard? üìåAs of August 2024, we've made some updates. Please refer to this link instead . Maintaining file versions is quite easy with zipBoard. The step by step process to effectively manage multiple versions is as follows: Login to your zipBoard account and navigate to the desired project. On the project home screen, navigate to "add content". Add the version file. You can add the version name and details while adding the file. You also have the option to tie your version files to the relevant project phase . 5. Click 'Add' to proceed. Now your version file is ready for review. You can add as many version files to your project and can track and analyze their corresponding activity individually. Also, you have the ability to work on two or more different versions simultaneously. This eases A/B testing and Beta testing . Did this answer your question? Name: What Is The Add Client Button For
Article Content: What is the "Add Client" button for? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is the "Add Client" button for? Managing feedback effectively is essential to ensuring a clutter-free project cycle. At zipBoard, we recognize that while clients don‚Äôt need to know the nitty-gritty of your internal workflows, they must be seamlessly integrated into the review and approval process when required. To simplify this collaboration, zipBoard provides two distinct user roles: Collaborators and Clients . Collaborators : Internal team members who manage the project's workflows, comments, and activities. Clients : External stakeholders who can access and approve feedback while remaining focused on project deliverables without visibility into internal discussions. Why Do We Have This Feature? Privacy for Internal Teams : Keep internal activities and comments confidential while allowing clients to participate where needed. Streamlined Feedback Process : Clients can review, approve, and convert feedback into actionable, trackable tasks, ensuring smoother collaboration. Clear Roles, No Confusion : By distinguishing between internal and external contributors, everyone stays in sync without compromising team privacy or efficiency. How to Add Clients to Your zipBoard Project Log in to your zipBoard account and navigate to the desired project. On the project home screen, go to the Collaborators tab in the left menu. Click the 'Add Client' button. Enter the email address of your client and an optional invitation message . Click the 'Invite' button to send the invitation. Your client will receive an email invitation. Once they accept the invite and log in to zipBoard, they can access the project and provide their feedback. Benefits of Using zipBoard by Industry AEC (Architecture, Engineering, Construction) Collaborate with architects, engineers, contractors, and clients in one platform. Simplify the review of construction documents and blueprints with visual annotations. Ensure timely approvals to keep projects on schedule. eLearning and Educational Content Streamline course content reviews with clear, visual feedback. Collaborate with instructional designers, SMEs, and clients in real-time. Track changes efficiently to ensure the quality and accuracy of learning materials. Marketing and Design Agencies Simplify creative reviews with clients and stakeholders using a centralized platform. Reduce back-and-forth emails with task tracking and visual annotations. Deliver campaigns faster with a clear approval process. What‚Äôs Next? Explore zipBoard today and see how it transforms your project management and feedback processes. üí° Start with a 14-day free trial to experience the full power of zipBoard, no credit card required. Or, book a live demo with our team to see how zipBoard fits your needs. üëâ READ: How do I Share Files with a Client? How do I Work with Clients in zipBoard? Reviewing client feedback and adding them to development workflow This feature is available exclusively with the Enterprise Plan . If you're interested in unlocking this functionality, please contact our support team to learn more or upgrade your plan at support@zipboard.co. Did this answer your question? Name: How Can I Record A Screen For Review Using Zipboard
Article Content: How can I record a screen for review using ZipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How can I record a screen for review using ZipBoard? üìå For new updates, please read How to use the Video Recording Tool in zipBoard? While zipBoard supports most of the browsers , video recording is only supported in Chrome. Make sure you have our zBreviewBoard chrome extension. If not, you can download it here . Follow these few easy steps to record a screen for Review using our zipBoard Plugin. Select your Project and go to the File and URLs section. Select the file or link for which you would like to record the screen by clicking on the Review button. Scroll to the screen you want to record and toggle to Review . Select the video camera icon from the review toolbar If you want to record your webcam and/or microphone audio, toggle on. Select Start Recording . From the pop-up, choose if you'd like to share your Entire Screen or just the Window . If you have two screens, select which screen you'd like to record. If you have multiple windows open, select the window you'd like to record. Once you've made your selection, select Share to start recording. When you want to stop recording, select Stop Sharing . A pop-up will appear with a list of your captured screens on the left, markup tools on the top of the screen and a list of tasks related to the screen on the right side of the screen. Once you are done marking up the recording, exit the screen to continue your review. If you want any help on how to review and annotate the recordings, be sure to check this out! Name: How To Upload Images Mocks To Zipboard And Get Live Feedback From People
Article Content: How to upload images/mocks to zipBoard and get live feedback from people? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to upload images/mocks to zipBoard and get live feedback from people? üìå For new updates, please read Complete Workflow for all zipBoard Users Uploading and getting feedback using zipBoard is very easy once you follow these few simple steps(or watch this video tutorial)! Go to the Files and URLs section using the side panel 2. Now, in order to upload an image/mock/file/link, you have to click on the¬†‚ÄòADD‚Äô¬†button. Select the type of file that you wish to review. For this tutorial, we would be using a Website. 3. Give a name and description to your website and add URL and click 'ADD' 4. Voila! Your website has successfully been added! Now in order to share it with your client, collaborator or user, click on the ‚ÄòShare‚Äô button. 5.¬†Here you have the option to create custom share links for people to review. You can require them to signup and login to review, let them view all the boards/reviews, or add new boards/reviews. 6. For our scenario, we want to get the feedback from the user without any need to signup/login, so we give them permission to add new boards/reviews. This generates a share link¬†which we will be copying and sending it to our users. 7. Please note that you can also use the send by email feature to send the links to your clients, collaborators or users! Once the user opens this link on his own computer, he is asked for his name and email id. 8. Upon entering the details, the user is now able to give feedback with the help of our toolbar. 9.The user can now click at any spot where he wants to give feedback! Easy! Name: API Authentication And Uri Structure
Article Content: API Authentication and URI Structure - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact API Authentication and URI Structure Welcome to the zipBoard platform REST API reference. This API is essential for connecting remotely with zipBoard, regardless of whether you are building an application, scripting interactions with zipBoard or building some other integration. This page documents the process of API key generation and the URL Structure that is followed by the API. Generating/Refreshing API Key The authentication method for the zipBoard API is HTTP token authentication (when using SSL). Accessing your zipBoard REST API token is easy! Here are the steps that you need to take in order to access your token: Sign in to your zipBoard account. Click your name at the top right corner of the screen and select 'Edit Profile' from the dropdown menu. Now click on the 'refresh' icon to generate your own zipBoard API key! URl Structure zipBoard REST APIs provide access to resources (that is, data entities) via URI paths. To use the REST API, your application makes an HTTP request and parses the response. The zipboard REST API uses JSON as its communication format and standard HTTP methods like GET , PUT , POST , and DELETE . URIs for zipBoard REST API resource has the following structure: http://host/api-name/api-version/resource-name As an example, if you wanted to retrieve the JSON representation of an issue from zipBoard, you would access: https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/:id If you have any questions, you can check out our Forum . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help?
