Name: What Happens If We Delete Shared Link For Review To Users
Article Content: What happens if we delete shared link for review to users? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What happens if we delete shared link for review to users? After deleting the link, when the user clicks on the link, it will redirect the user to the signup page if a user is not logged in, else to report page. But cannot see the review file. Name: What Is Manager Role
Article Content: What is the role of a "Manager"? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is the role of a "Manager"? You can only add managers if you are the project owner for an organization (this feature is only available for Team/Business/Enterprise plan users). Manager accounts are created at the organization level. To know how to add/remove the person as manager please click here Managers have the ability to Add Project : Add a project in the organization Add Collaborators/Clients: Can add collaborators/clients in the project Upload / Review files : Can upload/review files and also can review files in the other projects also Create a task : Can create the task in all files/projects Add feedback : Can add feedback to review files Assign a task : Can assign a task to other users Add screens : can add screens in the review board Add messages : can add messages and reply to added messages Share review : can review files Note: The manager can remove collaborators/clients from the project, only if the project is added by the manager in the organization. If you remove the manager from the organization, the projects and assign tasks to him will be assigned to the owner of the organization. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: API For Organization
Cleaned Article Content: API for Organization - zipBoard Help API for Organization Welcome to the¬†zipBoard platform REST API reference. This API is essential for connecting remotely with zipBoard, regardless of whether you are building an application, scripting interactions with zipBoard or¬†building some other integration. This page documents the REST resources available in the¬†zipBoard platform, along with the expected HTTP response codes and sample requests for interacting with projects in¬†zipBoard. Before you start working with the API, you will need to generate an API key and also get an idea of the URI Structure that needs to be followed. Please follow this article for more information on that. Get Organisation GET https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/orgs Returns the organization id and name where the user is owner and manager.. For organization¬†to be visible, the user must be logged in and authenticated. If no user is logged in, then the organization¬†data will not be visible. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: None Request var http=require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'GET', url: `https: //app.zipboard.co/api/v1/orgs`, body: { }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Succesfully retrieved Orgs.", "data": [ { "id": "bmifEBw8CMH99Wzsd", "name": "Qwerty's Organization" } ] } Did this answer your question? Name: Responses
Cleaned Article Content: Responses - zipBoard Help Responses Welcome to the¬†zipBoard platform REST API reference. This API is essential for connecting remotely with zipBoard, regardless of whether you are building an application, scripting interactions with zipBoard or building some other integration. This page documents the REST resources available in the¬†zipBoard platform, along with the expected HTTP response codes and sample requests for interacting with zipBoard¬†Tasks. Before you start working with the API, you will need to generate an API key and also get an idea of the URI Structure that needs to be followed. Please follow this article for more information on that. Get Responses GET https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/responses/ To get the corresponding responses related to the tasks. For responses to be visible, the user must be logged in and authenticated. If no user is logged in, the responses will not be visible. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: none Body Prams Required: taskid: String taskid of the responses to fetch Optional: none Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'GET', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/isssues/responses`, body: { tsakid:"9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3" }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Successfully retrieved responses.", "data": [ { "_id": "qDMjhELEZtMtjAg9e", "created_at": "2020-02-17T07:53:36.808Z", "reply_text": "new feed", "task_id": "9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3", "project_id": "3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9", "screen_id": null, "user_id": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "user_name": "Nippun" }, { "_id": "EcRCF2EX5GwCQrnXs", "created_at": "2020-02-17T10:40:12.755Z", "reply_text": "testing reply", "task_id": "9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3", "project_id": "3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9", "user_id": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "user_name": "Nippun" }, { "_id": "Ro8ahvnYnGbTd5XZN", "created_at": "2020-02-18T04:14:36.531Z", "reply_text": "testing reply edit 34", "task_id": "9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3", "project_id": "3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9", "screen_id": -1, "user_id": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "user_name": "Nippun" }, { "_id": "8ZKdmR7A4epj47bJY", "created_at": "2020-02-18T09:25:18.082Z", "reply_text": "new reply fro api", "task_id": "9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3", "project_id": "3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9", "screen_id": -1, "user_id": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "user_name": "Nippun" } ] } Create¬†Rsponse GET https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/responses/ Creates new response for the task, data required (title, projectid). To add a response to the task, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô or ‚ÄòReviewer‚Äô in the project. Returns the data of the newly created response. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: None Body Prams Required: taskid String id of the project where task should be created reply String Title of the task Optional: None Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'POST', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks`, body: { taskid: "9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3", reply: "new reply from api" }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 201, "message": "New Task Created", "data": { "_id": "rmRLttbWNoNY8Fmj4", "created_at": "2020-02-18T10:06:53.776Z", "reply_text": "new reply from api", "task_id": "9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3", "project_id": "3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9", "screen_id": -1, "user_id": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "user_name": "Nippun" } } Update¬†Response PUT https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/responses/:id Updates the existing response for the user, data required (reply). To update the response, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô or ‚Äòresponse owner‚Äô. Returns the updated responsemessage. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: id: String id of the response to be updated(string) Body Prams Required: reply String task title Optional: none Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'PUT', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/responses/rmRLttbWNoNY8Fmj4 `, body: { reply: "task-003", }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Response successfully updated.", "data": { "_id": "rmRLttbWNoNY8Fmj4", "created_at": "2020-02-18T10:06:53.776Z", "reply_text": "new reply from api updated", "task_id": "9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3", "project_id": "3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9", "screen_id": -1, "user_id": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "user_name": "Nippun" } } Delete Response PUT https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/responses/:id Deletes the existing response for the task To delete a task, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô or ‚Äòtask creator‚Äô. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: none Optional: none Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'DELETE', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/responses/rmRLttbWNoNY8Fmj4`, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Response successfully deleted" } If you have any questions, you can check out our Forum . Name: How To Install Widget And Use It
Article Content: How to install Widget and use it ? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to install Widget and use it ? Important Notice: Outdated Content This article is no longer being updated and may not reflect the current features or functionality of our platform. For the latest information, please refer to our Help Center or contact our support team. Adding the zipBoard widget/ plugin to a page gives you the ability to take screenshots and review them directly from your web page. Using zipBoard's screenshot and annotation plugin users can directly add feedback from the link shared with them. The plugin can be used to gather feedback from internal collaborators as well as guest users. Installing the Widget Installing the plugin is easy, with a simple script that can be embedded in the HTML of the website. Log into Zipboard account and Navigate to Files and URLs section of your project. 2. Select Web URL file and click on 3 dots on the file 3.¬†Open the Widget dropdown to reveal your code snippet and copy the code to your clipboard 4.¬†Paste the code at the bottom of the <body> tag on every page you want the widget to appear and you‚Äôre good to go! Now when you view your web page, you should be able to see the widget in the upper right corner as seen below If you‚Äôre already authenticated on the app in the same browser, you will be automatically signed in to your account and can skip the login instructions To sign in as guest user in the widget 1. Click on the widget, enter email id and name and click on submit in the tab prompted "Sign in as Guest" . To sign in with zip board account in the widget 1.¬†Click on sign in, prompt to the login page, enter your credentials and click on log in To Capture screenshot and add Review 1.Once you login either with zip board account or as a guest user, In prompt tab¬†select your current tab and click on share to capture your screenshot 2. You will now be redirected to the review board , where you can annotate your screenshot and comment or add a task 3.¬†You can toggle back and forth between your web page and the review board using the browse/review options given in the widget Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Is Make An Announcement In Zipboard For All Projects In The Organization
Article Content: Make an Announcement in zipboard for All Projects in the Organization - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Make an Announcement in zipboard for All Projects in the Organization For the enterprise plans there is an option to add an announcement. Steps to add an announcement 1. Log in to your account 2. Click on manage org from the profile on the top right corner 3. Navigate to Announcements 4. From Announcement page--> click on ADD to add an announcement Added Announcements will be shown on all pages and for all collaborators and clients. One Announcement can be added at once if you want to add a new announcement, the old one will be replaced. Did this answer your question? Name: Is Full Page Screenshot Option Availble In Zipboard
Article Content: Is Full Page Screenshot Option Available in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Is Full Page Screenshot Option Available in zipBoard? In this article, we'll walk you through adding a web URL to a zipBoard project and capturing content through the Review Board . Step 1: Add a Web URL to Your Project Go to your project in zipBoard. Add the web URL you want to review. Refer to How Can I Get My Web-Hosted Content Reviewed with zipBoard for detailed steps. Step 2: Open the Review Board After adding the URL, click the Review button. This will navigate you to the Review Board . Step 3: Capture Web Pages Using the Camera Tool On the Review Board, click the Camera icon. Full Page : Automatically scrolls and captures the entire webpage from top to bottom. These tools are useful for documenting feedback on both simple and complex web pages, ensuring nothing is missed in your reviews. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Can Screens Can Be Added To Task In The Project
Article Content: Can Screens be Added to Task in the Project? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can Screens be Added to Task in the Project? Yes, there is the 'Screen' option in Task. You can select the screen which you want to add to the task. 1. Log in to the zipBoard account. 2. Select the projects 3. Go to Tasks 4. Select the task --> click on 'Screen' For adding screen -->Select the file --> select the screen to add. 5. From the Replies also you can add a screen. Click on Preview icon -->Select file-->Select Screen-->Click on Add The added screen will be attached to the task. you can also delete added screen by just clicking on 'x' symbol on-screen hover. Name: What Is The Message Feature In Zipboard
Article Content: What is the Message Feature in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is the Message Feature in zipBoard? The message feature in zipBoard is a way to communicate with collaborators, and clients (only for Enterprise plan). Select the project 2. Go to 'Messages' from the dashboard --> click on 'Add message' 3. Message modal will open, here you can add a message Add message for collaborators : This will add message only for collaborators Add message for clients & collaborators : This will add a message for clients and collaborators Title : You can title/subject of the message here Message body : You can add a message here Attach Screens : You can add screens from this project to the message 6. Attach Review board: You can attach review board from this project to message Save : Save the message to add to collaborators/ clients& collaborators Cancel : To cancel the message Font weight controls : you can use the font-weight controls for the message body Once added message can be seen by all collaborators in the selected project. if you select clients and collaborators, all the clients and collaborators can see the added messages when they log into their zipBoard account. Notification is seen on the messages when new message is added. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Contact Us Contact Us Last updated on December 5, 2023 Related Articles What communication routes I can opt while using zipBoard, to keep the team in sync? Can my client get messages from project team in enterprise edition? Name: I Upload A File But Its Stuck What Should I Do
Article Content: I uploaded a zip file, but it's stuck. What should I do? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I uploaded a zip file, but it's stuck. What should I do? Oh, snap! This should not have happened, but if you are stuck at uploading your zip file, then firstly, please ensure that the zip file is not corrupted i.e. it unzips well in your machine. If the zip file is all okay then you should immediately contact our support team at support@zipboard.co to help you get out of the mess. Did this answer your question? Name: Can We Import Tasks To Zipboard From CSV Excel
Article Content: Can we Import Tasks to zipBoard from CSV/Excel? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can we Import Tasks to zipBoard from CSV/Excel? Yes, we have an option for importing task from CSV/Excel in the task 'Import CSV' 1. Go to the task tab for the selected project and click on 'Import CSV' 2. Select CSV file 3. zipBoard will map columns with zipboard fields, if required you can change them 4. Review tasks then click 'Complete and tasks' Did this answer your question? Name: Getting Started With Zipboard
Article Content: Getting Started with zipBoard: A Workflow for Everyone - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started with zipBoard: A Workflow for Everyone zipBoard is built for teams building digital content, websites, apps to collect feedback easily and process it using visual feedback - annotation, screenshot, screen recording tools. The biggest challenge with remote teams is setting the right systems. We need systems on big teams that can collaborate and produce great content. For the text and presentations, you can work with google docs and slides. But for reviewing the content and getting feedback you need a power-packed solution that has these three main components. Capture stakeholder reviews & feedback Triage the feedback into internal workflow Manage issues and tasks Keeping these major requirements in mind we have designed zipBoard. Before we dive in to show you all the main features of zipBoard. Make sure you have already signed up for the free trial and are logged in to zipBoard. In case you haven't signed up yet please go ahead and Sign up for a free account here and get started . By setting up zipBoard as your main feedback management tool, you are going to speed up your content development process. Step 1 - Create a new project Start by creating a new project. Once you are logged into your account, click on the big plus button to create a new project. Refer to the below preview. Add title, description and there is a custom project id that you use in your workflow then you can use that also. Step 2 -¬†Upload content The next step is to add content for review. zipBoard lets you share quick feedback on working content like webpages, web apps, e-learning courses, PDF documents, images, videos. You can create reviews through the development lifecycle using screenshots and annotated screens. In order to add your content to zipBoard, you can add a webpage URL , a zipped SCORM file ( for e-learning courses), mp4 files ( for videos), image files, PDF documents, and files hosted on cloud storage like dropbox or google docs as links. Content can also be added afterwards while reviewing files or adding comments. You can always add more content by simplifying uploading it with tasks, comments. Here is a more detailed step by step guide of ‚Äú How to upload and review SCORM/ Valid HTML content with zipBoard? ‚Äù Step 3 - Add Collaborators It's always a great idea to have all team members added as collaborators from the start. These are people who will have full visibility of the project and can be assigned specific tasks to follow up on reviews. You can always add more collaborators or guests at a later stage. However, by adding it in the beginning you can assign tasks or ask for a visual review from your team. Adding collaborators is as easy as you see it below. For more detailed procedures you can even follow the step from this knowledge base article Step 4 - Share files with guests for review and feedback. Getting reviews and feedback from your clients or guests is important. But at the same time, you do not want to overwhelm them with internal tasks and discussions.¬†Basically, all you need is a review from your client or external stakeholders. To do this zipBoard allows adding guest collaborators who can only review and share feedback. For a detailed guide on this r efer to our help doc . For now, here is a quick preview of how you can do it. Step 5 - Turn feedback into Tasks or create new tasks Now you are ready to add and manage visual reviews and tasks. Create tasks based on the feedback so that you can track progress. A good practice is to assign tasks for every feedback that you receive. You can create tasks from the review board, project dashboard area, or even while making a comment on the existing tasks. See how easy it is to create tasks Step 7 - Set Priorities for your Tasks It‚Äôs important that you set priorities for your tasks to move quickly with the high priority items. zipBoard offers you a drop-down list of set priorities for you to choose from. Setting priorities makes sure that the collaborators understand the urgency of a particular task and work accordingly. zipBoard automatically adds the date, time, creator, operating system environment, screen size when you are creating the tasks. This way you can even track each task if at all you need to. Step 8 - Assign to Stakeholders Now that the content is visually reviewed and tasks are created, it's time to assign tasks to the person who will be practically working on completing them. Connect with the team and assign tasks to responsible stakeholders and set approx ETA. zipBoard offers adding estimated ETA and real ETA. Using the time tracking feature of zipBoard you can actually monitor the time taken to finish each task and the project as a whole. For you to add stakeholders you will need to have them added as collaborators. If you did not add your collaborator while creating the account. You can add them now. Step 9 - Move tasks in different phases There are three main phases that any project can be categorized into. Backlog Work in Progress Completed Additionally, you can even Future Ideas or anything custom that you can think of. You can create different phases as per your needs and drag the tasks into different phases or choose from the dropdown list. Step 10 - Customize your view For an enhanced experience you can change the view of your dashboard, there are two views to choose from (Table View and Kanban View) Refer to the below screenshot to see how each of these looks. You can switch the views any time by using the toggle button right under the project name. 1. Table View 2. Kanban view Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Do We Have Reports On Project Based In Zipboard
Article Content: Do we have reports on project based in zipboard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Do we have reports on project based in zipboard? Yes, we maintain reports for every project individually. But this can be seen only by the owner and manager of the project. 1. Go to Projects 2.Select Reports from the left side dashboard 3. Reports can be seen based on date and also cumulative. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Do Slack Channel Get Notified If Task Is Created Or Updated In Zipboard
Article Content: Do slack channel get notified if task is created or updated in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Do slack channel get notified if task is created or updated in zipBoard? Yes in slack we get a notification if the task is created or updated also but first we have to integrate the zipBoard account with the slack. When the task is created in zipBoard, task notification is shown in the slack channel If any comment added to the task or updated the task that is also notified in the Slack channel. Name: How To Work With Microsoft Teams App With Zipboard Integrated In It
Article Content: How to Work with Microsoft Teams App with zipBoard Integrated in it? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Work with Microsoft Teams App with zipBoard Integrated in it? Why zipBoard with teams app? All your team can work together in zipBoard. Easy to track the issues for your project clients and developers can share feedback and convert them to task How to integrate : You can set up the app with just following simple steps. Within Microsoft Teams, click on the channel you want to add zipBoard app. Then, click to add a new tab to the channel and choose zipBoard from the list. 2. Enter link to zipBoard account and click connect 3. Log in with your zipBoard account and select project and click save Once you‚Äôre redirected back to Teams,¬†your tab will appear in the channel. Some important points to note: 1. Clicking on File review it redirects you to explorer 2. Import CSV and Download CSV will not be available in teams 3.¬†An administrator may need to enable external apps in Microsoft Teams for zipBoard¬†to appear. 4.¬†Each user of Microsoft Teams will need to have an zipBoard¬†account in order to see the insights in Teams. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Does Zipboard Support Two Way Communication With Jira
Article Content: Does zipboard Support Two Way Communication with JIRA - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Does zipboard Support Two Way Communication with JIRA Yes, if the user makes changes in the Jira it will change in the zipBoard task also. To know how to integrate with JIRA click here Mapped fields are Assignee Priority Due date Type Replies Description Limitations: When user add a comment in the zipboard, in JIRA it shows with zipBoard (username) The status of the task is also not mapped When we import task from CSV, this will not integrate by default, we have to integrate them just by clicking +icon beside JIRA integration Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Whats Next After Zipboard Account Integrated At Organization Level With Jira
Article Content: What's next after zipBoard account integrated at organization level with JIRA? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What's next after zipBoard account integrated at organization level with JIRA? Once the integration is done, a list of all the projects associated with this JIRA account will load. Now, choose the JIRA Project to which the issues created in zipBoard will correspond to. Go to project¬†settings and click on JIRA icon Map how you want Bugs and Enhancements in zipBoard to show up in JIRA. Did this answer your question? Name: Can We Capture Screenshotrecord Video Without Going To Zipboard
Article Content: How to Record a Video to Capture Feedback using zipBoard extension? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Record a Video to Capture Feedback using zipBoard extension? Ever wondered if you could capture screenshots or record videos without the hassle of navigating to zipBoard? Well, you're in luck! The zipBoard extension has you covered. With this feature-packed extension added to your browser, capturing screenshots and recording videos becomes a breeze. Add an extension to the browser. You can go to any tabs open, click the extension, then select what you want to record. Screen Screen and Self Self Make sure to select your camera, and mic before recording After that, you can stop the recording. You can either: exit, save, or download the recording If you select "save," you will have to fill out the important details. Another thing, it gives you option to save Can be uploaded as video Can create task and video gets uploaded as attachment Can add comment to the task, in here also video gets uploaded as attachment Saving or Adding in Uploads, Tasks, or a Comment: After recording, you have the option to save the recording to a project or add it as a task. Click on the task view and enter a task name. Assigning to a Project: Select the project and phase (area within the project) where you want to add the task. Confirm your selection. Tips for Screen and Self Recording Enabling Camera Access : For 'Screen and Self' recording, grant access to your camera when prompted. Microphone Selection: If you want to record your voice, ensure you select your microphone before starting the recording. Managing Voice Recording: Click on 'Start Recording' after configuring your microphone settings. To have a comprehensive guide about our video recording tool, you may visit this help article. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: How To Invite Collaborator To Project
Article Content: How to Invite Collaborators to a Project? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Invite Collaborators to a Project? Collaboration is at the heart of success, and zipBoard makes it easier than ever. Invite your team members to join your project by either adding their email addresses directly or sharing personalized invitation links. Empower your collaborators to contribute, review, and enhance your projects effortlessly with zipBoard's streamlined collaboration features. Go to the project --> Collaborators 2.Click on 'Add Collaborators' 3. Enter their email address (you can add many collaborators at once) or click on 'Copy invite link' and share a link to the user Invited users can use their email link/invite link to login to zipBoard Note: Invited link is valid only for 7 days Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: What Authoring Tools Does Zipboard Support
Article Content: What authoring tools does zipBoard support? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What authoring tools does zipBoard support? For eLearning projects, zipBoard supports projects created using authoring tools such as Articulate 360, Adapt Learning, Articulate Storyline, Articulate Presenter, Adobe Captivate, Adobe Presenter, iSpring and Lectora. If you have created a valid SCORM project or a hosted project from any other tool, zipBoard should have no problem viewing it. If you‚Äôd like our dev team to look at some specific file, share it with us here . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: How To Install The Zbreviewboard Extension On Edge
Article Content: How to install the zBreviewboard extension on Edge - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to install the zBreviewboard extension on Edge In order to install the zBreviewboard extension which is an essential plugin that is required for taking screenshots and video recordings for review on zipBoard, you need to follow the following steps if you are using the Edge¬†Browser. 1. Open the following link in Edge 2. Click on¬†'Get'. 3.A pop-up would appear. Click on¬†' Add Extension '. 4.Wait for the extension to get downloaded and installed. As soon as it gets installed, you will see the extension present in the extensions bar of Edge. Now that you have the extension installed, go to the following guide to start reviewing your first webpage! Did this answer your question? Name: Getting Started As A Collaborator
Article Content: Getting Started as a Collaborator - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started as a Collaborator Since zipBoard allows you to add multiple collaborators to a project, we would like to take you through how to get started as a collaborator when you are added by the owner of any project. After you are added as a collaborator by the owner or manager of a specific project, you need to follow these simple steps to get started: What can collaborators do in zipBoard? Access shared projects Upload and review content Share files externally Provide and triage feedback Assign tasks and track progress View project reports Step-by-Step Process for Collaborators Step Description Help Article Video 1. Join the Project You‚Äôll receive an email invitation to collaborate. ‚Ä¢ If you don‚Äôt have a zipBoard account, sign up. ‚Ä¢ If you already have an account, you‚Äôll be redirected to the project dashboard. Getting Started as a Collaborator ‚Äì 2. Upload Content (if applicable) Collaborators can upload relevant files such as designs, PDFs, or documents. Note: Files are usually uploaded by the Project Manager. How to Add and Review Content Watch Video 3. Start Reviewing Begin reviewing uploaded content by adding comments or annotations. How to Add and Review Content ‚Äì 4. Share with External Reviewers (Optional) Share the content with external stakeholders to collect feedback. Share Link Settings Watch Video 5. Triage Feedback Sort feedback by relevance, priority, or status to streamline action items. Track and Prioritize Feedback Watch Video 6. Manage Tasks After triaging, you can: ‚Ä¢ Assign tasks ‚Ä¢ Move tasks across workflow phases ‚Ä¢ Switch views (table or kanban) Getting Started with a Workflow Manage Tasks Better ‚Äì 7. View Project Reports Access auto-generated reports to monitor feedback trends, progress, and team productivity. Auto-Generated Reports ‚Äì Need More Help? Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Or start your 14-day Free Trial! Name: How Secure Is Zipboard
Article Content: How Secure is zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Secure is zipBoard? At zipBoard , we treat your data with the same level of care you do. Our platform is architected to support secure collaboration for teams handling sensitive content, regulated processes, and complex stakeholder reviews. üñ•Ô∏è Enterprise-Grade Cloud Infrastructure zipBoard is primarily hosted on Amazon Web Services (AWS) , a global leader in cloud security. Our infrastructure leverages AWS‚Äôs redundant, layered controls and 24/7 monitoring. Compliance & Certifications: Our hosting environment meets rigorous global standards, including SOC 1/2/3, ISO 27001, PCI DSS Level 1, and FedRAMP . Physical Security: zipBoard personnel have no physical access to data centers; we rely on AWS's industry-leading physical security protocols. Multi-Cloud Flexibility: For organizations standardizing on the Microsoft ecosystem, we offer deployments on Microsoft Azure as part of our Enterprise engagements. Need Azure? zipBoard can also support deployments on Microsoft Azure as part of an enterprise or pilot engagement. üìÅ Data Encryption & Transmission Your information is shielded from the moment it leaves your browser. Encryption in Transit: All data sent between your device and zipBoard is protected using industry-standard SSL/TLS encryption . Sensitive Data : High-stakes information, such as login credentials and payment details, is encrypted while in transit to prevent unauthorized interception. üéØ Access Controls & Internal Security Access to customer data within zipBoard is strictly limited to authorized personnel only , and solely for operational or support purposes when required. Internal security practices include: Role-based access controls Secure credential management Immediate access revocation when team members leave the organization. üîê Data Protection & Disaster Recovery We ensure your work is never lost due to unforeseen system issues. Automated Backups : We perform regular snapshots (via Amazon EBS and S3) to help protect against accidental data loss and support recovery in the event of system issues. High Availability: Our backup systems are well-tested and designed for fast recovery to ensure business continuity. üóÉÔ∏è Flexible Enterprise Deployment & Residency In addition to standard cloud hosting, zipBoard offers flexible deployment and data-handling options for organizations with enhanced security, compliance, or data-residency requirements. Depending on organizational policies and technical needs, these options may include: Customer-hosted document storage , where documents remain on the customer‚Äôs servers while zipBoard enables secure review and collaboration Region-specific or private cloud configurations Deployments on Microsoft Azure for organizations standardizing on the Microsoft ecosystem Custom access, authentication, or permission models These configurations are typically evaluated as part of an enterprise or pilot engagement and may involve additional setup, validation, or onboarding. üìÉ Compliance & Vendor Review Support zipBoard works with organizations that require supplier vetting, risk assessment, and procurement review. We are happy to assist your IT and Legal teams during the procurement process. We can provide: Security White Papers Architectural Overviews Operational Security Details Download our Security White Paper: Download now for a deep dive into our internal policies and technical safeguards. Do you have specific security requirements? If your organization has specific security, compliance, or hosting requirements, please contact the zipBoard team to discuss available options and determine the best configuration for your needs. Contact us at support@zipboard.co Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: What Is Client Role In Enterprise Edition
Article Content: What is the Client role in Enterprise Plan? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is the Client role in Enterprise Plan? Managing projects with external stakeholders can be tricky. Clients, SMEs, and executives need to stay informed and provide feedback, but they don't want to be bogged down by the nitty-gritty of internal workflows, task updates, or project management details. Balancing transparency with privacy is a common challenge that often slows down progress and creates communication gaps. What zipBoard Offers zipBoard simplifies client collaboration by allowing you to add external stakeholders as Clients to your projects. With features like the ' Add Client ' button and advanced permission settings, you can provide clients with the exact level of access they need‚Äînothing more, nothing less. Clients can: View and provide feedback on shared files, comments, and messages. Convert feedback into actionable tasks for smoother workflows. Enjoy a clutter-free experience without being exposed to internal activities or discussions. Why It‚Äôs Beneficial Streamlined Collaboration : Focused client access reduces unnecessary back-and-forth and keeps feedback on track. Privacy Preserved : Internal team discussions, tasks, and workflows remain secure. Efficient Workflow Management : Clearer communication means fewer misunderstandings and faster approvals. Impact Across Industries AEC (Architecture, Engineering, and Construction) : Collaborate effectively with clients, subcontractors, and consultants while keeping project details secure. E-Learning : Share course content with SMEs for review without exposing development notes. Marketing and Design : Collect client feedback on campaigns and visuals without revealing internal drafts. Software Development : Enable user feedback during beta testing while maintaining internal sprint details. How It Works Add your client via the 'Add Client' button in the Collaborators tab. Share files with customizable permissions: Let clients view all or specific boards. Allow them to provide comments or start new reviews. Use advanced settings to manage what feedback is visible to whom. Convert comments into tasks for efficient follow-ups. Experience Seamless Client Collaboration Start leveraging zipBoard's client collaboration tools today. üëâ Try zipBoard free for 14 days or Book a Demo to see how it can transform your workflows. Name: How To Review And Collaborate On Video Projects
Article Content: How to Review and Collaborate on Video Projects - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Review and Collaborate on Video Projects You can review video files using zipBoard and also invite team members to collaborate. It‚Äôs easy to add video files on the zipBoard App and review them directly without having to worry about installing any other third-party apps or leaving the application while in the project. Video projects are widely used in a large number of industries and have proved to be the most efficient way of conveying information, below are a few simple steps for reviewing video projects while collaborating with other stakeholders: 1) Log in to the zipBoard app using your credentials You can log in to the zipBoard app which will redirect you to the project‚Äôs dashboard. 2) Create a new project or select an existing one. Once you have logged in successfully, you will have the option to create a new project or select an existing one as per your needs and requirements. 3) Click on the "Add Content" 4) Upload the required video file and start reviewing Click on the add button on the top right corner of your screen and select the required video file from your local drive, upload the video file which will then be ready for review. Click on the start review button which appears on your screen once the required video file is uploaded. You can use zipBoard's annotation tools to manage feedback and comments on multiple content types - videos, images, mp3, HTML zipped files and courses, websites. New to zipBoard? See how you can easily add annotations and comments to your Digital content Reviewing and Collaborating Now that we are done with the initial steps of adding video files and starting reviewing, let‚Äôs go through each review feature and collaboration tools separately. Once we are inside the review board, you have options to: 1) Use annotation tools like ‚áß Select, üí¨ Comment, üñâ Pencil, ‚Üó Arrow, ‚ñ≠ Rectangle, ‚äü Eraser as per your needs and convenience on any part of the video by simply using the play/pause ‚èµbutton located on the top and bottom of the screen for annotating the specific video part for review. 2) Use the annotation tools mentioned above for reviewing the video project and assigning them as tasks to other stakeholders. 3) You can also share your reviews with others using the share button on the top right corner of the review board. a) Guest Collaborators : You can share your review board of the video project with guest collaborators after selecting options like enable/disable require signup/login, review all board/reviews and add new board/reviews, you can also copy/paste the sharing link or share via email. b) Collaborators : You can share your review board with internal collaborators who are already added to your project as collaborators by clicking on the required name and email and notifying them about the collaboration via email simply share the collaboration link c) You can also view the shared link status on the sharing dialogue box. 4) Other than the tools mentioned above, the review board has other features such as full-screen option, and review summary widget on the top section along with the annotation tools for a list view of all the reviews, task summary widget for viewing all the tasks in a Kanban board and finally the info widget which gives the video project details like upload details, file name, file resolution, creator details, etc. Here's a short video demonstrating the video review process: You can also check out this article on getting feedback on videos for additional details. Name: Comprehensive Guides For Zipboard
Article Content: Guides for zipBoard Users - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Guides for zipBoard Users üëâ Please read this: Comprehensive Workflow Guide for All zipBoard Users: Understanding Roles and Responsibilities We, at zipBoard, always strive to make your work easier and help you collaborate with your team effectively. Here, we have compiled three comprehensive guides based on your role on zipBoard. 1. The Complete Comprehensive Guide for Owners/Admin : This Guide contains all of the details you need to get started. All the features and ins and outs are described here. It is recommended for Admins/Owners, the individuals who create the projects. 2. The Complete Comprehensive Guide for Collaborators : This Guide is meant for creators who were invited as collaborators, either by link or email, to work on a project. Collaborators can do pretty much everything that Admins/Owners can do, except for a few. 3. The Complete Comprehensive Guide for Guest Reviewers : If you are invited as a guest reviewer/external client/stakeholder, you might want to keep this one handy. It describes everything that an external reviewer is capable of doing. All of the guides are also linked with various help articles. Make sure to check our help documents for further help. If you feel that the guides are missing something or can be improved in any way, or if you need help with something for which articles are not available or adequate, feel free to write to us at support@zipboard.co. Name: Can We Add Live Annotations With Zipboard Extension
Article Content: Can We Add Live Annotations without zipBoard Extension? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can We Add Live Annotations without zipBoard Extension? Yes, we can add live annotations without the zipBoard extension . Go to File and click on 'Review' Following are options available in live annotations Browse : Let's you go through your content Review : You can use all annotations tools to add your feedback and suggestions Select : With select, you can browse around and look through existing comments and annotations that your team members provided, you can also move comments around and erase them Comments : Adding a comment is easy, just click anywhere in your content where you feel to give a suggestion/add a task Pencil : It works like just you imagined doodle away and add your comment Arrow : It helps you to point at an object give comments and review to it Rectangle : It helps you to select the section on the screen and add your comment/task to it Eraser : This allows you to delete an existing annotation Stamp Options : Allows you to add signature, check mark, and timestamp Screenshot/Video recording : You can take a screenshot to grab a part of the webpage or you can capture entirely in one go for review and screen recorded allows you to record the screen, your webcam and your mic helps you give effective and explanatory feedback Reviewboard : Every time you add a review, we create a screenshot for reference. From the review board, you can access all your screenshots for this project Review summary : It shows the review history of your file, from here you can browse/review files from where they were added Device mode : Let's you know how your web page or multimedia file in different resolutions in different devices Limitations : The user cannot add live annotations for the following file types Scorm courses published in Articulate, Adapt, Elucidate, Lectora Did this answer your question? Name: What Are The Upload Limits
Article Content: What are the Upload Limits? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What are the Upload Limits? With every project, you get 250MB of disk space. Space is shared across your projects and is available as a pool, so if you buy 10 projects, you have 2.5GB of disk space. Enterprise accounts come with 25 GB disk space by default. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Visual Reviews And Feedback With Zipboard
Article Content: Visual Reviews and Feedback with zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Visual Reviews and Feedback with zipBoard zipBoard lets you provide visual feedback to your collaborators, guest reviewers, clients and external stakeholders. This not only saves time by helping you avoid long and tedious screen-sharing online meetings, it makes the entire process better by directly getting your points across visually, rather by text. You can visually annotate and review over images, videos, PDFs, URLs and Zip files. You can also navigate to the "Comments" section in the left menu bar to view all the comments that have been given to all of the files in one project. If you want, you can add those comments as tasks or delete the comments if you feel like it. By using the search bar and the filters, you can sift through all of the comments and find something specific in a matter of seconds. zipBoard's visual collaboration and feedback tools have helped our customers across the world to have more efficient review cycles and get their points across faster. One of the most useful features while giving visual feedback and comments while reviewing is, if you are the Owner of the project, you can decide whether the external clients can view the internal comments! Just by using a toggle, you can separate external and internal information during review cycles. To learn more about sharing externally, you may go here . Did this answer your question? Name: Manage Tasks Better With Zipboard
Article Content: Manage Tasks Better with zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Manage Tasks Better with zipBoard üìå We have new updates! Please visit this link. zipBoard helps you manage tasks and prioritize your backlog visually. Watch the following video to learn what you can do in zipBoard's task manager: Organize your tasks with ease: Assign ownership : Clearly delegate tasks to team members for clear accountability. Set priorities (critical, high, medium, low) to ensure the most important tasks get tackled first. Use statuses to visualize the workflow of each task. Set due dates to keep everyone on track and avoid missed deadlines. Group related tasks within specific project phases for a clear structure. Add watchers to keep relevant team members informed about task progress. You can also communicate with your collaborators by using the comments section and message them personally by using '@'. You can visually track your task and phases by using Kanban Board . Kanban Board lets you drag tasks through different phases in your project and have a quick glance over the tasks and their respective statuses. Did this answer your question? Name: Collaborate Better With Zipboard
Article Content: Collaborate Better with zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Collaborate Better with zipBoard zipBoard makes collaboration better and smoother by letting you add collaborators, reviewers, managers, external clients and stakeholders in one place. What makes it even better is you can add unlimited collaborators to your zipBoard project. You can also message the collaborators and clients from within the app. Moreover, you can invite collaborators and guest reviewers to work on a specific content. You, the project owner, can also make sure if they would be allowed to add comments and/or view existing ones and/or assign tasks. In other words, more power to you! zipBoard will save a lot of time by making collaboration more efficient quicker. No more "let's hop on a quick call". Did this answer your question? Name: Generate Consolidated Reports With Zipboard
Article Content: Generate Consolidated Reports with zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Generate Consolidated Reports with zipBoard zipBoard helps you get updated quickly with everything that is going in in an Organizational level by generating consolidated reports for you. In these reports you can view all of the updates about all of the projects in an organization like number of tasks, status of tasks, number of collaborators, etc. On the other hand, you can also view reports on a project level. Name: Auto Generated Reports
Article Content: Help Scout - Log In Help Scout Please login to view the requested page Log In Remember me for 30 days Log In or Sign in with Google Loading‚Ä¶ Forgot your password? Sign in with Help Scout credentials 2025 Fall Seasonal Release Collecting and Connecting Dots See What Shipped Help Scout requires JavaScript Follow these steps to enable it in your browser Google Chrome (Windows & Mac) Find the three vertical dot option in the top-right corner of your browser, and open the Settings section from there. Click the "Security and Privacy" link in the left-hand sidebar. Click the "Site Settings" option. Click the "JavaScript" option. Select "Sites can use JavaScript." Firefox (Windows & Mac) In your browser, type "about:config" in the address bar and click enter. A warning message will display on your browser; click "Accept the Risk and Continue" button to proceed. Enter "javascript.enabled" in the search box. Locate the option labeled "javascript.enabled" on the search result and select toggle to turn on JavaScript. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Microsoft Edge On the More menu (‚Ä¶), select Settings. Click the "Site permissions" option in the left-hand sidebar. Select the "JavaScript" option. Toggle the "Allow (recommended)" option to enable it. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Internet Explorer 11+ is required Upgrade For a faster, more secure browsing experience, we highly recommend installing Google Chrome or Firefox . Looking for a better way to talk with customers? Try Help Scout

Name: Review All Types Of Content In One Place
Article Content: Review All Types of Content in One Place - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Review All Types of Content in One Place zipBoard makes it easy for your entire team and clients by letting you review multiple types of content, visually, in one place. You can add a URL/webpage, PDF, video, image and ZIP file to your zipBoard project. It will help you save time and also avoid confusion as you don't have to cycle through multiple apps for different files. To add content, you can go to "Uploads" in the left hand menu bar and then click on "Add content" button on the top right corner. When you see the dropdown menu, choose a file of your choice and you are ready to go! Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Can We See Error Logs In Zipboard Related To Jira Integration
Article Content: Can We See Error Logs in zipBoard Related to JIRA Integration? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can We See Error Logs in zipBoard Related to JIRA Integration? Yes, once the organization integrated with Jira , if there are any error logs you can see them. Go to Manage integration Click on "Error logs" Error logs are shown If you still have any doubt, reach out to us at¬†support@zipboard.co¬†and we will help you troubleshoot. Name: Zipboard Pricing Update March 2021
Article Content: zipBoard pricing update: 12th March 2021 - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact zipBoard pricing update: 12th March 2021 üìå For new updates, please refer to our pricing page. Starting from 12th March 2021 we at zipBoard have updated our pricing plan where the free plan will be replaced by a 14-day free trial at the end of which the users have to upgrade to a paid plan to continue using zipBoard. We have also introduced a new ‚ÄúBusiness Plan‚Äù priced at $110/month, when billed annually. Why did the pricing plan change? The Business Plan will allow our new users to collaborate on 50 files/URLs at once and also allow them to add managers to their projects. We have created this plan which is targeted to cater the needs of our customers who work in bigger organisations and complex projects. The new ‚Äú14-day Free trial‚Äù will allow our valued users explore the product deeply and all the solutions it provides to make their existing workflow more efficient and productive, something the ‚ÄúFree Plan‚Äù was unable to achieve. Furthermore, with the ‚ÄúFree Plan‚Äù there were only limited things that a user could do with zipBoard. This change in plans will also help our developers understand which features are suitable for you and how you can use zipBoard for maximum efficiency. I created my account before this change. What happens to me? If you had created your account before this change in pricing, your free trial will be extended by another 90 days. After that, in order to continue using zipBoard, you will have to upgrade to one of the paid plans . What will happen to my data if my free trial expires? Your data will be stored safely on our servers and you can access it as soon as you upgrade your account. What are the features of the free 14-day trial? With the new 14-day free trial, you can explore all the features of zipBoard which will help you understand how much of an improvement you are capable of having in your workflow with zipBoard in your arsenal. Click here to learn more . Are there any other changes on the existing plans? Yes. We have added new features and functionalities in all of the existing plans. For instance, now you can add managers if you are upgraded to Team Plan or Business Plan. Learn more . Moreover, if you decide to upgrade your account before 31st March 2021, you can avail flat 20% discount on all of the paid plans. Don‚Äôt worry, their pricing of all our existing plans remains the same. Click here to learn more . Which plan is best suitable for me? We recommend you to go for a free trial and explore our solutions. Talk with your team, clients and stakeholders on how zipBoard will be helpful to your process. Still if you need any help, you can book a personalised demo . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Contact Us Contact Us Last updated on October 18, 2024 Related Articles Which Plan is Right for me? Can I Change my Plan? What Payment Methods Do You Support? Name: Enterprise Plan What To Expect
Article Content: Enterprise Plan : What to expect? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Enterprise Plan : What to expect? Enterprise plan will allow you to customise zipBoard very specifically to your needs. You can check out the features of the Enterprise plan here . Apart from getting all the features that we offer in Business Plan or Team plan, you will also get: 1. Custom branding and URL 2. Custom tags 3. Custom Integrations 4. Archiving projects Learn how Enterprise plan can help your organisation with improved workflow with our visual review and bug tracking solution. If you on the fence, no worries, you can talk to us and we will gladly help you out. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: How Do I Enable Webhooks To Receive Updates From Jira
Article Content: How Do I Enable Webhooks to Receive Updates from JIRA? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Do I Enable Webhooks to Receive Updates from JIRA? To know how to integrate with JIRA, click here . Once 3LO authentication is done,¬†you can optionally enable webhook to receive real-time updates from your JIRA tasks created with zipBoard. To enable webhook, click on enable webhook from the integrations tab and enter email id and API token and click on save,¬†before proceeding, make sure to go to this link and create an API Token for yourself. Please note, if we delete authentication and add it again, the webhook should enable again, an earlier one will be deleted. Did this answer your question? Name: What Are Different Types Of Content Created Using Authoring Tools Does Zipboard Support For Adding Live Annotations
Article Content: What are different types of content created using authoring tools does zipboard support for adding live annotations? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What are different types of content created using authoring tools does zipboard support for adding live annotations? Zipboard support the following content created authoring tools Gomo: Yes zipboard support for adding live annotations for the courses/content created using gomo authoring tool Captivate:¬†Yes zipboard support for adding live annotations for the courses/content created using Captivate¬†authoring tool Articulate: Yes it supports but there are some limitations with articulate courses Limitations We do support courses created using Rise360 but not Storyline360 Rise360 courses should be published either as Scorm 2004/Scorm1.2 version We do not support courses published on the web using Rise360 User can upload Rise 360 courses to any web app/website and add the URL to zipboard to add live annotation but if the website opens course in a new tab then we do not support Courses uploaded in website/web apps and add share link in zipboard as URL then also we do not support live annotations Please note: zipboard does not support¬†Scorm courses published in Adapt, Elucidate, Lectora For the Published LMS, if the URL does not change, we cannot guarantee that live annotations works correctly Did this answer your question? Name: I Have Uploaded Articulate Scorm File But Live Annotations Does Not Work What Was The Issue
Article Content: I have uploaded Articulate scorm file but live annotations does not work, what was the issue? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I have uploaded Articulate scorm file but live annotations does not work, what was the issue? For Articulate scorm files, below are the limitations. zipBoard supports live annotations for the course created and published in Rise360 only not for courses created using Storyline360 The course should be published either in Scorm 1.2 or Scorm 2004 version We do support only published LMS but not published on web We do not support if the course is uploaded on website/ web app which opens in new tab Live annotations will work only for the courses which are in compliance with the aforementioned limitations. Name: Using Zipboard Browser Extension Across A Business Account
Article Content: Using zipBoard browser extension across a business account - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Using zipBoard browser extension across a business account Web browser policies to deploy zipBoard extension across the enterprise or specific users. Silent installation without user intervention. Also auto-updates.¬†zipBoard recommends using web browser policies to use zipBoard extension across your enterprise and/or for specific users as it offers a silent installation with no user intervention. It also enables an auto-update mechanism for the zipBoard extension. Step 1 : Enable the ability to manage web browsers using policies Here is how you could do it. Windows : ADM or ADMX template for each browser Chrome ‚Äì Carefully read this article , then download the policy templates .zip file and follow the instructions. Edge ‚Äì Carefully read this article , then download the Administrative Template and follow the instructions. Step 2 : Set up browser policies for installation of zipBoard extension Windows : Chrome : Use the ExtensionInstallForcelist policy https://chromeenterprise.google/policies/?policy=ExtensionInstallForcelist with following parameters: Software\Policies\Google\Chrome\ExtensionInstallForcelist\1 = hjggbopcacdchdecegldbeknhpeiheaf;https://clients2.google.com/service/update2/crx extensionID: hjggbopcacdchdecegldbeknhpeiheaf Edge : Use the ExtensionInstallforcelist policy https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-policies#extensioninstallforcelist Setting up Microsoft Edge policy settings on windows https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/configure-microsoft-edge Parameters : extensionID: clfnfmfdemhnmngbcgoebljponknedfj updateURL: https://edge.microsoft.com/extensionwebstorebase/v1/crx Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: How Secure Is My Data With Zipboard
Article Content: How Secure is my Data with zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Secure is my Data with zipBoard? At zipBoard, we take your data privacy and security very seriously. We are hosted in a fully-redundant data centre of tier-1 hosting providers in North America. You can also decide to host your data on a server location of your choice . (Contact us at support@zipboard.co .) All data is encrypted and transmitted via an SSL connection. We'll retain the information you store on our Services for as long as we need it to provide you with the Services. If you delete your account, we'll also delete this information. But please note: There might be some latency in deleting this information from our servers and backup storage; and We may retain this information, if necessary, to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, or enforce our agreements. Data Privacy & Application Security You can read the zipBoard privacy policy here . For any further queries, feel free to reach out to us at support@zipboard.co or contact us directly from above. Name: Why Integrate Zipboard Lambdatest
Article Content: Why do I Need to Integrate zipBoard with LambdaTest? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Why do I Need to Integrate zipBoard with LambdaTest? zipBoard is an online collaboration, visual feedback and issue tracking tool. While LambdaTest¬†is a cloud-based cross-browser testing platform that helps enterprises run web automation tests at scale (through parallel testing).¬†And now you can integrate zipBoard with LambdaTest to the best out of both worlds. zipBoard offers a review platform on the cloud to help you collaborate with your team over a web project. You can attach an image and mention suggestions, tag your collaborators, and do more with full transparency. Using zipBoard your colleagues can view every reported bug or suggestion regarding the project, and understand who is doing what? LambdaTest is a cross-browser testing tool on cloud that offers 2000+ real browsers and browser versions. You can perform both manual and automated cross-browser testing with an online Selenium Grid. LambdaTest integration with zipBoard will help you report bugs directly from LambdaTest to your zipBoard instance, in just a single click. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: How Integrate Zipboard Lambdatest
Article Content: How do I Integrate zipBoard with LambdaTest? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I Integrate zipBoard with LambdaTest? Integrate LambdaTest with zipBoard and report bugs directly from LambdaTest to your zipBoard instance, in just a single click. Step 1: Find zipBoard in LambdaTest Log in to your LambdaTest account. You would need to have Admin or User level access to see and install integrations. Select ‚ÄòIntegration‚Äô from the left navigation menu bar. This will guide you to a screen where you will find a list of 3rd party applications, available to integrate with your LambdaTest account. Under the Bug Tracker category, click on the block that says¬†‚ÄòzipBoard‚Äô. You will be routed to a screen where you need to fill up your API key. Step 2:¬†Finding API Key In zipBoard Go to your zipBoard account and click, "edit profile", by opening the drop-down menu from the top-right corner of your screen. Click on the + icon to generate your first API key if you don‚Äôt have one already. A prompt message would open up asking you to create a new API key. Click on Yes. Note: This API key will be used to authenticate your zipBoard account with third-party applications. Make sure you don‚Äôt share it with anyone. In case you feel the API key has been misplaced then you can always regenerate a new API key from zipBoard by clicking on the refresh icon under your profile settings. Step 3: Inserting the API in LambdaTest Copy the API key and paste it on LambdaTest to integrate with zipBoard and hit Install. You have successfully integrated zipBoard with LambdaTest. If you go to integrations tab you will find a green tick over the zipBoard block, indicating the integration is successful. Did this answer your question? Cleaned Article Content: How do I Integrate zipBoard with LambdaTest? - zipBoard Help How do I Integrate zipBoard with LambdaTest? Integrate LambdaTest with zipBoard and report bugs directly from LambdaTest to your zipBoard instance, in just a single click. Step 1: Find zipBoard in LambdaTest Log in to your LambdaTest account. You would need to have Admin or User level access to see and install integrations. Select ‚ÄòIntegration‚Äô from the left navigation menu bar. This will guide you to a screen where you will find a list of 3rd party applications, available to integrate with your LambdaTest account. Under the Bug Tracker category, click on the block that says¬†‚ÄòzipBoard‚Äô. You will be routed to a screen where you need to fill up your API key. Step 2:¬†Finding API Key In zipBoard Go to your zipBoard account and click, "edit profile", by opening the drop-down menu from the top-right corner of your screen. Click on the + icon to generate your first API key if you don‚Äôt have one already. A prompt message would open up asking you to create a new API key. Click on Yes. Note: This API key will be used to authenticate your zipBoard account with third-party applications. Make sure you don‚Äôt share it with anyone. In case you feel the API key has been misplaced then you can always regenerate a new API key from zipBoard by clicking on the refresh icon under your profile settings. Step 3: Inserting the API in LambdaTest Copy the API key and paste it on LambdaTest to integrate with zipBoard and hit Install. You have successfully integrated zipBoard with LambdaTest. If you go to integrations tab you will find a green tick over the zipBoard block, indicating the integration is successful. Did this answer your question? Name: How Log Bug Lambdatest Zipboard
Article Content: How to Log Your First Bug from LambdaTest to zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Log Your First Bug from LambdaTest to zipBoard? Steps to log a bug from LambdaTest to zipBoard: Log in to LambdaTest and perform any type of testing. In this case, we will go with LambdaTest's screenshot testing¬†feature under the drop-down menu for Visual UI Testing. zipBoard also provides screenshots and screen recording in-house. Select the browsers for which you wish to¬†capture a screenshot¬†of your website and provide the test URL before you hit the Capture button. Wait a few seconds and you will find your full-page screenshots for every configuration you selected. Once you have the screenshots ready, click on any screenshot and highlight the bug you wish to report. After you highlight click on the mark as bug button. A form specific to zipBoard would open up. You will need to fill in the details in this form before you create the issue. Doing so will directly mark a bug in your zipBoard instance. You can attach the details below with the screenshot: Project Assignee Task Status Task Priority Task Type Task Name Description Every detail you provide at LambdaTest will automatically be reflected in the zipBoard task. Note: After you click on ‚ÄúCreate Bug‚Äù, you will be able to observe it being successfully marked through a single click effort. You will get prompt messages on top of your Virtual Machine indicating the progress of bug logging. After few seconds you will be notified with a prompt message ‚ÄúBug successfully marked‚Äù indicating that the screenshot has been pushed to your zipBoard project. If you visit your respective Project on zipBoard, you will find a new task created under it. Open tasks of the Project and you will find the bug marked from LambdaTest with all the information you specified while your performed cross-browser testing. Click on the task and you can also find the URL to the screenshot you highlighted at LambdaTest along with the test environment details. Did this answer your question? Article Content: Adding & Using Stamps - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Adding & Using Stamps Adding your Organization's Stamp Note : You need Admin accessibility to add a stamp to your organization Select your profile icon in the top right corner and select Manage Org Select Stamps from the Organization menu on the left side of your screen Select Add in the top corner. Upload your organization's stamp, enter a name & description and select Add Using your Organization's Stamp Select the stamp option from the review toolbar Select the stamp you would like to use from the drop-down Hold and drag the stamp to move it on the content Use the checkmark , timestamp and signature tools to complete the stamp as needed Did this answer your question? Article Content: Adding & Using the Signatures in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Adding & Using the Signatures in zipBoard Add Your Signature Have an image of your signature ready . Either physically write your signature and take a photo or sign using a digital drawing tool. Select the signature icon from the review toolbar and select Add signature Select your signature file Use Your Signature in Review In the review toolbar , select the signature icon Select the signature you added Click and drag to move the signature around on the content or onto your stamp . Name: Test
Article Content: How can I set up Review Cycles in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How can I set up Review Cycles in zipBoard Setting up review cycles in zipBoard can be done using phases and by following these steps: 1. Create phases that indicate each step in your review cycle 2. Arrange the phases to reflect the sequential order (if necessary) 3. Upload content to the appropriate phase¬†to reflect where you are in your projects review process Create Phases that Indicate Each Step in Your Review Cycle In the "Uploads" view click on the button that says "Add Phase" Next give the phase a Name - here you can also optionally add a description status, and completion date to the phase - and click add Repeat the process for any of the critical points in your review cycle Here is what a potential review cycle could look like Arrange the Phases to Reflect the Sequential Order (If Necessary) If you did not create your phases in sequential order, you can re-order them by dragging and dropping them Upload Content to the Appropriate Phase to Reflect Where You are in Your Project's Review Process Under each phase, you have the option to add content to them. In a proper review cycle, it might look something like this - where at each stage in the review cycle, an updated version is uploaded to reflect the projects level of completion. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: How Do I Re Authenticate My Jira Integration
Article Content: How Do I Re-authenticate my JIRA Integration - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Do I Re-authenticate my JIRA Integration Re-authenticate your zipBoard organization's connection to JIRA so that your projects stay connected. Re-authenticating your connection to your JIRA account To re-authenticate your JIRA connection with zipBoard you need to be a Project Owner in zipBoard and an Administrator in JIRA. Click to the circular icon in the top right corner that should have the first two letters of your name in it, and click on " Manage Integration " In the " Manage Integrations " section of your organization, click the " re-authenticate " button in the JIRA display box Clicking this button will open up a new tab and bring you to a new page where you will be asked to grant zipBoard access to your Atlassian account In the new page, click the blue " Accept " button at the bottom This should grant zipBoard access to your Atlassian account and enable the re-authentication After you click on " Accept " there should be a loading screen for a few second Followed by a screen that confirms the success of your re-authentication Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: How Update Task Statuses
Article Content: Help Scout - Log In Help Scout Please login to view the requested page Log In Remember me for 30 days Log In or Sign in with Google Loading‚Ä¶ Forgot your password? Sign in with Help Scout credentials 2025 Fall Seasonal Release Collecting and Connecting Dots See What Shipped Help Scout requires JavaScript Follow these steps to enable it in your browser Google Chrome (Windows & Mac) Find the three vertical dot option in the top-right corner of your browser, and open the Settings section from there. Click the "Security and Privacy" link in the left-hand sidebar. Click the "Site Settings" option. Click the "JavaScript" option. Select "Sites can use JavaScript." Firefox (Windows & Mac) In your browser, type "about:config" in the address bar and click enter. A warning message will display on your browser; click "Accept the Risk and Continue" button to proceed. Enter "javascript.enabled" in the search box. Locate the option labeled "javascript.enabled" on the search result and select toggle to turn on JavaScript. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Microsoft Edge On the More menu (‚Ä¶), select Settings. Click the "Site permissions" option in the left-hand sidebar. Select the "JavaScript" option. Toggle the "Allow (recommended)" option to enable it. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Internet Explorer 11+ is required Upgrade For a faster, more secure browsing experience, we highly recommend installing Google Chrome or Firefox . Looking for a better way to talk with customers? Try Help Scout Close cross-small
