Name: Integrating The Zipboard API Into User Application
Article Content: Integrating the zipBoard API into User Application - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Integrating the zipBoard API into User Application Overview This document describes the steps required to integrate the zipBoard API into the user application. Following the steps will let the user application connect to the API, create Projects, insert files(URL) into zipBoard and sync the comments between zipBoard and the app. Typographic Convention Convention Description Click Edit Profile The word in box indicates a clickable object Locate the API Key section The italicized word indicates a section in the webpage *title: project name The *asterisk indicates required field The user must have one of¬†... The underlined sentence indicates a requirement for the function Authentication zipBoard uses HTTP token authentication for its API, and to get/refresh the token: 1. Log in to zipBoard and click on the User Icon in the top right corner 2. Click Edit Profile 3. Locate the API Key section in the lower portion of the page 4. Click on the ‚ûï / üîÑ to generate/refresh the API key 5. Highlight and copy the API Key and insert it into the code for authentication For more information on Authentication, please check the API Authentication and URI Structure . Adding projects Action Endpoint URI Function Create Project POST https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/projects Creates a new project for the user and returns the project data of the newly created project. Data Inputs The data type for the inputs is String, unless indicated otherwise. Header: Content-Type ‚Äòapplication/json‚Äô Authorization Authorization token from Authentication Body: *title The name of the project orgid The id of Organization in which the project should be made in description The Description for the project projectid Custom project Id for the project On completion, The request will return status code 201, along with the project data, which includes the project id of the newly created project. For more information, please check the API for Project . Adding Files (URL) The user must have one of the following roles to add files: [Owner, Manager, reviewer, Project Owner] Action Endpoint URI Function Create Files POST https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/files/ Creates a new file in the project specified. Data Inputs The data type for the inputs is String, unless indicated otherwise. Header: Content-Type ‚Äòapplication/json‚Äô Authorization Authorization token from Authentication Body: *name The name of the file *projectid The id of the project in which the file should be created in *url The URL of the file description description of the file On completion, the request will return an object with message: ‚ÄúFile successfully created‚Äù along with the file Id, reviewURL and other data. For more information, please check API for FIles (URL) . Syncing comments (task) From User Application to zipBoard The user must have one of the following role to add/update tasks: [Owner, Manager, reviewer] Action Endpoint URI Function Create Task POST https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/ Creates a new task in zipBoard Update Task PUT https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/:id Update the specified task in zipBoard Creating new Tasks Data Inputs The data type for the inputs is String, unless indicated otherwise. Header: Content-Type ‚Äòapplication/json‚Äô Authorization Authorization token from Authentication Body: *title The title of the task *projectid The id of the project in which the task should be created in type One of the 4 types of the task: ‚ÄòBug‚Äô, ‚ÄòEnhancement‚Äô, ‚ÄòFeature‚Äô, ‚ÄòTask‚Äô priority One of the 4 priority levels: ‚ÄòLow‚Äô, ‚ÄòMedium‚Äô. ‚ÄòHigh‚Äô, ‚ÄòCritical‚Äô status The task status name found in zipBoard (default status if left empty) file_id The Id of the file in which the task originates from description description of the file On completion, the request will return status code 201 along with the new task data. Updating Existing Tasks Data Inputs The data type for the inputs is String, unless indicated otherwise. Header: Content-Type ‚Äòapplication/json‚Äô Authorization Authorization token from Authentication URL Params: *id id of the task to be updated Body: At least one is required from optional Body parameters. title The title of the task type One of the 4 types of the task: ‚ÄòBug‚Äô, ‚ÄòEnhancement‚Äô, ‚ÄòFeature‚Äô, ‚ÄòTask‚Äô priority One of the 4 priority levels: ‚ÄòLow‚Äô, ‚ÄòMedium‚Äô. ‚ÄòHigh‚Äô, ‚ÄòCritical‚Äô status The task status name found in zipBoard (default status if left empty) description description of the file On completion, the request will return status code 200 along with the updated task data. From zipBoard to User Application the user must be logged in and authenticated in order to view tasks Action Endpoint URI Function Get Task GET https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/ Get the list of tasks that satisfies the condition specified. Data Inputs The data type for the inputs is String, unless indicated otherwise. Header: Content-Type ‚Äòapplication/json‚Äô Authorization Authorization token from Authentication URL Params: id id of the task to fetch Body: fileid or/and projectid is required projectid The project to fetch the list of tasks fileid The file to fetch the list of tasks priority One of the 4 priority levels: ‚ÄòLow‚Äô, ‚ÄòMedium‚Äô. ‚ÄòHigh‚Äô, ‚ÄòCritical‚Äô status The task status name found in zipBoard (default status if left empty) type One of the 4 types of the task: ‚ÄòBug‚Äô, ‚ÄòEnhancement‚Äô, ‚ÄòFeature‚Äô, ‚ÄòTask On completion, the request will return status code 200 along with data (array), which can be used to update/add comments in the user application. For more information, please check API for Issues (Task) . To find out more about the features of zipBoard API, please visit the zipBoard API Documentation page . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Kanban View For Content
Article Content: Is there a Kanban View for My Content? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Is there a Kanban View for My Content? The latest September update for 2022 now provides our users with a Kanban view for their content. This lets you visualize your content as it moves along the different phases. Just like how it is in our task dashboard . Let‚Äôs see how this will look on your browser! Kanban View for Content Kanban boards are a great way to organize items into different phases. So, we‚Äôre excited to bring the kanban view to manage the content. Now you will notice that this is the default view for content, instead of the grid view. The table view still exists and you can toggle between the two. This is a similar interface you‚Äôve been using in tasks . Easy to use and intuitive, our new Kanban update will help you organize content better. With this update, you no longer have to deal with stagnant cards that cannot be reorganized quickly! With every upload having its content card, you can easily drag and drop based on your project's workflow. The status, due date and assignee info are shown in the content cards while you‚Äôre in the Kanban view. We've added phase columns to organize your content workflow. These columns allow you to visualize the content in different phases. Move content between phases directly from the Kanban board To create a more complete online proofing tool , we‚Äôve provided the ability to seamlessly add phases to content. And this can also be done directly through the Kanban board. In the Kanban board, simply select the piece of content then drag and drop it to the phase of your choice. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Assign Phases To Content
Article Content: Help Scout - Log In Help Scout Please login to view the requested page Log In Remember me for 30 days Log In or Sign in with Google Loading‚Ä¶ Forgot your password? Sign in with Help Scout credentials 2025 Fall Seasonal Release Collecting and Connecting Dots See What Shipped Help Scout requires JavaScript Follow these steps to enable it in your browser Google Chrome (Windows & Mac) Find the three vertical dot option in the top-right corner of your browser, and open the Settings section from there. Click the "Security and Privacy" link in the left-hand sidebar. Click the "Site Settings" option. Click the "JavaScript" option. Select "Sites can use JavaScript." Firefox (Windows & Mac) In your browser, type "about:config" in the address bar and click enter. A warning message will display on your browser; click "Accept the Risk and Continue" button to proceed. Enter "javascript.enabled" in the search box. Locate the option labeled "javascript.enabled" on the search result and select toggle to turn on JavaScript. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Microsoft Edge On the More menu (‚Ä¶), select Settings. Click the "Site permissions" option in the left-hand sidebar. Select the "JavaScript" option. Toggle the "Allow (recommended)" option to enable it. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Internet Explorer 11+ is required Upgrade For a faster, more secure browsing experience, we highly recommend installing Google Chrome or Firefox . Looking for a better way to talk with customers? Try Help Scout Close cross-small

Name: Assign Statuses To Content
Article Content: Can You Assign Statuses to Content? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can You Assign Statuses to Content? The latest September update for 2022 now provides our users with a content manager, similar to the one you‚Äôve been using for tasks . This new content manager will ensure that you have a holistic online proofing experience with each content now having its development phase, status, due date, assignee, description, and so on. You get the gist. Now let‚Äôs see how you can assign status to content using this content manager. Assign statuses to each content Simply click on any uploaded content. There you see a dropdown next to STATUS‚Äù where you can select the status you want to assign the content. Did you know that you can now have customized task statuses? Check here ‚û° There are four statuses for content in zipBoard: Open Approved Rejected In Progress You can also check the status along with the due date and assignee info in the content cards while you‚Äôre in the Kanban view. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Assign Content To Multiple Collaborators
Article Content: Can You Assign One Content to Multiple Collaborators? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can You Assign One Content to Multiple Collaborators? Yes , unlike tasks, you can assign one content to multiple collaborators in zipBoard. The latest September update for 2022 now provides our users with a content manager, similar to the one you‚Äôve been using for tasks . This new content manager will ensure that you have a holistic online proofing experience with each content now having its development phase, status, due date, assignee, description, and so on. You get the gist. Now let‚Äôs see how you can assign one content to multiple collaborators using this content manager. Assign content to multiple collaborators Simply click on any uploaded content. There you see a dropdown below ‚ÄúASSIGNED TO‚Äù where you can select the collaborator you want to assign the content. Something you can‚Äôt even do in the task manager ! You can also check the assignees along with the due date and status info in the content cards while you‚Äôre in the Kanban view. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: What Happens To Content If Delete Phase
Article Content: What happens to the content if I delete a phase? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What happens to the content if I delete a phase? The latest September update for 2022 provides the ability to seamlessly add phases to content . This can now be done while adding the content, through the content manager or the Kanban board. You can also visualize the development stage of your content better as it moves along the different phases using the Kanban board for your content . Creating Phases for Content Before deleting phases, let‚Äôs see how you can create new phases in zipBoard. Here‚Äôs how you can add content phases: Deleting Phases You can delete the phases directly from the Kanban board. Just click on the trashcan icon on the side of the phase you wish to delete. A pop-up will appear asking you to assign the content in the phase to another existing phase. Once you‚Äôve done that, you‚Äôre good to go ahead! Check out the video below, which will quickly show you the entire process. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Contact Us Contact Us Last updated on December 11, 2023 Related Articles Can You Assign One Content to Multiple Collaborators? Can You Assign Statuses to Content? Name: What Are Content Uploads
Article Content: What are Content Uploads? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What are Content Uploads? There are 5 different types of Content that can be uploaded into zipBoard for you to review and annotate on. 1. URLs 2. PDFs 3. Images 4. Videos 5. ZIP Files Each time you add any of the types of Content mentioned above to zipBoard, that counts as a Content Upload. Did this answer your question? ZIP Files Each time you add any of the types of Content mentioned above to zipBoard, that counts as a Content Upload. Did this answer your question? Name: I Cannot Play My Scorm File With Zipboard What Can Be The Issue
Article Content: I cannot play my SCORM file with zipBoard. What can be the issue? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I cannot play my SCORM file with zipBoard. What can be the issue? Firstly, try playing your SCORM directly in the browser, if it‚Äôs all well in the browser then please check your SCORM folder hierarchy for the start file. Make sure that the start file for your SCORM should exist in the top level folder only (not inside any subfolder); if not then we won‚Äôt be able to play such a file. Still not able to play your file with zipBoard; share it with us here . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: What Are Managers
Article Content: What are Managers? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What are Managers? üìå For new updates, please read What is the role of a "Manager"? A manager in you organization can help keep your projects organized. Managers in zipBoard have control over everything on the project level of the organization. Managers have the authority to: 1. Create and delete projects 2. Add and remove others to their projects 3. Upload content into projects for reviewal 4.¬†Create phases in projects 5.¬†View reports related to the project Did this answer your question? Name: Does Zipboard Have Sso
Article Content: Does zipBoard have Single Sign-On (SSO)? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Does zipBoard have Single Sign-On (SSO)? Yes zipBoard supports Single Sign-On (SSO). Currently it is only available for accounts that have Enterprise access. If you would like to use SSO for your organization, please contact us and we can help you set it up. Did this answer your question? Name: Requirements For Course Uploads In Zipboard
Article Content: Requirements for course uploads in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Requirements for course uploads in zipBoard Requirements for course uploads in zipBoard zipBoard is a review and approval tool that embeds annotations on webpages, courses, PDF documents, videos, etc. For standard formats like PDF and videos, zipBoard is able to tag comments on the exact location because of an easy way to identify the location of those tags. But, for webpages and courses, we are dependent on the HTML / coding structure of that webpage. While we have tried to include and test on many different authoring tools, supporting every authoring tool, where the tech does not have the specific APIs exposed, we are unable to get the tagging to work. For comments to work in zipBoard directly on the courses or webpages , zipBoard needs the following information: a unique URL for every page to reflect change in contentor a Webpage to expose an API in global scope to read/set current locatione.g. window.getPageId, window.setPageId ( this information varies for different authoring tools or webpages- and we have had to engineer this to cover as many as cases as possible ) Annotation positioning relies on element IDs and class names. So it‚Äôs required for elements to have unique IDs/class names for correct positioning. i.e. if a course changes content of the page without changing URL or exposing JavaScript API for reading location and elements that don't have unique id/class name annotation might appear on top of the wrong element. There are courses authored in some authoring tools, which do not give any of this information, in that case, the users have to resort to taking a screenshot manually and then adding annotations. Status for specific Authoring tools Courses created in the following authoring tools where annotations work directly: Rise ( Articulate ) Adobe Captivate GOMO Courses created in the following authoring tools, do not work with directly tagging annotations, and require screenshots to be taken: Articulate 360 Articulate Storyline Elucidat Adapt Please note, these are the authoring tools that we have tested with, if there are any other specific ones that you would like us to test, feel free to share the content. Requirements for courses to work in zipBoard player: We do not really mandate having any tracking standards for courses to work in zipBoard. But, sometimes, the published course requires them to be enabled for the course to work properly. If the course engine requires any of these standards to finish a course, our player also requires the same. The following standards have been tested in our player: *SCORM 1.2 / 2004 *TinCan API For any other information, please feel free to reach out at support@zipboard.co Did this answer your question? Name: So Ive Been Given A Zipboard Share Link Now What
Article Content: So I've been given a zipBoard share link, now what? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact So I've been given a zipBoard share link, now what? So, someone using zipBoard has created a project and uploaded a file that they need your help with reviewing. They've sent you a share link but you're not sure what that means or what to do with it. Share Links Share links are a quick and easy way for zipBoard users to get feedback from their users. While all share links will give you access to view the file, they have different tiers of accessibility. Required Signup/Login View the Document along with other reviewer's comments View the document and add your own comments. These three settings can be combined to create 6 unique different kinds of reviewer accessibility: View All Boards/Reviews Only Access Add New Boards/Reviews Only Access View All and Add New Boards/Comments Access Required Signup/Login and View All Boards/Comments Access Required Signup/Login and Add New Boards/Comments Access Required Signup/Login,¬†View All and Add New Boards/Comments Access The accessibility¬†level should be provided to you by the zipBoard user who sent you the share link - when in doubt revert back to them. Click here for further information on these permissions Using Share Links to Review Uploads To launch your review, click on the share link. Depending on the upload type shared with you, you may be asked to download a browser plugin. In the event that a plugin is required,¬†clicking on the green "Install Chrome Extension" button in the middle of your screen will launch the extension store where you can download our plugin for free. Once downloaded, go back to the tab that you pasted the URL in and click refresh, or relaunch the URL from the email you received. Now you should be able to see the upload, along with zipBoard's review tools in the frame. If this is your first time using zipBoard there will be a quick walkthrough explaining the tool. Once you have finished with the onboarding messaging you're ready to start using zipBoard for your review. The comments you make while reviewing the upload will be translated as tasks to the members of the project, all you have to do is write down what you think needs to be revised. If you want more information on the different types of tools that zipBoard has to offer, click here . Did this answer your question? Name: The Various Permissions You Can Grant When Using Share Links
Article Content: The Various Permissions You Can Grant When Using Share Links in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact The Various Permissions You Can Grant When Using Share Links in zipBoard üìå For new updates, please read this help article. So you've uploaded something into zipBoard and want external users to be able to review it with you too. The simplest way to do this is via share links. What are Share Links? üîó Share Links are unique URLs generated by zipBoard that allow external users to review a specific upload without needing full project access. üëâ To create a share link: Open the file you want to share. Click the "Share" button in the top-right corner. A pop-up will appear, displaying different sharing permissions . üìå These permissions help control what external users can view or edit. Three Types of Share Link Permissions Require Signup/Login Guests have to create an account in zipBoard. Toggle the options as per your requirement to share files. ‚úÖ¬†Use this option for secure collaboration where authentication is required. View All Boards/Reviews If you enable the toggle for this option, the obtained share link for your project would allow your clients to view all previous boards and comments , and add their respective comments and tasks. For guests , they have limited capabilities. While they can view the content and existing comments, they are unable to add annotations . Their participation is limited to adding comments only. ‚úÖ¬†Use this option when sharing full project context with external stakeholders. Add New Boards/Review If you enable the toggle for this option, the obtained share link for your project would allow your clients, and guests to start a fresh review; where they can click new screens and add annotations or comments to them . But, they won't be able to see any previously added screens or comments. ‚úÖ¬†Ideal for situations where feedback is needed on fresh versions without prior context. Enabling Different Permissions Simultaneously You can combine different permissions when generating a Share Link : ‚úÖ View All Boards/Reviews + Add New Boards/Reviews: Reviewers can see previous feedback AND add new annotations . ‚úÖ Require Signup/Login + View All Boards/Reviews: Only logged-in users can view all feedback . ‚úÖ Require Signup/Login + Add New Boards/Reviews: Only logged-in users can provide new feedback without seeing existing comments. ‚úÖ Require Signup/Login + View All + Add New: Full access with required login for complete security and collaboration . üìå To manage permissions for existing Share Links, go to the "Share Links" section in the pop-up. Managing Your Share Links Once a Share Link is created, you can: ‚úÖ View and track existing share links. ‚úÖ Modify permissions as needed. ‚úÖ Revoke access by deleting a share link. üîπ For a detailed breakdown of managing Share Links, click here . Next Steps üöÄ Learn more about file sharing and collaboration with the related article below ‚¨áÔ∏è üîπ Try zipBoard Today! Ready to enhance external collaboration? Request a Demo to explore secure file sharing. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Managing Share Links
Article Content: Managing Share Links - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Managing Share Links üìå For new updates, please read this help article. So you've shared a file with your external collaborators but can't remember which permission level you sent to who. There's an easy way to manage the share links all in one place. How to Manage Share Links in zipBoard 1Ô∏è‚É£ Open the Share Links Panel Locate the file you previously shared. In the pop-up, navigate to the "Share Links" section in the top menu. In the "Share Links" section you will be shown all the various types of share links that you have generated. Each link will be indicative a different combination of permission settings as described through the use of icons: Icon Meaning üîë Arrow Through a Door Users must sign up/log in to access the file. üí¨ Chat Bubbles Users can add comments and annotations . üëÄ Eye Icon Users can view existing comments and annotations . If the icon is in green, that means that it is one of the permissions that have been enabled for the associated share link on the left in the Shared URL section. Deleting Share Links In the event that one of your share links get compromised, or you want to restrict ongoing access to an upload, you can delete it by clicking on the red trash can icon. This will delete the share link from your zipBoard project and doing so means that recipients of that share link will no longer have access via that link. üìå¬†Use this feature to revoke access instantly and maintain control over your files. Best Practices for Managing Share Links üîπ Use Expiry Dates ‚Äì Set expiration dates for temporary access. üîπ Limit Guest Access ‚Äì Avoid giving full visibility unless necessary. üîπ Review Permissions Regularly ‚Äì Ensure the right users have the right level of access. Next Steps üöÄ Want to learn more? Check out these related articles below ‚¨áÔ∏è üîπ Try zipBoard Today! Ready to streamline your client collaboration? How to Manage Share Links in zipBoard 1Ô∏è‚É£ Open the Share Links Panel Locate the file you previously shared. In the pop-up, navigate to the "Share Links" section in the top menu. In the "Share Links" section you will be shown all the various types of share links that you have generated. Each link will be indicative a different combination of permission settings as described through the use of icons: Icon Meaning üîë Arrow Through a Door Users must sign up/log in to access the file. üí¨ Chat Bubbles Users can add comments and annotations . üëÄ Eye Icon Users can view existing comments and annotations . If the icon is in green, that means that it is one of the permissions that have been enabled for the associated share link on the left in the Shared URL section. Deleting Share Links In the event that one of your share links get compromised, or you want to restrict ongoing access to an upload, you can delete it by clicking on the red trash can icon. This will delete the share link from your zipBoard project and doing so means that recipients of that share link will no longer have access via that link. üìå¬†Use this feature to revoke access instantly and maintain control over your files. Best Practices for Managing Share Links üîπ Use Expiry Dates ‚Äì Set expiration dates for temporary access. üîπ Limit Guest Access ‚Äì Avoid giving full visibility unless necessary. üîπ Review Permissions Regularly ‚Äì Ensure the right users have the right level of access. Next Steps üöÄ Want to learn more? Check out these related articles below ‚¨áÔ∏è üîπ Try zipBoard Today! Ready to streamline your client collaboration? Request a Demo and explore seamless file sharing. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: I Just Uploaded A Captivate Scorm File But Could Not Access It Using Zipboard What Can Be The Issue
Article Content: I just uploaded a captivate SCORM file, but could not access it using zipBoard. What can be the issue? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I just uploaded a captivate SCORM file, but could not access it using zipBoard. What can be the issue? For captivate files, please make sure that reporting feature is turned off for your SCORM package. If the reporting feature is on please turn it off, then upload the new SCORM file to zipBoard, It should work fine. If this is not the case then you can contact us at support@zipboard.co Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Annotate Content Without Using Extension
Article Content: Can I Annotate Content Without Using the Extension? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can I Annotate Content Without Using the Extension? Yes , with our new embedded annotations update , you can now annotate content without using the extension. This lets you review content such as PDFs, images, videos, and SCORM content without having to download and use the zipBoard extension . And do not worry this will not change your workflow or affect any other features . You‚Äôre not missing out on any functionality nor does it affect your workflow whatsoever. All of our annotation tools work even without the extension so we‚Äôre not cutting any corners here. With the same features as with the extension, you or your client will not experience any limitation or change in task/content management, collaboration features, feedback collection, etc. You get the gist. This isn‚Äôt something you install or setup separately. It works straight out of the box. But if you want to see how to review content using the embedded annotations, check the quick video below. Name: Another Way To Receive Client Feedback
Article Content: My clients aren‚Äôt comfortable downloading a browser extension, is there another way to receive feedback? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact My clients aren‚Äôt comfortable downloading a browser extension, is there another way to receive feedback? Yes! We‚Äôve had countless users telling us how their client feedback and collaboration process would greatly benefit from having an extension-free review experience. So, we got down to it and released embedded annotations . With embedded annotations, we‚Äôve removed the hassle of downloading an extension every time feedback is needed from a new client. Simply share the content as you would, the client can now directly add their feedback with no friction whatsoever and without affecting any other feature/workflow. This doesn‚Äôt change any functionality, feature, or workflow that you might have set. All this does is removes the barrier between technical and non-technical stakeholders. And this isn‚Äôt something you install or setup separately. It works straight out of the box. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Difference Between Embedded Annotations And Browser Extension
Article Content: Difference Between the Embedded Annotations and Browser Extension. - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Difference Between the Embedded Annotations and Browser Extension. The only major difference between embedded annotations and the browser extension is that you no longer have to download and use the zipBoard extension using embedded annotations ! Currently, you can review content such as PDFs, images, videos, MP3, URLs, and SCORM using embedded annotations. You do not have to download an extension for this, nor do you have to set this up. This works straight out of the box. Embedded annotations will not change your workflow or affect any other features. You‚Äôre not missing out on any functionality nor does it affect your workflow whatsoever. With the same features as with the extension, you or your client will not experience any limitation or change in task/content management, collaboration features, feedback collection, etc. You get the gist. To sum it up, embedded annotation is nothing but a more seamless and secure extension-free review experience. Did this answer your question? Name: Ive Been Given A Share Link With View All Boards Comments Only Access
Article Content: I've been given a share link with View All Boards/Reviews Only access, now what? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I've been given a share link with View All Boards/Reviews Only access, now what? üìå For new updates, please read this help article. View All Boards/Comments Only Access If you enable the toggle for this option, the obtained share link for your project would allow your clients to view all previous boards and comments, and add their respective comments and tasks. For guests , share links that have View All Boards/Comments Only Access mean that you can view the content of the upload that has been shared with you, as well as the comments and annotations of others who have reviewed the upload. This means that you will most likely see Pencil Drawings, Highlighted text, Boxes, and Arrows on the upload - along with their associated comments - but you WILL NOT be able to create those annotations on your own. If you're not sure what kind of share link you've been given, it's always best to contact the person who shared the link with you to double check the permissions they have enabled for you. For more information on other types of share link access, click here . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Article Content: I've been given a share link with Add New Boards/Reviews Only access, now what? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I've been given a share link with Add New Boards/Reviews Only access, now what? üìå For new updates, please read this help article. Add New Boards/Reviews Only Access Share links that have¬†Add New Boards/Reviews Only Access¬†mean that you can view the content of the upload that has been shared with you, as well as create your own annotations and comments on the upload. This means that, while you won't be able to see what other reviewers have said about the upload, you will be able to provide your input/feedback on the upload. If you're not sure what kind of share link you've been given, it's always best to contact the person who shared the link with you to double check the permissions they have enabled for you. Article Content: I've been given a share link with View All + Add New Boards/Reviews access, now what? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I've been given a share link with View All + Add New Boards/Reviews access, now what? üìå For new updates, please read this help article. View All &¬†Add New Boards/Reviews¬†Access Share links that have View All & Add New Boards/Comments Only Access mean that you can view the content of the upload that has been shared with you, as well as the comments and annotations of others who have reviewed the upload. You will also be able to¬†create your own annotations and comments on the upload. This means that you will most likely see Pencil Drawings, Highlighted text, Boxes, and Arrows on the upload - along with their associated comments - AND you will be able to create those annotations and comments on your own. If you're not sure what kind of share link you've been given, it's always best to contact the person who shared the link with you to double check the permissions they have enabled for you. Name: Ive Been Given A Share Link With Required Signup Login And View All Boards Comments Access Now What
Article Content: I've been given a share link with Required Signup/Login + View All Boards/Comments access, now what? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I've been given a share link with Required Signup/Login + View All Boards/Comments access, now what? If you enable the toggle for this option, the obtained share link for your project would allow your clients to view all previous boards and comments, and add their respective comments and tasks. For guests , share links that have View All Boards/Comments Only Access mean that you can view the content of the upload that has been shared with you, as well as the comments and annotations of others who have reviewed the upload. This means that you will most likely see Pencil Drawings, Highlighted text, Boxes, and Arrows on the upload - along with their associated comments - but you WILL NOT be able to create those annotations on your own. If you're not sure what kind of share link you've been given, it's always best to contact the person who shared the link with you to double check the permissions they have enabled for you. Cleaned Article Content: I've been given a share link with Required Signup/Login + View All Boards/Comments access, now what? - zipBoard Help I've been given a share link with Required Signup/Login + View All Boards/Comments access, now what? If you enable the toggle for this option, the obtained share link for your project would allow your clients to view all previous boards and comments, and add their respective comments and tasks. For guests , share links that have View All Boards/Comments Only Access mean that you can view the content of the upload that has been shared with you, as well as the comments and annotations of others who have reviewed the upload. This means that you will most likely see Pencil Drawings, Highlighted text, Boxes, and Arrows on the upload - along with their associated comments - but you WILL NOT be able to create those annotations on your own. If you're not sure what kind of share link you've been given, it's always best to contact the person who shared the link with you to double check the permissions they have enabled for you. For more information on other types of share link access, click here . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Ive Been Given A Share Link With Required Signup Login And Add New Boards Reviews Access Now What
Article Content: I've been given a share link with Required Signup/Login + Add New Boards/Reviews access, now what? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I've been given a share link with Required Signup/Login + Add New Boards/Reviews access, now what? Share links that have Required Signup/Login and View All Boards/Comments Access mean that you must sign up and sign in to a zipBoard account to gain access to the upload that you have been assigned to review. Once logged in, you can view¬†the content of the upload that has been shared with you, as well as create your own annotations and comments on the upload. This means that, while you won't be able to see what other reviewers have said about the upload, you will be able to provide your input/feedback on the upload. If you're not sure what kind of share link you've been given, it's always best to contact the person who shared the link with you to double check the permissions they have enabled for you. For more information on other types of share link access, click here . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: The Different Ways To Invite Reviewers To Get Feedback On Content Or Documents In Zipboard
Article Content: The Different Ways to Invite Reviewers to Get Feedback on Digital Assets - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact The Different Ways to Invite Reviewers to Get Feedback on Digital Assets zipBoard is a collaboration and project management tool that helps teams to organize and streamline their workflow. One of the key features of zipBoard is the ability to get feedback on content or documents. In order to get valuable feedback from reviewers, it's important to understand what kind of reviewers you can have, and how to invite them in the right way. Here are the three broad categories in which reviewers fall under Collaborators Clients Guest Collaborators Collaborators Collaborators are typically members of your team who need to have greater access to your project beyond simply reviewing. They can upload content into your project, as well assign tasks/be assigned tasks in your project. Here are different ways to invite Collaborators in zipBoard: Adding them directly to the project - when you are working on a project, there is a Collaborators section on the left side toolbar. Here you will be able to select Collaborators, and then enter their email address. This is the most common method of inviting Collaborator reviewers to provide feedback. zipBoard allows you to send an email invitation directly from the platform to your Collaborator reviewers. This is an easy and convenient way to invite Collaborator reviewers and get started with the feedback process. Send them a project share link - you can copy a share link from the same¬†Collaborators section on the left side toolbar when you click on the "Add Client" button. This link can be shared with your reviewers through email, chat or any other communication channel. The reviewers can then access the¬†project¬†as a Collaborator¬†and provide their feedback directly in zipBoard. Click here for a step by step guide on how to invite Collaborators to your project Clients Clients are typically your external stakeholders that need to be in the loop with your project. In zipBoard, they will only be able to see individual uploads that you enable access to, but they will not be able to add any additional uploads to the project. They will have access to comment and annotate on those uploads once given permission, as well as have the ability to send messages to the project team in zipBoard in the event that they want to delegate tasks further. Here are different ways to invite Clients in zipBoard: Adding Them Directly to the Project - when you are working on a project, there is a Collaborators section on the left side toolbar. Here you will be able to select Client, and then enter their email address. This is the most common method of inviting Client reviewers to provide feedback. zipBoard allows you to send an email invitation directly from the platform to your Client reviewers. This is an easy and convenient way to invite Client reviewers and get started with the feedback process. Send Them a Project Share Link - you can copy a share link from the same¬†Collaborators section on the left side toolbar when you click on the "Add Client" button. This link can be shared with your reviewers through email, chat or any other communication channel. The reviewers can then access the project¬†as a Client and provide their feedback directly in zipBoard. Click here to learn more about the Client role and watch a step by step guide on how to invite Client's to your project Guest Collaborators Guest Collaborators are typically people who you want to be able to review your uploaded content, without having any access to the project that the content is in. You simply just want their feedback. Guest Collaborators cannot alter your project in any way. They cannot upload into your project, or assign tasks to Collaborators in your project. Here are different ways to invite Guest Collaborators in zipBoard: Email Invitation - This is the most common method of inviting reviewers to provide feedback. zipBoard allows you to send an email invitation directly from the platform to your reviewers. You can enter the email addresses of the reviewers and send them an email with a link to the document or content that you want feedback on. This is an easy and convenient way to invite reviewers and get started with the feedback process. Send Them a Content Share Link - zipBoard also allows you to create a shared link for your document or content. This link can be shared with your reviewers through email, chat or any other communication channel. The reviewers can then access the document or content using the shared link and provide their feedback directly in zipBoard. Click here to see how you can add Guest Collaborators, and change their permission settings. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Contact Us Contact Us Last updated on August 29, 2024 Related Articles Guides for zipBoard Users Adding a collaborator or reviewer account Getting Started as a Collaborator How can I add collaborators to my project? How are Guest Collaborators different from Guest Reviewers? How can I remove collaborators from my project? Name: Annotation Tools Backup
Article Content: Annotation Tools Backup - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Annotation Tools Backup üìå For new updates, please read Streamlining PDF Collaboration with our Latest Tools! or What are the Annotation Tools in zipBoard? At zipBoard, we put a lot of emphasis on asynchronous collaboration , but that does not have to be on spreadsheets and team messages only. You can take your content and document collaboration further with annotations. Leave notes directly on your websites , videos , images , courses , and PDF documents - so that all communication is in-context and everyone stays in sync. This feature is available to all users for many different content types. You will need to download a one-time browser plugin to use the annotation features. Soon, for some content types, you will not need the browser plugin. Here‚Äôs a short video explaining the various annotation tools: Adding annotations To start adding annotations to existing content, you first add content to your project . After clicking Review on the content added, you will see the annotation and commenting tools on the left. You can pick any of the tools to start drawing or simply add comments. By default, the annotation tools will be displayed on the left side of your screen. This review bar is easily draggable. You can drag and place it anywhere on your content. Allowing you to review the content with no impediment. The various annotation tools at your disposal Now that we know how you can start your review for a file, let‚Äôs talk about all the annotation tools. So, here are the tools that you can use to review your content. A. Comment Let‚Äôs talk about the first tool in your arsenal. The comment tool. This is the simplest tool to leave contextual feedback on any content. To use the tool, simply click on the second icon which once hovered over spells, ‚ÄúComment‚Äù. Once you click it, it will turn green which means now you are ready to add comments/feedback on your content using the comment tool. Now click anywhere on the file to add a comment. You‚Äôll notice that there‚Äôs a checkbox, ‚ÄúAdd as task‚Äù. If you untick this, your feedback will simply go in the comment section and will not be added as a task . Although you will have an option to add it as a task later on from within the dashboard. Once you‚Äôre ready, simply type your feedback and hit send. zipBoard will record your feedback. With a dot a signify its placement, we‚Äôve found that our users love this the most. But fret not, there are many more tools designed specifically to match our user‚Äôs unique use cases. B. Pencil Moving on to our next tool. To use the pencil tool, simply select the third icon, pencil. And as you might have guessed, you can now start using this review tool like a pencil. (I‚Äôve personally found it interesting trying to write one's name with it. But we‚Äôre deviating.) Here, we have 2 options in the Pencil, 1. Pencil mode Once you‚Äôve selected the tool, simply click and drag your cursor to draw. The pencil tool can be used to circle, underline or even highlight elements (more on this soon) within the content. After you've drawn, a comment box will appear to add the annotation. Click ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù to save the annotation on your content. The user can also select the thickness of the pencil from the toolbar 2. Highlight mode(with pencil) When the user wants to highlight some image/text we can use this highlight mode with a pencil, you can also select the thickness of the highlighter C. Highlighter Why use the pencil tool when we have a dedicated annotation tool to highlight content? You‚Äôll find the highlighter just below the pencil tool.¬†Once you‚Äôve selected the tool, you can click and drag on any text on the screen to highlight the section. Release your cursor and a comment box will appear. Simply hit submit and your desired text will be highlighted. Note: The highlighter tool can only be used on text. Sometimes, you need to point your feedback to a specific element. And for this, we have an arrow tool in zipBoard. So, the collaborators never miss your targeted feedback. To use the tool, click on the tool with an arrow. You can then drag your cursor to the¬†object where you want the arrow to point. Release your cursor and a comment box will appear. Add your comment and click on the small green button on the right to save it. E. Rectangle This tool as its name suggests allows you to provide comments on an area of the screen. Some users call it the area tool. To use the rectangle tool, select the rectangle icon on the review bar. On the screen, click where you want the rectangle to start, hold and drag your cursor to draw the rectangle and then release it once you‚Äôve enclosed the area. A comment box will appear where you can add your feedback. Add your comment and click on the green button to save it. F. Easer The eraser is used to remove/delete annotations without removing the comment associated with them. To use the eraser tool, select the eraser icon below the rectangle and click on the annotation you want to remove. If you want to remove the comment associated with the annotation, simply click the trash icon at the top right of each individual comment. This will remove the annotation as well as the comment.Note: If you have selected any annotation but haven‚Äôt added the comment yet, then pressing the ‚ÄúESC‚Äù of your PC will remove it. G. Screenshot There are times when you just have to take a screenshot. This screenshot tool can be used to capture the screen you are on. There are two ways you can capture the screen. I. Visible area screenshot If you want to capture the area which is visible on your screen then click this option. It will take the shot, process it and will open a new section called screens where you will see the screenshot taken. You can then use the different annotations available to start your review right on the screenshot. II. Full page screenshot We‚Äôve all been there. We‚Äôve wanted to grab a fullscreen screenshot without having the proper means to do so. Now if you want to capture the full page then click this option. It will take the shot, process it and will save it in a new section where you will see the full page screenshot taken. There you can use the different annotations available to start your review right on the full screenshot. III. Record video Chances are you want to explain specific issues to a client or a team member, showing them exactly how a site performs or how you want it to perform. For this, we have a recording tool which you can use to record the screen and yourself with audio, for better context. To record the video, just select the record video option. This will open up an interface where you will find multiple recording features. Make sure the ‚ÄúRecordvideo‚Äù option is selected. Set the settings i.e. record microphone or audio as per your choice. Then click on ‚ÄúRecordvideo‚Äù. This will open up a UI from Chrome where you will be required to select the screen for recording. Select from the screen or window option and click ‚ÄúShare‚Äù. It will start the recording. Once the recording is done, then click on ‚ÄúStopsharing‚Äù. It will process the video and will open it up in a new window where you will be able to play your recorded video and add annotations . H. Slideshow Now that we‚Äôve provided a lot of contextual feedback and annotations, it‚Äôs time to look at it from a high-level view.¬†The slideshow function allows you to see all of your screenshots, screen recordings and comments. You can also add annotations and comments in the slideshow view! I. Hide/Un-hide pop-ups Content with multiple collaborators is bound to have numerous valuable feedback. However, they can often impede your view of the content itself.¬†If the comments are blocking the content on your file then you can easily hide them. Just click on ‚ÄúHide‚Äù to close all the popups. Don‚Äôt worry! Your feedbacks are still there. And is just a click away from you. So, if you want all the comments back then click ‚ÄúUnhide‚Äù which will make them visible once again. J. Device mode At zipBoard, we recognize the importance of responsive sites. This is why you can review your content in the device type you want to review it.¬†In this mode, you will be able to review your content in the multiple available device modes. To use it click on the ‚ÄúDevice mode‚Äù option. You will see a dropdown on the top of your screen. Click on the drop-down and it will show you a list of all available devices that you can select to review your content. Simply selecting the device will emulate the screen in the same size as the device chosen. You can then take a screenshot/video and change the option from ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù to ‚ÄúReview‚Äù. On browse, you can scroll through the screen. Once you take the screenshot/video in the review mode, you will be able to add multiple annotations to review your file. If you want to exit from device mode, then simply click on ‚ÄúCross‚Äù showing right next to the dropdown. Comment count & Reply count The other thing that you‚Äôll see is that there is a comment counter on the right side of the screen. Displaying the total count of the comments added. These comments will however not reflect the replies to individual comments. Meaning, that if you reply to any comment, the comment counter will not change. You will instead notice a different counter for individual comments, keeping tabs on the number of replies to it. The default value is set to 1, which is the comment. We can set the content status from here as 1. Open 2. Approved 3. Rejected 4. In-progress J.Toggle disable comments we can add only annotation without comment using this option If you have any doubts or questions, feel free to reach out to us at support@zipboard.co. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Soon, for some content types, you will not need the browser plugin. Here‚Äôs a short video explaining the various annotation tools: Adding annotations To start adding annotations to existing content, you first add content to your project . After clicking Review on the content added, you will see the annotation and commenting tools on the left. You can pick any of the tools to start drawing or simply add comments. By default, the annotation tools will be displayed on the left side of your screen. This review bar is easily draggable. You can drag and place it anywhere on your content. Allowing you to review the content with no impediment. The various annotation tools at your disposal Now that we know how you can start your review for a file, let‚Äôs talk about all the annotation tools. So, here are the tools that you can use to review your content. A. Comment Let‚Äôs talk about the first tool in your arsenal. The comment tool. This is the simplest tool to leave contextual feedback on any content. To use the tool, simply click on the second icon which once hovered over spells, ‚ÄúComment‚Äù. Once you click it, it will turn green which means now you are ready to add comments/feedback on your content using the comment tool. Now click anywhere on the file to add a comment. You‚Äôll notice that there‚Äôs a checkbox, ‚ÄúAdd as task‚Äù. If you untick this, your feedback will simply go in the comment section and will not be added as a task . Although you will have an option to add it as a task later on from within the dashboard. Once you‚Äôre ready, simply type your feedback and hit send. zipBoard will record your feedback. With a dot a signify its placement, we‚Äôve found that our users love this the most. But fret not, there are many more tools designed specifically to match our user‚Äôs unique use cases. B. Pencil Moving on to our next tool. To use the pencil tool, simply select the third icon, pencil. And as you might have guessed, you can now start using this review tool like a pencil. (I‚Äôve personally found it interesting trying to write one's name with it. But we‚Äôre deviating.) Here, we have 2 options in the Pencil, 1. Pencil mode Once you‚Äôve selected the tool, simply click and drag your cursor to draw. The pencil tool can be used to circle, underline or even highlight elements (more on this soon) within the content. After you've drawn, a comment box will appear to add the annotation. Click ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù to save the annotation on your content. The user can also select the thickness of the pencil from the toolbar 2. Highlight mode(with pencil) When the user wants to highlight some image/text we can use this highlight mode with a pencil, you can also select the thickness of the highlighter C. Highlighter Why use the pencil tool when we have a dedicated annotation tool to highlight content? You‚Äôll find the highlighter just below the pencil tool.¬†Once you‚Äôve selected the tool, you can click and drag on any text on the screen to highlight the section. Release your cursor and a comment box will appear. Simply hit submit and your desired text will be highlighted. Note: The highlighter tool can only be used on text. Sometimes, you need to point your feedback to a specific element. And for this, we have an arrow tool in zipBoard. So, the collaborators never miss your targeted feedback. To use the tool, click on the tool with an arrow. You can then drag your cursor to the¬†object where you want the arrow to point. Release your cursor and a comment box will appear. Add your comment and click on the small green button on the right to save it. E. Rectangle This tool as its name suggests allows you to provide comments on an area of the screen. Some users call it the area tool. To use the rectangle tool, select the rectangle icon on the review bar. On the screen, click where you want the rectangle to start, hold and drag your cursor to draw the rectangle and then release it once you‚Äôve enclosed the area. A comment box will appear where you can add your feedback. Add your comment and click on the green button to save it. F. Easer The eraser is used to remove/delete annotations without removing the comment associated with them. To use the eraser tool, select the eraser icon below the rectangle and click on the annotation you want to remove. If you want to remove the comment associated with the annotation, simply click the trash icon at the top right of each individual comment. This will remove the annotation as well as the comment.Note: If you have selected any annotation but haven‚Äôt added the comment yet, then pressing the ‚ÄúESC‚Äù of your PC will remove it. G. Screenshot There are times when you just have to take a screenshot. This screenshot tool can be used to capture the screen you are on. There are two ways you can capture the screen. I. Visible area screenshot If you want to capture the area which is visible on your screen then click this option. It will take the shot, process it and will open a new section called screens where you will see the screenshot taken. You can then use the different annotations available to start your review right on the screenshot. II. Full page screenshot We‚Äôve all been there. We‚Äôve wanted to grab a fullscreen screenshot without having the proper means to do so. Now if you want to capture the full page then click this option. It will take the shot, process it and will save it in a new section where you will see the full page screenshot taken. There you can use the different annotations available to start your review right on the full screenshot. III. Record video Chances are you want to explain specific issues to a client or a team member, showing them exactly how a site performs or how you want it to perform. For this, we have a recording tool which you can use to record the screen and yourself with audio, for better context. To record the video, just select the record video option. This will open up an interface where you will find multiple recording features. Make sure the ‚ÄúRecordvideo‚Äù option is selected. Set the settings i.e. record microphone or audio as per your choice. Then click on ‚ÄúRecordvideo‚Äù. This will open up a UI from Chrome where you will be required to select the screen for recording. Select from the screen or window option and click ‚ÄúShare‚Äù. It will start the recording. Once the recording is done, then click on ‚ÄúStopsharing‚Äù. It will process the video and will open it up in a new window where you will be able to play your recorded video and add annotations . H. Slideshow Now that we‚Äôve provided a lot of contextual feedback and annotations, it‚Äôs time to look at it from a high-level view.¬†The slideshow function allows you to see all of your screenshots, screen recordings and comments. You can also add annotations and comments in the slideshow view! I. Hide/Un-hide pop-ups Content with multiple collaborators is bound to have numerous valuable feedback. However, they can often impede your view of the content itself.¬†If the comments are blocking the content on your file then you can easily hide them. Just click on ‚ÄúHide‚Äù to close all the popups. Don‚Äôt worry! Your feedbacks are still there. And is just a click away from you. So, if you want all the comments back then click ‚ÄúUnhide‚Äù which will make them visible once again. J. Device mode At zipBoard, we recognize the importance of responsive sites. This is why you can review your content in the device type you want to review it.¬†In this mode, you will be able to review your content in the multiple available device modes. To use it click on the ‚ÄúDevice mode‚Äù option. You will see a dropdown on the top of your screen. Click on the drop-down and it will show you a list of all available devices that you can select to review your content. Simply selecting the device will emulate the screen in the same size as the device chosen. You can then take a screenshot/video and change the option from ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù to ‚ÄúReview‚Äù. On browse, you can scroll through the screen. Once you take the screenshot/video in the review mode, you will be able to add multiple annotations to review your file. If you want to exit from device mode, then simply click on ‚ÄúCross‚Äù showing right next to the dropdown. Comment count & Reply count The other thing that you‚Äôll see is that there is a comment counter on the right side of the screen. Displaying the total count of the comments added. These comments will however not reflect the replies to individual comments. Meaning, that if you reply to any comment, the comment counter will not change. You will instead notice a different counter for individual comments, keeping tabs on the number of replies to it. The default value is set to 1, which is the comment. We can set the content status from here as 1. Open 2. Approved 3. Rejected 4. In-progress J.Toggle disable comments we can add only annotation without comment using this option If you have any doubts or questions, feel free to reach out to us at support@zipboard.co. Name: How To Use The Share Link Security Features
Article Content: How to Use the Share Link Security Features - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Use the Share Link Security Features üìå For new updates, please read this help article. zipBoard has introduced a new set of features designed to make your content sharing more secure and streamlined than ever. This help document will guide you on how to use the new Share Link features to improve collaboration and efficiency in your project. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Accessing the Share Link Section The Share Link section has a revamped interface that allows you to: ‚úÖ Invite others to view, comment, or edit documents. ‚úÖ Manage who has access to your files. ‚úÖ Apply security settings such as password protection & expiry dates . How to Access the Share Link Section: Open the file you want to share. Click the "Share" button on the file. A pop-up will appear with all sharing and security options . üìå This section allows you to customize security settings before sharing your file. You will find the "Share" button in the pop-up interface when you click on any of the uploads This is the interface that you will see after clicking the "Share" button Setting Up Password Protection You can now secure your content by adding a password to your Share Link. Here's how: Go to the Share Link section : In this area, you'll find the password protection option. Add a password: This ensures that your content is only accessible to your intended audience, providing you an additional layer of security. Setting a Due Date for Your Share Link Some content needs to be shared for a specific period. Here's how to set an expiry date for your Share Link: Go to the Share Link section: Locate the due date setting option. Set a due date: This ensures that your content is accessible only for the intended period, providing extra protection. üìå Once the expiry date is reached, the link will automatically become inactive, ensuring temporary access only. ‚úÖ Great for sharing time-sensitive files securely! Sharing with Multiple Recipients We've simplified sharing with multiple recipients. Here's a step-by-step guide on using the multiple recipients email invite feature: Navigate to the Share Link section: Find the option for multiple recipients email invites. Add multiple email addresses: You can input several addresses and send them an email invite simultaneously, saving you time. üìå All recipients will receive an email invitation with the correct permissions, ensuring seamless collaboration. ‚úÖ Perfect for teams, external reviewers, and large-scale approvals. Next Steps üöÄ Want to learn more? Check out these related articles below ‚¨áÔ∏è üîπ Try zipBoard Today! Ready to streamline your client collaboration? Request a Demo and explore seamless file sharing. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: What Is Review Board
Article Content: What is Review Board? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is Review Board? Review Board is a platform to view your resources and to review them simultaneously (or simultaneously share your feedback with the team). When you launch Review Board for the first time, you will see your web project open inside zipBoard along with an option to take screenshots, or adjust the screen resolution, add comments using annotation tools Tool Bar List of Tools in order Mouse cursor - by selecting the browse option you can go through the content A toolbar to access draw and view options for the asset to be reviewed. Options include rectangle, pencil, highlighter, arrow, text, eraser, signature. Eye icon - to show or hide comments, you can use this option By clicking on the camera icon , it shows options for visible area screenshots. Slide show: opens new tab with screens captured, and you can get back by clicking on "Navigate to content" and if you want to share the screen, click on "share screen" and added tasks can be seen in "Tasks" tab Navigate to device mode and can capture the screen for different resolutions You can set content status from here. Tools around comments Pencil icon - used to edit the comment Trash bin - delete a comment Two circles - adjust the transparency, or opacity of the comment Reply button - to respond in a certain comment Task Bar Filter - to search or filter comments based on authors or sources Pencil icon - used to edit the comment Trash bin - delete a comment Reply button - to respond in a certain comment Comment section - to add a comment Did this answer your question? Name: Apis For Custom Integration
Article Content: APIs for Custom Integration - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact APIs for Custom Integration You can integrate zipBoard with your existing custom software using our APIs, extension and widget to create a content review experience that is tailored for your use cases or integrated into your existing workflow. For a comprehensive overview of our API and the various possibilities it opens up for you, check out our brand new API docs on https://docs.zipboard.co/ . Integration Example While there are several approaches you may take, this article gives you a high-level overview of what you can build with our API integration. An interactive demo project can be viewed at https://weathered-darkness-2854.fly.dev/ . The first step in this process is creating an API key. You can do this by following our getting started and API authentication guides Once you have your API key ready, you can now put these in a .env file to begin safely using it in your project. Please note that we do not reccomend exposing your API key in the browser through a client-side app. We reccomend that you interact with the zipBoard API exclusively through the server. You should now be able to interact with the API in your app. Perhaps you may start by fetching all the projects associated with your organization. An example request for this can be as simple as the following: const projects = await fetch( "https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/projects?orgid=your-org-id", { headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json", authorization: apiKey, }, } ) You can also create projects using the API if you do not have existing projects in your organization. Once you have fetched the data associated with your organization you should be able to leverage it in your backend or display it in your UI with custom styling. To upload a file to zipBoard using the API, you can leverage the files API. Note that we currently only support URLs and hosted PDF URL uploads through the API. For any other file types you will need to upload files through our UI. The zipBoard API also gives you programmatic access to view all your uploads irrespective of file type. You can find detailed documentation for this at https://docs.zipboard.co/#tag/Files/paths/~1api~1v1~1files/get You can now bring these pieces together to initiate a content review with zipBoard. To do this, you need to make a POST request to create a review link with your project ID and the ID of the file you‚Äôd like to review. You will receive a response with a link to review your file. Navigate to the link returned in the response and you should be able to see your file with all of zipboard review tools ready for you to use. You can review PDFs and ZIP files by default without any add-ons. In order to review other files types you will need to install zipBoard‚Äôs browser extension for Chrome, Firefox or Edge. Name: Can I Add Text Annotation In Pdf And Make It A Task Comment
Article Content: Can I add a text annotation in a PDF and make it a task/comment? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can I add a text annotation in a PDF and make it a task/comment? üì£ We have an UPDATE üì£üéâ Please go to this link. As of September 2024. Yes, you can add text annotations in PDFs and convert them to tasks/comments. Here's how: Open your PDF document for review Click on the text annotation tool and add your text Click on the add to comment icon by the font color to add to comment Internal Users (Super Admins, Admins, Managers, Collaborators): When internal users add information, it will directly create new tasks on the platform. This allows for streamlined action and clear task ownership. You'll easily see these tasks listed within the project interface. External Users (Clients, Guest Collaborators, Guest Reviewers): These users can still contribute valuable insights, but their input will be added as comments to existing tasks. This helps maintain project focus and avoid creating unnecessary tasks for information sharing. You'll find these comments in the "External Comments" section for each relevant task. Caution: Once you convert a text annotation into a task/comment, you cannot revert the action. However, you can completely delete it. And when you do, it will also be deleted from the task and comment tabs. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Contact Us Contact Us Last updated on October 2, 2024 Related Articles Power of Tags: A Comprehensive Guide How is a Task Different from a Comment? As of September 2024. Yes, you can add text annotations in PDFs and convert them to tasks/comments. Here's how: Open your PDF document for review Click on the text annotation tool and add your text Click on the add to comment icon by the font color to add to comment Internal Users (Super Admins, Admins, Managers, Collaborators): When internal users add information, it will directly create new tasks on the platform. This allows for streamlined action and clear task ownership. You'll easily see these tasks listed within the project interface. External Users (Clients, Guest Collaborators, Guest Reviewers): These users can still contribute valuable insights, but their input will be added as comments to existing tasks. This helps maintain project focus and avoid creating unnecessary tasks for information sharing. You'll find these comments in the "External Comments" section for each relevant task. Caution: Once you convert a text annotation into a task/comment, you cannot revert the action. However, you can completely delete it. And when you do, it will also be deleted from the task and comment tabs. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: How Do I Share Files With A Client
Article Content: How do I Share Files with a Client? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I Share Files with a Client? Collaborating with clients has never been easier. With zipBoard, you can securely share files, gather feedback, and streamline communication‚Äîall in just a few clicks. Here's how you can invite clients and share files seamlessly to keep your projects moving forward. Step 1: Add the Client to Your Project Before sharing files, you need to add the client to your zipBoard project: Open your project and navigate to the " Collaborators " tab. Click " Add Client ." Enter the client‚Äôs email address and click "Invite." Once the client accepts the invitation, they will be added to the project as a Client. Step 2: Share a File with the Client Once the client is added, follow these steps to share a file: Locate the file you want to share. Click the three horizontal dots (‚ãÆ) on the file card. Select " Share. " Choose the client(s) you want to share the file with. Set their access permissions : All Comments ‚Äì Clients can see all feedback. Only External Comments ‚Äì Clients only see external discussions. Remove Access ‚Äì Revokes client access. Click "Share" to finalize the process. üìå Clients will receive an email with a direct link to access the file in zipBoard. Step 3: Client Access & Feedback Once the client clicks the link in their email: They can log in to zipBoard using their credentials. They can review the file and provide feedback using the built-in annotation tools. Troubleshooting & FAQs ‚ùì What if the client doesn‚Äôt receive the email? ‚úîÔ∏è Ask them to check their spam/junk folder or resend the invitation. ‚ùì Can I remove or change client access later? ‚úîÔ∏è Yes! Go to the Access Tab in the Share modal and update permissions. Next Steps üöÄ Want to learn more? Check out these related articles: Different Share Link Options How Version Control Works in zipBoard? How to Track and Prioritise the Feedback from Guest in zipBoard? üîπ Try zipBoard Today! Ready to enhance your client collaboration? Request a Demo to explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Did this answer your question?
