Name: Mp3 File Sharing Feature
Article Content: How to Review or Get Feedback with MP3 or Audio Files? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Review or Get Feedback with MP3 or Audio Files? zipboard is a collaborative tool designed to simplify the process of gathering feedback, reviewing and approving assets, and collaborating on projects, especially in web development, eLearning, and design contexts. It offers a platform where teams can work together seamlessly to improve digital assets, websites, and applications. Now, let's dive into our latest update: introducing a feature that allows you to upload and share MP3 audio files with your colleagues. While you can't add annotations directly to the MP3 files, you can utilize comments strategically to highlight specific sections of the audio. Here's the scoop: When your teammates listen to your audio, they can also read your notes plus they can add comments. Inside those little boxes, you can share valuable insights, creative ideas, and your thoughts ‚Äì all to make your message crystal clear. Let your coworkers in on your plans by pinpointing which part of the audio you're eyeing for your project, or simply spicing up your assets with awesome tunes, this tool's your best friend. Consider comments as handy markers that ensure everyone's following the same rhythm when it comes to the audio content. With comments, collaboration becomes a smooth symphony of ideas and understanding. Uploading an MP3 File: Log in to your zipBoard account. Navigate to the project where you want to share the MP3 file. Click on the "Add" button that lets you upload files. Select the MP3 audio file you want to share from your local drive. Wait for the file to upload and become available for review. Leaving Comments: Play the uploaded MP3 file by clicking the play button. Listen carefully to the audio and identify sections you want to highlight. When you come across a part of the audio that you intend to use or discuss, pause the playback. Click on the comment tool located within the interface. Leave a comment that describes your thoughts or intention for that specific part of the audio. Tips: Use descriptive comments to ensure your coworkers understand the significance of a specific audio section. If you're using the audio for a particular purpose, mention it clearly in your comments. Collaborators can reply to your comments, making discussions smoother and more contextual. With zipBoard's MP3 File Sharing feature, you can seamlessly share audio files, leave comments for precision, and enhance your collaborative efforts. This innovative approach to communication will undoubtedly boost your productivity and streamline your teamwork. If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to contact our support team. Happy Collaborating with zipBoard! Did this answer your question? Name: Enhanced Notifications
Article Content: How do I Receive Combined Notifications for Multiple Task Updates? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I Receive Combined Notifications for Multiple Task Updates? At zipBoard, we're all about optimizing your project management experience. That's why we're excited to introduce a significant improvement to our notification system. We know that staying informed about task updates is crucial, but we also understand the frustration of being bombarded with a barrage of notifications. What's New: When multiple changes occur concerning a single task, these updates will now be bundled together within a single notification . This means you won't be flooded with individual notifications for every change, ensuring your notification feed remains clear and easy to manage. How It Works: Grouped Notifications: If several updates happen in relation to the same task, you'll see them grouped under a single notification. Dropdown Convenience: To see the detailed list of changes, simply click on the notification. A dropdown menu will reveal all the updates related to that particular task. Simplified Viewing: Instead of scrolling through numerous separate notifications, you can now review all the changes within one organized notification card. Benefits: Efficient Communication: Stay updated without being overwhelmed by individual notifications. Clutter-Free Feed: Your notification feed remains neat and concise, focusing only on important tasks. Quick Access: Access all related updates in one click, streamlining your workflow. Note: These changes apply when multiple updates are linked to a single task. Individual notifications for distinct tasks will remain unchanged. With our improved notification system, you can handle task updates more effectively, ensuring you're always in the loop without the hassle of excessive notifications. Did this answer your question? Name: Can We Tag Users In Live Annotations Too
Article Content: Can We Tag or Mention Users in Live Annotation Too? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can We Tag or Mention Users in Live Annotation Too? The answer is Yes ! With zipBoard's tagging feature, collaboration becomes more dynamic, focused, and efficient. No more back-and-forth emails or separate discussions. It's all conveniently integrated right where you need it. When the user mentions collaborators in the project, they get notified regarding the task/comment. Mentioning Made Easy When you're in the review process and ready to add annotations to your content, simply use the "@" symbol followed by the user's name. This allows you to bring their attention to specific points or elements within the content that require feedback or discussion. Efficient Feedback Loop Mentioning not only makes your annotations more targeted but also accelerates the feedback loop. By involving the right people at the right time, you can address issues, brainstorm ideas, and make improvements more effectively . Client Collaboration If you're working with clients and have shared the file with them, they too can take advantage of this tagging feature. Clients can tag collaborators and team members, ensuring everyone's input is considered in one central space. Did this answer your question? Name: How To Enable Camera And Video Access
Article Content: How to Enable Camera and Microphone Access - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Enable Camera and Microphone Access Camera and video access is essential for various online activities such as video conferencing, live streaming, and more. This guide will walk you through the steps to enable camera and video access on your preferred web browser. We'll use Google Chrome as an example, but the steps are generally similar across different browsers. Launch Google Chrome. Navigate to a website that requires access to your microphone and camera. When prompted, select either "Allow" or "Block." Enabling Camera and Video Access in Google Chrome Step 1: Open Chrome Settings Launch the Google Chrome browser on your computer or device. Click on the three vertical dots (menu icon) located at the top-right corner of the browser window. From the dropdown menu, select "Settings." Step 2: Navigate to Site Settings In the Settings tab, scroll down and click on "Privacy and security" in the left sidebar. Under the "Privacy and security" section, click on "Site settings." Step 3: Access Camera and Microphone Settings In the "Site settings" page, scroll down to find the "Permissions" section. Click on "Camera" or "Microphone," depending on which access you want to enable. You can also perform these steps separately for camera and microphone access. Step 4: Allow Camera and Microphone Access In the respective camera or microphone settings, you'll see a list of websites that have requested access. Find the website for which you want to enable camera or microphone access. To the right of the website's name, you'll see a dropdown menu. Click on it. Select "Allow" to grant camera or microphone access to the website. Step 5: Test the Access Once you've allowed access, visit a website that uses camera or microphone features. The browser will prompt you to grant access to the camera or microphone. Click on "Allow" in the popup. Troubleshooting If you're experiencing issues with enabling camera and video access, consider the following steps: Check Browser Version: Ensure you're using an up-to-date version of Google Chrome or your preferred browser. Check Operating System Permissions: Some operating systems also have camera and microphone permissions. Make sure they're enabled as well. Clear Cache and Cookies: Sometimes, cached data can cause access issues. Clear your browser's cache and cookies and try again. Conclusion Enabling camera and video access in your browser is crucial for various online tasks. By following the steps outlined in this guide, you can ensure that websites have the necessary permissions to use your camera and microphone for seamless online interactions. For more detailed troubleshooting or browser-specific instructions, you can visit the official support page for your browser. Did this answer your question? Check Operating System Permissions: Some operating systems also have camera and microphone permissions. Make sure they're enabled as well. Clear Cache and Cookies: Sometimes, cached data can cause access issues. Clear your browser's cache and cookies and try again. Conclusion Enabling camera and video access in your browser is crucial for various online tasks. By following the steps outlined in this guide, you can ensure that websites have the necessary permissions to use your camera and microphone for seamless online interactions. For more detailed troubleshooting or browser-specific instructions, you can visit the official support page for your browser. Did this answer your question? Name: Zipboard Users Workflow
YouTube Links: https://youtu.be/4D4QbzuE6_A, https://youtu.be/95Ps3-B_YW0, https://youtu.be/G0b_5Rw9ye0, https://youtu.be/a8dZW7EtI0E, https://youtu.be/eBLnrCrfHOU, https://youtu.be/jVq4AN_W7Vc, https://youtu.be/lYW8LLEN5aU, https://youtu.be/nlt_Mt7tEGI, https://youtu.be/voQ4w0EHPRI
Article Content: Workflow for all zipBoard Users - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Workflow for all zipBoard Users üìå For new updates, Complete Workflow for all zipBoard Users In the fast-paced landscape of project management and collaboration, maintaining clarity and efficiency can be a daunting task, especially when dealing with diverse roles and permissions within an enterprise context. The challenge lies in orchestrating seamless workflows and effective communication. zipBoard Enterprise offers a streamlined solution for these challenges. By following the guidelines below, teams can effectively manage projects and collaborate within the platform while adhering to defined roles and permissions, ensuring smoother workflows and increased productivity. Super Admin Setup: Super admin signs up for zipBoard Enterprise . During setup, provide the following information: Organization name. Domain name. Whether Single Sign-On (SSO) is required. Custom logo for branding. Customization preferences, such as status, stamps, tags, etc. Inviting Managers and Admins : Super admin invites managers and admins to join the organization. Admin Workflow Definition: Admins define the workflows for projects, including: Phases . Statuses . Integrations . Tags . Stamps . Manager Workflow : Managers create new projects within their defined workflows. What are the parts of a project? Managers invite collaborators to join these projects. Managers add phases to each project as needed. Collaborator Content Contribution: Collaborators upload content to the projects. Content Sharing: Collaborators share the uploaded content with designated reviewers. Review Process: Reviewers access the shared content. Reviewers provide feedback on the content. PDF URL Images Video ZIP MP3 Triage and Content Updates: Project members (managers and collaborators) triage the received feedback . Collaborators update the content based on feedback. New versions of the content are uploaded to the project. Repeat Review Cycle: Repeat Steps 5-8 as necessary until the content meets the desired quality and requirements. Reporting: Managers and admins have access to project reports for monitoring and analysis. Auto-Generated Reports Generate consolidated reports with zipBoard There you have it! Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Roles And Permissions
Article Content: Roles and Permissions - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Roles and Permissions Welcome to our Help Center, your go-to resource for understanding and mastering your role within the organization's platform. Whether you're an Org Admin with overarching control or a Collaborator focused on content contribution, these guides are designed to empower you with the knowledge and skills you need for effective navigation and seamless collaboration. Org Admin/Super Admin: For a Complete Comprehensive Guide for Owners/Admin Overall ownership of the organization. Adding users to the organization. Creating tags. Visibility and control over the entire organization. Customization of organization settings. Access to project reports. Admin: Similar permissions as the super admin, excluding billing and member management. Managers : Creation and management of projects. Adding collaborators to projects. Customization of projects. Integration management. Access to project reports. Collaborators/Members: For a Complete Comprehensive Guide for Collaborators Content contribution. Task assignment and management. Review feedback. Task organization. Clients (Enterprise Only): External stakeholders responsible for content review and approval. Communication with the project team. Feedback conversion into tasks. Guest Reviewers: For a Complete Comprehensive Guide for Guest Reviewers/Clients and Stakeholders External stakeholders for content review. Limited access based on shared links. Feedback provision. Feedback conversion into tasks (by clients or internal team). Additional Information: Understanding Permissions: Gain a deeper understanding of user permissions by visiting our permissions guide . Removing Users: Need to remove someone from your organization? Find step-by-step instructions in our article on removing users. Effective Stakeholder Management: Learn how to manage your stakeholders effectively by referring to our dedicated stakeholder management guide . Did this answer your question? Name: Introduction To Super Admins
Article Content: Understanding Super Admins & Admins - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Understanding Super Admins & Admins For updated information, kindly proceed to Getting Started as Super Admin and Admin in zipBoard. What is a Super Admin? A Super Admin in zipBoard is the highest-level administrator in the organization, with full control and oversight. They have overall ownership, can add users, create tags, customize organization settings, and access project reports within the zipBoard platform. How is it different from Admins? Admins have similar permissions as the super admin, excluding billing and member management. How to Start? To sign up for ZipBoard Enterprise : Click the provided sign-up link. During the setup process, provide the following information: Organization name. Domain name. Specify if Single Sign-On (SSO) is required. Upload a custom logo for branding. Define customization preferences, including status, stamps, tags, and more. Once the setup is complete, the Super Admin can invite managers and admins to join the organization. Permissions : In the context of zipBoard, the Workflow Definition is a crucial aspect of project management. Admins have the responsibility to configure and define the specific workflows for projects, which involves the following key elements: Phases : Admins can define project phases, breaking down the project into manageable stages or milestones. These phases help organize and track progress throughout the project's lifecycle. Statuses : Admins set up different project statuses to reflect the current state of tasks or items within a project. Common statuses might include "To-Do," "In Progress," "Review," and "Completed." These statuses provide clear visibility into the project's progress. Integrations : Admins can configure integrations with other tools or software to streamline project management. Integrations can include connecting with version control systems, task management tools, or communication platforms to ensure seamless collaboration and data exchange. Tags : Admins define project-specific tags that can be applied to tasks, items, or discussions. Tags help categorize and organize project elements, making it easier to search for and filter information. Stamps : Admins can set up customized stamps or annotations that can be applied to project assets. These stamps might include approval stamps, comments, or feedback markers, allowing for clear communication and feedback within the project. Did this answer your question? Name: Introduction To Managers
Article Content: Getting Started as Project Managers - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started as Project Managers Managers in the context of zipBoard are key members of an organization responsible for various aspects of project management and coordination. Here are the primary responsibilities and tasks associated with the role of Managers: What can a Project Manager do in zipBoard? How can a Project Managers Do These Tasks? What can a Project Manager do in zipBoard? Project Managers have the following capabilities: Create and manage projects from start to finish Upload and organize content like design files, documents, images Set up workflows using project phases and statuses for better tracking Add and manage collaborators, clients, and reviewers involved in the project Share projects with controlled access and permissions Collect, triage, and prioritize feedback to ensure project goals are met Assign and manage tasks based on feedback in Kanban or table views Access comprehensive reports to monitor progress and performance Remove stakeholders when their involvement ends How can a Project Managers Do These Tasks? Step-by-Step Guide for Project Managers Step Action Help Article Video 1 Sign up to zipBoard to create an account and start reviewing. Signing up for zipBoard 2 Create a new project after logging in. Creating a Project in zipBoard Creating a Project 3 Upload content for review, this can be design files, PDFs, images, or documents. How to Add and Review Different Types of Content with zipBoard? Upload a Content 4 Set up project phases to track workflow and progress. Also configure project or organization-level statuses. What is a Project Phase ? How to Add Statuses from Project Level? How to Edit Org Statutes? Adding Content Phases in zipBoard 5 Invite stakeholders collaborators, clients, managers, or reviewers. How to Invite Collaborators to a Project? How to add collaborators 6 Share the project with stakeholders to start the review process. Customize sharing settings to control permissions. Please see this link for the different share link options. Share your projects 7 Triage feedback by organizing it based on relevance and urgency. Prioritize actionable comments. How to Track and Prioritize the Feedback from Guest in zipBoard? Start Receiving Feedback and triage those 8 Manage tasks: assign them, move them across phases, and choose your preferred view (table or Kanban). Getting Started with zipBoard: A Workflow 9 View reports: Use auto-generated or consolidated reports to track feedback, performance, and overall progress. Auto-Generated Reports Generate Consolidated Reports with zipBoard 10 Remove stakeholders once the project is done or their role ends. How to Remove Members from an Organization or Project? If I remove a collaborator from my organization or project, what happens to their tasks and comments? Need More Help? Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Or start your 14-day Free Trial! Did this answer your question? Name: Introduction To Collaborators
YouTube Links: https://youtu.be/4D4QbzuE6_A, https://youtu.be/95Ps3-B_YW0, https://youtu.be/G0b_5Rw9ye0, https://youtu.be/a8dZW7EtI0E, https://youtu.be/eBLnrCrfHOU, https://youtu.be/jVq4AN_W7Vc, https://youtu.be/lYW8LLEN5aU, https://youtu.be/nlt_Mt7tEGI, https://youtu.be/voQ4w0EHPRI
Article Content: Workflow of Collaborators - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Workflow of Collaborators üìå For new updates, please read Getting Started as a Collaborator . Collaborators in the context of zipBoard are individuals who actively participate in projects and contribute to various project-related activities. Here are the primary responsibilities and tasks associated with the role of Collaborators: Content Contribution: Collaborators play a key role in content creation and contribution within projects. They can add and edit content, such as text, images, videos, or other multimedia elements, based on the project's objectives and requirements. Task Assignment and Management: Collaborators are responsible for assigning tasks to themselves or other team members, tracking task progress, and ensuring that tasks are completed within the specified timelines. This helps in efficient project management and task delegation. Review Feedback: Collaborators provide valuable feedback on project assets, content, or design elements. They review and comment on work done by others, helping to identify areas for improvement and ensuring that the project meets quality standards. Task Organization: Collaborators assist in organizing project tasks and assets effectively. They categorize tasks, use tags, and apply other organizational methods to make it easier for team members to find and work on specific items within the project. To summarize the workflow: Collaborator Content Contribution: Collaborators upload content to the projects. Content Sharing: Collaborators share the uploaded content with designated reviewers. Review Process: Reviewers access the shared content. Reviewers provide feedback on the content. PDF URL Images Video ZIP MP3 Triage and Content Updates: Project members (managers and collaborators) triage the received feedback . Collaborators update the content based on feedback. New versions of the content are uploaded to the project. Repeat Review Cycle: Repeat steps as necessary until the content meets the desired quality and requirements. In summary, Collaborators in zipBoard are active participants in project teams who contribute to content creation, task management, feedback provision, and task organization. Their involvement is essential for successful project execution and achieving project goals. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: How Can I Access My Content Back Once I Have Started A Review Session
Article Content: How can I access my content back, once I have started a review session? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How can I access my content back, once I have started a review session? If you‚Äôve initiated a review session in zipBoard and need to return to your content, follow these steps to quickly regain access: Step 1: Log in to Your zipBoard Account Visit the zipBoard platform here: https://app.zipboard.co/ Enter your email and password to log in. Step 2: Navigate to Your Project Once logged in, go to the Projects tab on the dashboard. Select the relevant project where the review session was started. Step 3: Resume the Review Session Inside the project, click on the Review Board to access your content and review materials. You‚Äôll be able to see your progress, comments, and any annotations made during the session. With these steps, you can seamlessly return to your work and continue collaborating without any interruptions. Did this answer your question? Cleaned Article Content: How can I access my content back, once I have started a review session? - zipBoard Help How can I access my content back, once I have started a review session? If you‚Äôve initiated a review session in zipBoard and need to return to your content, follow these steps to quickly regain access: Step 1: Log in to Your zipBoard Account Visit the zipBoard platform here: https://app.zipboard.co/ Enter your email and password to log in. Step 2: Navigate to Your Project Once logged in, go to the Projects tab on the dashboard. Select the relevant project where the review session was started. Step 3: Resume the Review Session Inside the project, click on the Review Board to access your content and review materials. You‚Äôll be able to see your progress, comments, and any annotations made during the session. With these steps, you can seamlessly return to your work and continue collaborating without any interruptions. Did this answer your question? Name: Customizing Statuses At The Project Level
Article Content: Customizing Statuses at the Project Level - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Customizing Statuses at the Project Level Previously, users were limited to adding and managing task statuses only at the organization level. This constraint often led to a lack of flexibility in adapting statuses to the unique requirements of individual projects. üìå Please read zipBoard's recent updates , users can now move the storing and creation of statuses to the project level, allowing for more granular control and customization. Navigating to Project Statuses: To take advantage of the enhanced status management at the project level, follow these simple steps: a. Go to the "Projects" section. b. Select the specific project you want to customize. c. On the left-hand side, just below the phases, locate and click on "Statuses." insert a GIF Viewing and Creating Statuses: a. Within the "Statuses" section, you'll find a list of current statuses associated with the project. b. To add new statuses, simply click on the relevant option (usually labeled "Add Status" or similar). c. Name your status and set any additional parameters as needed. d. Save the changes, and your new status is now available for use within the selected project. insert a GIF Setting Default Status for Tasks: a. After creating your statuses, you have the option to set a default status for all tasks created within the project. b. Look for the "Default Status" or a similar setting in the project's status configuration. c. Choose the desired status from the available options and save your changes. insert a GIF Managing Statuses at the Task Level: a. Alternatively, you can manage statuses on a task-by-task basis. b. Navigate to the "Tasks" section. c. Select the specific task for which you want to modify the status. d. Look for the "Status" option and scroll down to find "New Statuses." e. Here, you can choose from existing statuses or create a new one specific to the task. f. Save the changes, and the task will now reflect the updated status. With these steps, you can now enjoy a more flexible and tailored approach to managing statuses within your projects, adapting them to the specific needs of each task. This enhancement provides a more dynamic and efficient way to organize and track progress within your projects. Did this answer your question? Name: Zapier X Zipboard Integration
Article Content: Zapier x zipBoard Integration - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Zapier x zipBoard Integration Streamline your workflows with zipBoard + Zapier and save 30%+ time for what matters most. What you need: Zapier account - start with the free plans and upgrade when you need to upscale. Zipboard account - you should be an admin or owner. Learn more about the teams here . See howüîΩ Follow the interactive step-by-step below or continue down for written instructions: Get started from Zapier Log into your Zapier account to get started. Sign up if you don‚Äôt already have an account. Click ‚ÄòCreate Zap‚Äô in the top left-hand corner Select zipBoard as your trigger Skip to Setting Up zipBoard as your Trigger app below to continue Setting Up zipBoard as your Trigger app Choose the trigger event you want to use such as ‚ÄòMarkUp created‚Äô, and click ‚ÄòContinue‚Äô Select the account you want to link to the trigger event If your zipBoard account is not already connected, you‚Äôll need to select Connect a new account If it is already connected, skip to Step 6 When you‚Äôre prompted to enter your API key from zipBoard, head to the Zapier integration dashboard in zipBoard - or click here to jump to it Copy your API key and paste it in Zapier - a new window/tab should have opened prompting you for your API key earlier Click continue to connect your zipBoard workspace to Zapier You‚Äôll receive a prompt to test the trigger - this isn‚Äôt essential, but it helps when building the next step. Configuring the Action Select the app you want to use as the action app, such as Google Sheets, Asana, or Trello. Choose the specific action you want to happen next, such as 'Create a new row' or 'Create a new card'. Fill in the required fields when prompted and customize the action as needed. Testing the Zap Once you've configured the trigger and action, click "Test this Zap" to ensure it works correctly. Follow the prompts to test the Zap and make necessary adjustments (if needed). If you encounter any issues during the integration process, here are some common solutions: Check your API keys and authentication settings Make sure you've linked the correct zipBoard account/workspace. Ensure you have the right permissions in both Zapier and zipBoard - you have to be a Workspace Admin or Owner Double-check the fields you've filled in for the action app Integrating zipBoard with Zapier can help you streamline your workflow and get more done in less time. Note: Zaps are workflows that connect your apps to automate repetitive tasks. A trigger is an event that starts a Zap. An action is an event a Zap performs. Learn more about the zipBoard and Zapier integrations here. You‚Äôll find how to connect 1000+ of your favorite apps. Did this answer your question? Name: How To Create Transparent Text Boxes
Article Content: How to Use Clear Text Boxes? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Use Clear Text Boxes? Have you ever encountered situations where white text boxes obscured important data behind them? This can be frustrating, especially when you want to present information clearly and transparently. Well, worry no more! Clear text boxes are here to save the day. Clear text boxes offer complete transparency, allowing you to see your data like never before. This can significantly improve data visualization, readability, and user experience. In this guide, you'll learn exactly how to use clear text boxes and unlock their full potential. Let's dive in! Step 1: Locate the Text Box First, select the text box or comment you want to make transparent. This could be a text box in a document, image, or any other assets. Step 2: Adjust the Opacity Level Once you've selected the text box, look for the opacity option in its properties. There you have it! Did this answer your question? Name: Change Email Address In Zipboard Account
Article Content: Change Email Address in zipBoard Account - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Change Email Address in zipBoard Account Are you using a different email address now than the one you originally signed up with on zipBoard? Don't worry, updating your email address is quick and easy! This guide will walk you through the steps on desktop, so you can get your zipBoard info back in sync. Open zipBoard and navigate to Edit Profile . Click "Edit" next to your current Email Address . Enter your new email address and click Save . Tips: Double-check your new email address for accuracy. Consider setting up email forwarding from your old address. That's it! Your email address is now updated. This version keeps it simple and direct, focusing on the core steps the user needs to take. I hope this is even more helpful! Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Don't worry, updating your email address is quick and easy! This guide will walk you through the steps on desktop, so you can get your zipBoard info back in sync. Open zipBoard and navigate to Edit Profile . Click "Edit" next to your current Email Address . Enter your new email address and click Save . Tips: Double-check your new email address for accuracy. Consider setting up email forwarding from your old address. That's it! Your email address is now updated. This version keeps it simple and direct, focusing on the core steps the user needs to take. I hope this is even more helpful! Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Can We Edit Org Statuses
Article Content: How to Add Statuses from Organization Level? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Add Statuses from Organization Level? Users often encounter challenges when it comes to modifying or adding custom statuses at the organizational level. Without a clear guide, this process can be confusing, potentially leading to inconsistencies in project management workflows. Here's a concise guide to help you effortlessly edit and add new statuses at the organizational level on zipBoard. ‚ö†Ô∏èOnly admin or owner can add statuses Access Organization Settings: Click on your profile image to access the user menu. Select "Manage Org" to navigate to the organization settings. Navigate to Statuses: Once inside the organization settings, locate and click on the "Statuses" section. Adding New Statuses: To add a new status, click on the "Add" button. Enter the desired status text in the provided field. Click "Add" to save the new status. Editing Existing Statuses: To edit an existing status, locate the status you want to modify. Click on the drop-down under "Actions" and select "Edit." Update the status text as needed. Note on Default Status: Default statuses can be edited but not deleted. Modify default statuses to suit your organizational needs. Deleting Statuses: To delete a status, find the status you wish to remove. Click on the drop-down under "Actions" and select "Delete." Did this answer your question? Name: Can We Add Statuses From Project Level
Article Content: How to Add Statuses from Project Level? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Add Statuses from Project Level? One common challenge users face is configuring project-specific statuses to effectively track the progress of tasks within a project. Without a clear understanding of how to set up and manage project statuses, users may find it challenging to organize and monitor the workflow of their projects. With the latest zipBoard updates , managing project statuses is now simpler than ever. zipBoard empowers you with flexibility for personalized project management. Permissions Who can add statuses? Super admin, admin, project owner: all of these users can add new statuses. Who can set default statuses for project? Super admin, admin, project owner can set the default status. Who can delete project level statuses? Super admin, admin, project owner can delete the statuses. ‚ö†Ô∏è The default statuses set by users will NOT be deleted For new updates on statuses, please follow this link Navigate to the Project: Log in to your zipBoard account. From the dashboard or main menu, select the project you want to manage. Access Statuses: Once you're inside the selected project, locate and click on the "Statuses" option from the left-hand side navigation menu. Add New Status: Under the "Statuses" section, find the "Add New" button. Enter the desired status text in the provided field. Click the "Add" button to save the new status. Set Default Statuses: To set default statuses for the entire project, look for an option that allows you to configure default statuses. Configure the default statuses according to your project's workflow. Considerations for Default Status Changes: If you decide to change the default status, be aware that any new tasks added from Live annotations, the review board, or the tasks tab will inherit the default status. Until the user explicitly changes the task status, it will be displayed as the default status. Note: Make sure to communicate any changes in default statuses to your team to maintain clarity and consistency in project management. Users have the flexibility to customize individual task statuses, allowing for a fine-tuned project tracking experience. By following these steps, you can effectively manage project-specific statuses, ensuring a streamlined workflow and improved project tracking on Did this answer your question? Name: How To Record And Manage Videos On Zipboard
Article Content: How to use the Video Recording Tool in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to use the Video Recording Tool in zipBoard? zipBoard now offers the capability to record videos directly within the platform, making collaboration and feedback even more seamless. This article provides a step-by-step guide on how to use the video recording feature and manage your recordings effectively. It is recommended to download the zipBoard extension to use this in all digital assets. Recording a Video Accessing the Recording Option: After entering the review interface, locate the camera icon. Selecting Recording Options: Click on the record option. Choose one of the three recording options: Screen Screen and Self Self Make sure to select your camera, and mic before recording Recording Screen: If you choose the 'Screen' option, select the specific tab or window you want to record. Start, pause, stop, or delete your recording as needed. Once you've stopped the recording, a new tab will automatically pop up, displaying your recorded video. You can now review and edit your video directly from this tab. If you prefer not to access the recorded video immediately after stopping the recording, you can do so later using the toolbar, then click slideshow. Alternatively, you can access your recorded videos from your project dashboard. Navigate to the project where you recorded the video. Look for the "Captures" or "Recordings" section within the project interface. Tips for Screen and Self Recording Enabling Camera Access : For 'Screen and Self' recording, grant access to your camera when prompted. Microphone Selection: If you want to record your voice, ensure you select your microphone before starting the recording. Managing Voice Recording: Click on 'Start Recording' after configuring your microphone settings. By following these steps, you can easily record, save, and manage videos within zipBoard, enhancing your collaboration and feedback processes. If you encounter any issues or have further questions, don't hesitate to reach out to our support team for assistance. You may also want to read " How to Record a Video to Capture Feedback using zipBoard extension ?" Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Managing Guest Reviewer Notifications And Access In Zipbboard
Article Content: Managing Guest Reviewer Notifications and Access in zipbBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Managing Guest Reviewer Notifications and Access in zipbBoard In zipBoard, guest reviewers play a crucial role in providing feedback and insights on projects without needing an account. However, managing their notifications and access can sometimes be challenging. This guide aims to provide a comprehensive overview of handling guest reviewer notifications and access within the platform. Guest Reviewer Notifications: Email Notifications: Guest reviewers do not receive email notifications when someone replies to their comments. However, if a guest reviewer inputs their email address in the optional field, they will indeed receive email notifications for replies. Accessing Replies: Guest reviewers can revisit the shared link to view replies and comments made by clients. Even comments added as tasks and their subsequent replies will be visible on the review board. Managing Access: Deleting Shared Links: Deleting the shared link does not immediately revoke access for guest reviewers and collaborators. Even after deletion, guest reviewers and collaborators may still access the link if they have it saved or cached. Revoking Access: Deleting the guest reviewer from the collaborators tab will revoke their access, this only works if you set up a password. Upon attempting to access the link again, they will be prompted for a password (if set). To ensure complete removal, delete the shared link from the share link section as well. Permanent Removal: To prevent any further access, ensure both the guest reviewer (if applicable) and the shared link are deleted. Deleting the shared link will redirect users to app.zipboard.co upon attempting to access it again. Rest assured, removing the guest reviewer from the collaborators tab does not delete their comments; it only prevents them from receiving further notifications. Effectively managing guest reviewer notifications and access is crucial for maintaining security and control over project feedback in zipBoard. By following the outlined steps, you can ensure that guest reviewers only access the relevant content and that their access is promptly revoked when necessary. For further assistance or inquiries, don't hesitate to reach out to our support team for personalized guidance. Did this answer your question? Name: Workflow Of Clients
Article Content: Getting Started as Clients - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started as Clients Clients in the context of zipBoard are those external stakeholders responsible for content review and approval. After you are added as a client by the owner or manager of a specific project, you need to follow these simple steps to get started. If you were invited via email : You will receive a personalized invitation to collaborate in the email address that will also contain a quick tutorial on how to use zipBoard. Click on the open (project name) button on the invitation email that will redirect you to the projects‚Äô dashboard. If you are new, you will get redirected to the log in page. You need to sign up to be able to access the project. Once you are done, you will now see the project. If shared via link, you still have to follow steps 3 and 4. The initial process has been done, now let‚Äôs go through each section under the project you are invited to collaborate: When the commenting and reviewing process for the digital asset is completed, you will receive the file for your review Click on the open (file name) button on the invitation email that will redirect you to the file dashboard. Click on the file, and start reviewing. For a comprehensive guide on how to review an asset, please follow this link . To know what are the different tools in zipBoard, you may go here . Collaborating with the Internal Team: Once you've submitted your feedback, the internal team will receive it for triaging. They will assess your comments and take appropriate actions to address them. As the internal team progresses with implementing changes based on your feedback, you'll receive notifications and updates regarding the status of your suggestions. Approving Comments as Tasks: In addition to providing feedback, you have the ability to approve comments made by the internal team. When you believe a comment warrants further action or requires implementation as a task, you can mark it as approved. By approving comments, you signal to the internal team that specific feedback should be translated into actionable tasks to enhance the project. Please follow this link to guide on how to approve those comments. This review process is iterative in nature, ensuring that each step is meticulously executed to achieve the desired outcome. Initially, you will review and approve the digital assets, after which the internal team will implement the necessary changes. Subsequently, you will review the revised content and provide further approval. If the changes meet your requirements and standards, the product can proceed to launch. However, if further adjustments are needed, the process loops back to reviewing and editing until the desired outcome is achieved Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Complete Workflow For All Zipboard Users
Article Content: Getting Started as Super Admin and Admin in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started as Super Admin and Admin in zipBoard In zipBoard, managing roles helps keep your workspace organized and secure. Two of the most powerful roles in the system are Super Admin and Admin . Both have extensive capabilities to manage projects, users, and settings but with a few key differences. What Can Super Admins and Admins Do? Getting Started as a Super Admin Getting Started as an Admin Need More Help? What Can Super Admins and Admins Do? Here‚Äôs a breakdown of what each role can manage in zipBoard: Capability Super Admin Admin Add/remove reviewers ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Add/remove clients ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Add/remove collaborators ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Add/remove collaborators ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Add/remove managers ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Add/remove super admins ‚úÖ ‚ùå Delete own projects ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Delete any projects ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Add project ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Archive own projects ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Access reports ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Add integrations ‚úÖ ‚úÖ Access billing ‚úÖ ‚ùå Getting Started as a Super Admin If you're a Super Admin, follow these steps to set up your organization in zipBoard: Create an Organization Go to https://app.zipboard.co/login Sign up or log in using your Google or Microsoft account. Change the Organization Name Once logged in, you can update your organization‚Äôs name under your Organization Settings . Name: Best Practices For Creating Scorm Courses HTML That Work In Zipboard
Article Content: Best Practices for Creating SCORM Courses / HTML that Work in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Best Practices for Creating SCORM Courses / HTML that Work in zipBoard This article outlines best practices for creating SCORM courses and HTML content that function seamlessly within the zipBoard review and approval tool, both with and without the zipBoard widget. Understanding zipBoard Functionality zipBoard empowers users to review and annotate various web content formats, including webpages, courses , PDFs , and videos . While zipBoard excels at pinpointing annotations on standard formats like PDFs and videos, its ability to precisely tag comments on webpages and courses hinges on the underlying HTML structure. Challenges with Webpages and Courses: Non-Standardized Code: Unlike standardized formats, webpages and courses often employ varying code structures depending on the authoring tool used. This inconsistency makes it difficult to universally support every authoring tool. Missing APIs: In cases where the authoring tool doesn't expose specific APIs, zipBoard is unable to achieve direct tagging functionality. Requirements for Direct Annotation in zipBoard For annotations to function directly on courses or webpages within zipBoard, the following information is essential: Unique URL per Page: Every webpage within the course must possess a unique URL to reflect any content changes. This ensures annotations stay attached to the correct content. JavaScript API for Location Tracking (Optional): Alternatively, the webpage can expose an API in the global scope, enabling zipBoard to read and set the current location within the course. This API typically takes the form of window.getPageId (to read) and window.setPageId (to set). The exact implementation may vary based on the authoring tool or webpage, but zipBoard is engineered to accommodate a wide range of variations. Unique Element IDs and Class Names: Precise annotation positioning relies heavily on elements having unique IDs and class names. If the course content changes without altering the URL or exposing the JavaScript API for location tracking, and elements lack unique IDs/class names, annotations might appear in incorrect locations. Authoring Tools Supporting Direct Annotations: The following authoring tools have been tested and confirmed to work seamlessly with zipBoard's direct annotation feature: Rise 360 (Articulate) Adobe Captivate GOMO Authoring Tools Requiring Screenshots: Courses created using the following authoring tools currently do not allow for direct tagging of annotations within zipBoard. As a workaround, users can capture screenshots and add annotations to those screenshots: Articulate Storyline 360 Elucidat Adapt Please Note: This list reflects the authoring tools tested by zipBoard. If you have a specific tool you'd like zipBoard to test for compatibility, feel free to contact zipBoard support at support@zipboard.co. Course Requirements for the zipBoard Player While zipBoard doesn't mandate specific tracking standards for courses to function within its player, there are instances where enabling these standards might be necessary for optimal course operation. If the course engine relies on any of the following standards to function properly, the zipBoard player will require them as well: SCORM 1.2 / 2004 Tin Can API Additional Support For any further inquiries or to report issues, please don't hesitate to reach out to zipBoard support at support@zipboard.co. Name: How Do I Use The Responsive Test Feature Of Zipboard
Article Content: How do I Use the Responsive Test Feature of zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I Use the Responsive Test Feature of zipBoard? The Responsive Test feature in zipBoard allows you to evaluate how your website appears across different screen resolutions. Here‚Äôs a step-by-step guide on how to use this feature effectively: Step 1: Start a Review Session Log in to your zipBoard account at https://app.zipboard.co/ . Navigate to the project you want to review. Click on the Review button to start a new review session. Step 2: Select Screen Resolution In the review session interface, locate the screen resolution dropdown menu . Choose the desired resolution from the options available (e.g., mobile, tablet, desktop). Your website will refresh to display how it appears in the selected resolution. Step 3: Take Screenshots and Add Comments As you review the website, click the screenshot button wherever necessary to capture specific elements or issues. After taking a screenshot, you can add comments or annotations directly on the image to highlight feedback or concerns. Step 4: Save and Share Once you‚Äôve completed the review, ensure to save your annotations and comments. Share the review session with your team to discuss any required changes. By following these steps, you can effectively use zipBoard‚Äôs Responsive Test feature to ensure your website is optimized for all devices. Did this answer your question? Name: How To Add A Start File
Article Content: How to Add a Start File? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Add a Start File? At zipBoard, we know getting your SCORM files reviewed quickly is important. Sometimes, however, a seemingly valid SCORM file might not launch for review right away. This is because SCORM packages don't inherently specify a starting point. What's a Start File? Think of a SCORM file as a toolbox. It contains all the pieces needed for your eLearning course, like HTML pages, images, and activities. But unlike a traditional program, there's no single "run" button. A start file, often named "index.html" or "launch.html", acts as that button, telling the SCORM player where to begin. Why is This Happening? There are a couple of reasons why zipBoard might not automatically detect the start file: Non-Standard Naming: Sometimes, authoring tools might use different file names for the launch file. ZipBoard is looking for common names like "index.html" but might miss it if it's called something else. Missing File: In rare cases, the SCORM package itself might be missing the start file entirely. Why You Might Need to Add One? Authoring tools typically include a start file by default. However, some developers might create custom SCORM packages or use older authoring tools that don't automatically include one. This can lead to confusion for zipBoard's review system. How to Continue? Don't worry, fixing this is a simple process: Click the "Add Start File" button. This will open a pop-up window. You'll see a list of files within your SCORM package. Look for files named "index.html" or "story.html" ‚Äì these are the most likely candidates. If you see the file you need, select it. Click "Save". zipBoard will now use the selected file as the starting point for your review. Easy as that! Did this answer your question? Name: A Guide To Zipboards Task List
Article Content: A Guide to zipBoard's Task List - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact A Guide to zipBoard's Task List zipBoard's task list empowers you to manage your projects efficiently. This comprehensive overview will guide you through adding tasks, organizing your workload, and utilizing filters for a clear view of your projects. Adding Tasks: Create on-the-fly: Don't wait to review an asset! Compose tasks directly in the task list. Mention team members using "@" for clear communication and collaboration from the start. Prioritize and adjust later: Set priorities (high, medium, low) to keep focus, and don't worry ‚Äì you can always adjust them later. Reviewing Content: Manage your assets: Click "Review Content" to upload files, images, or even links to webpages. Search through your uploaded assets for easy access. Kanban or table view: Choose the view that best suits you ‚Äì Kanban boards offer a visual workflow, while table view provides a detailed breakdown. Importing and Exporting Tasks: CSV import for existing tasks : Moving from another platform? No problem! Download the provided CSV template, populate it with your existing tasks, and import it seamlessly into zipBoard. Export your data: Maintain a backup or share your task list with others. Export all tasks, specific selections, or filtered views in a convenient CSV format. Customizing Your View: Show/Hide columns: Focus on what matters! Select the details you want to see in your task list, such as ID, title, assigned member, and more. Changes update automatically. Powerful Filtering: Phases : Organize tasks into customizable phases, allowing you to filter by project stage (e.g., Design, Development, Testing). Assets : Quickly find tasks associated with specific files or links uploaded to zipBoard. Comments: Filter tasks based on the presence or absence of comments in the "Screen" section. Ownership: See tasks assigned to specific team members or filter by reported the task. Status, Priority, and Type: Refine your view further by filtering by task status, priority, or type. Take control of your projects and streamline your workflow with zipBoard's comprehensive task list features! Did this answer your question? Name: How To Find The Documents And Digital Assets You Need In Zipboard
Article Content: How to find the documents and digital assets you need in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to find the documents and digital assets you need in zipBoard? Never waste time hunting for files again! zipBoard's robust search and organization features ensure you can effortlessly locate any document or digital asset within your projects. This guide will equip you with the knowledge to navigate your content with ease. Powerful Search: Intuitive search bar: Simply type the file name or relevant keywords into the search bar located at the top of your task list. zipBoard will instantly surface any matching documents and assets. Multiple Views: Kanban board visualization : Prefer a visual layout? Choose the Kanban board view to see your files arranged on cards, providing a quick overview of your project's progress. Detailed table view: For a more comprehensive breakdown, switch to the table view. This view displays a list of your files with detailed information like file name, upload date, and type. Effortless Sorting: Sort by key criteria: Organize your file list for optimal efficiency. Click on the column headers (e.g., Name, Uploaded) to sort by that specific criteria, allowing you to quickly find the most recent files or prioritize based on file name. Advanced Filtering: Refine your search: Utilize zipBoard's powerful filters to narrow down your search results and pinpoint exactly what you need. Here are some key filter options you can leverage: Phases : Filter by customizable phases to view documents specific to a particular project stage (e.g., Design phase documents). Type: Focus on specific file types (e.g., images, PDFs, documents). Assigned To: See files assigned to particular team members. Status : Filter by file status (e.g., open, approved, in progress). Combine these features for ultimate control! For instance, you can search for "meeting notes" (search bar), then filter by "Phase" to see only meeting notes from the "Planning" phase. With zipBoard's search, sorting, and filtering functionalities, you'll spend less time searching and more time getting things done! Did this answer your question? Cleaned Article Content: How to find the documents and digital assets you need in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help How to find the documents and digital assets you need in zipBoard? Never waste time hunting for files again! zipBoard's robust search and organization features ensure you can effortlessly locate any document or digital asset within your projects. This guide will equip you with the knowledge to navigate your content with ease. Powerful Search: Intuitive search bar: Simply type the file name or relevant keywords into the search bar located at the top of your task list. zipBoard will instantly surface any matching documents and assets. Multiple Views: Kanban board visualization : Prefer a visual layout? Choose the Kanban board view to see your files arranged on cards, providing a quick overview of your project's progress. Detailed table view: For a more comprehensive breakdown, switch to the table view. This view displays a list of your files with detailed information like file name, upload date, and type. Effortless Sorting: Sort by key criteria: Organize your file list for optimal efficiency. Click on the column headers (e.g., Name, Uploaded) to sort by that specific criteria, allowing you to quickly find the most recent files or prioritize based on file name. Advanced Filtering: Refine your search: Utilize zipBoard's powerful filters to narrow down your search results and pinpoint exactly what you need. Here are some key filter options you can leverage: Phases : Filter by customizable phases to view documents specific to a particular project stage (e.g., Design phase documents). Type: Focus on specific file types (e.g., images, PDFs, documents). Assigned To: See files assigned to particular team members. Status : Filter by file status (e.g., open, approved, in progress). Combine these features for ultimate control! For instance, you can search for "meeting notes" (search bar), then filter by "Phase" to see only meeting notes from the "Planning" phase. With zipBoard's search, sorting, and filtering functionalities, you'll spend less time searching and more time getting things done! Did this answer your question? Name: The Essential Guide For Aec Teams
Article Content: The Guide for AEC Teams - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact The Guide for AEC Teams zipBoard is a powerful tool designed to streamline the review and management of construction documents and designs. This guide will help architects effectively use zipBoard, ensuring smooth collaboration and efficient project management. Complete Workflow for All zipBoard Users Getting Started with zipBoard Sign Up and Set Up Your Profile Visit the zipBoard website and sign up for an account. Complete your profile with relevant information. Create a New Project Navigate to the dashboard. Click on "Create New Project." Enter project details such as Project ID, Title, and description. Projects are like folders. So you can create projects based on teams, or the projects that teams are doing, anything you wish to do. Create Project Phase AEC Project Managers can establish phases to monitor project progress. Typical phases might include Design, Pre-Construction, Construction, and Post-Construction. They also need to configure statuses at the project or organizational level . Invite AEC Team and Stakeholders Invite Stakeholders Project managers may opt to include architects, engineers, contractors, and managers in the review process to ensure comprehensive collaboration and feedback. Project managers may also invite clients . Involving clients in the review process fosters transparency, aligns expectations, and ensures their vision is accurately represented throughout the project lifecycle. Share Files After uploading AEC-specific content and adding collaborators, project managers in the AEC industry can share the project with stakeholders for review. Sharing the project enables other stakeholders to access the content and provide feedback from their respective locations. AEC project managers can customize sharing settings to control who within the team and client base has access to the project and what permissions they possess. Uploading and Managing Documents Upload Files Click on "Add Content" and select the documents you want to add. zipBoard supports various file formats, including PDFs, images, and CAD drawings. You may also click a specific phase and add some contents Annotate and Markup Documents Click on the document you wish to review. Use the annotation tools to add comments, markups, shapes, highlights, and other annotations directly on the document. Leverage cloud annotations for real-time collaboration and ensure all team members can see updates instantly. Collaboration and Communication Assign Tasks and Comments Click on specific areas of the document to add comments or suggestions. You may also reply to an existing comments Assign tasks to team members directly, specifying due dates and priorities. Use the project dashboard to track the progress of assigned tasks and comments . Review and Approve Documents Set up a review process or workflow where team members can approve or request changes to documents. If you are the head of the project, you may approve, reject, or make actions to a comment directly in the document. If you invited external stakeholders to review the file, you can triage their comments, and transform them into tasks. Advanced Features Dynamic and Run-Time Stamping Use dynamic and run-time stamps to add approval or review stamps to documents. Customize stamps with relevant information such as date and reviewer name. Keep track of all changes and approvals with automated version control. Add Images and Links Add images directly to your documents to provide visual references or additional information. Insert hyperlinks within the document to external resources or other parts of the project for easy reference. Integration Integrate zipBoard with other tools you use, such as project management software, cloud storage services, or other applications. Microsoft Integration JIRA Integration WRIKE Integration Slack Integration LambdaTest Integration Ensure a seamless workflow by connecting zipBoard to your existing project management ecosystem. Best Practices for Architects Using zipBoard Regularly update project documents and keep team members informed of changes. Use comments and annotations to provide clear, concise feedback. Keep documents well-organized with phases and tags to ensure easy access and retrieva l. Regularly monitor the progress of tasks and reviews to keep the project on track. zipBoard offers architects a robust platform for managing construction documents and collaborating with team members. By following this guide, you can maximize the efficiency of your workflow, enhance communication, and ensure the success of your projects. Did this answer your question? Name: How Version Control Works In Zipboard
Article Content: How Document Version Control Works in zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Document Version Control Works in zipBoard? This guide will help you understand and utilize our new and improved document version control system. Managing your project files is now easier and more efficient. Let's get started! The Problem with Managing Revisions When working on editing documents and content, you often need to manage revisions and gather feedback on the latest version while still being able to view feedback from previous versions. Without an effective system, this process can become confusing and inefficient, making collaboration difficult and hindering productivity. The New Version Control Solution With our updated version control, you can now manage your file revisions seamlessly within the same task. Here are the key features of this new system: Add New Versions Seamlessly As you make revisions, simply upload the updated version within the same task. There is no need to create separate entries for each version. This keeps your project files organized and easy to manage. Track Changes with Ease zipBoard automatically tracks all uploaded versions and displays them in a clear timeline. This feature removes confusion and ensures you always know which version is the most current. It also makes it easy to review the history of changes made to any file. Maintain a Clean Workspace To keep your task manager organized, you can hide older versions that you no longer need. This ensures that everyone on your team is referencing the most current iteration of each file, helping to avoid any potential mix-ups or errors. Review with Your Entire Team in One Place Share and collaborate on different versions with your team directly within zipBoard. This centralized approach to file management enhances collaboration and ensures everyone is on the same page. Step-by-Step Process to Use Version Control Follow these simple steps to use the new version control system in zipBoard: Select the File Inside the Project Navigate to the project and select the file you want to update. Click 'Upload a New Version' Click on the 'Upload a New Version' button. Choose the New File Select the new file you want to upload. Start Reviewing Once the new version is uploaded, you can start reviewing it. The new version will appear at the top of the list, with older versions listed below. Important Notes Deleting Files: Currently, you cannot delete the old file, but you can delete the new file if needed. Review and Share: Both the original file and the new version can be reviewed and shared with your team. Conclusion With zipBoard's enhanced version control, managing file revisions is now straightforward and efficient. Keep your workspace organized, track changes effortlessly, and collaborate with your team like never before. For any further assistance, feel free to reach out to our support team. Happy project managing with zipBoard! Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Getting Started With The Zipboard Outlook Plugin
Article Content: Getting Started with the zipBoard Outlook Plugin - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started with the zipBoard Outlook Plugin Managing tasks and projects can be challenging, especially when you constantly need to switch between different applications. This fragmentation often leads to missed tasks, decreased productivity, and inefficient communication. To address this issue, we created the zipBoard Outlook Plugin, allowing you to seamlessly integrate task management directly into your email workflow. This powerful tool helps you stay organized, ensuring that all tasks are logged, tracked, and managed without leaving your Outlook inbox. Prerequisites Before you begin, ensure you have the following: A zipBoard account with an active subscription. Microsoft Outlook desktop application (Windows or Mac). Step-by-Step Instructions 1. Launch the Microsoft Outlook desktop application. 2. Select and open any email in your inbox. 3. Within the email window, click on the 'Apps' icon or menu to access the add-ins. 4. In the Marketplace, search for "zipBoard Outlook Plugin." Alternatively, browse the available integrations and add-ons category to find it. 5. Once you locate the zipBoard Outlook Plugin, click 'Add' to install it. Using the zipBoard Outlook Plugin Select an email and click on the zipBoard icon in the 'Apps' section. Log in with your zipBoard credentials. Fill out the required fields such as Project, Title, Priority, Type, and Description. Click 'Create New Task' to log the task. A confirmation banner will appear, indicating that the task was created successfully. Click 'View task at ZipBoard app' to be redirected to the task within the zipBoard platform. Additional Tips Ensure you have the latest version of Outlook installed for optimal performance. Regularly check for updates to the zipBoard Outlook Plugin to access new features and improvements. Troubleshooting If you encounter any issues, consider the following steps: Ensure your device is connected to the internet. Make sure your Outlook application is up-to-date. If problems persist, try removing and reinstalling the zipBoard Outlook Plugin. If you need further assistance, reach out to zipBoard support for help. Conclusion The zipBoard Outlook Plugin is a powerful tool that streamlines task management by integrating directly with your email workflow. By following this guide, you can efficiently set up and use the plugin to enhance your productivity. For more information and support, contact support@zipboard.co Did this answer your question? Name: New Update On Ai Powered Statuses
Article Content: New Update on AI-Powered Statuses - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact New Update on AI-Powered Statuses With our latest update, we've introduced AI-powered statuses to streamline your workflow. This feature leverages top suggestions from ChatGPT, offering you pre-defined statuses relevant to your project. Here's a guide on how to use these new features: Permissions Who can add statuses? Super admin, admin, project owner: all of these users can add new statuses. Who can set default statuses for project? Super admin, admin, project owner can set the default status. Who can delete project level statuses? Super admin, admin, project owner can delete the statuses. ‚ö†Ô∏è The default statuses set by users will NOT be deleted Add Recommended Architecture, Engineering, and Construction Statuses Action: Select "Add recommended Architecture, Engineering, and Construction statuses" from the drop-down under ‚ÄúBulk Actions (AI powered).‚Äù Click "Apply." To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Software Development Statuses Action: Select "Add recommended Software Development statuses" from the drop-down under ‚ÄúBulk Actions (AI powered).‚Äù Click "Apply." To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Education and eLearning Statuses Action: Select "Add recommended Education and eLearning statuses" from the drop-down under ‚ÄúBulk Actions (AI powered).‚Äù Click "Apply." To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Marketing and Advertising Statuses Action: Select "Add recommended Marketing and Advertising statuses" from the drop-down under ‚ÄúBulk Actions (AI powered).‚Äù Click "Apply." To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Manufacturing Statuses Action: Select "Add recommended Manufacturing statuses" from the drop-down under ‚ÄúBulk Actions (AI powered).‚Äù Click "Apply." To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Finance and Banking Statuses Action: Select "Add recommended Finance and Banking statuses" from the drop-down under ‚ÄúBulk Actions (AI powered).‚Äù Click "Apply." To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Legal Statuses Action: Select "Add recommended Legal statuses" from the drop-down under ‚ÄúBulk Actions (AI powered).‚Äù Click "Apply." To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. By following these steps, you can efficiently manage your project statuses using the new AI-powered suggestions. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please contact our support team. To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Finance and Banking Statuses Action: Select "Add recommended Finance and Banking statuses" from the drop-down under ‚ÄúBulk Actions (AI powered).‚Äù Click "Apply." To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Legal Statuses Action: Select "Add recommended Legal statuses" from the drop-down under ‚ÄúBulk Actions (AI powered).‚Äù Click "Apply." To Save: Click "Save all suggested statuses." To Remove: Click the "x" button beside individual statuses or select "Delete unsaved statuses" from the drop-down to remove all suggested statuses. By following these steps, you can efficiently manage your project statuses using the new AI-powered suggestions. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please contact our support team. Name: How To Manage Custom Statuses
Article Content: How to Manage Custom Statuses? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Manage Custom Statuses? Managing your project‚Äôs statuses effectively is crucial for maintaining a streamlined workflow. Custom statuses in zipBoard allow you to tailor your project‚Äôs progress tracking to meet your team‚Äôs unique needs. This guide will walk you through managing custom statuses, including how to delete them, handle statuses associated with tasks, and avoid duplicate statuses. Deleting All Custom Statuses Action: Select the option "Delete all custom statuses." Result: This will remove all custom statuses, retaining only the default ones. Note: If you attempt to add a custom status that already exists in the project, the system will prevent duplicates by not adding it again. Deleting a Status with Associated Tasks If you try to delete a status that has associated tasks, a prompt will appear. This prompt will ask you to select another status to replace the one being deleted. Once you choose a new status and click "Apply," the original status will be deleted, and all associated tasks will be updated to the newly selected status. Duplicate Status Detection zipBoard automatically detects and prevents the creation of duplicate statuses. This feature ensures that your project overview remains clean and efficient, preventing confusion and maintaining clarity across your team‚Äôs workflow. By following these steps, you can easily manage custom statuses in your projects, ensuring that your workflow stays organized and efficient. Did this answer your question? Name: How To Add Statuses On A Task Level
Article Content: How to Add Statuses on a Task Level? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Add Statuses on a Task Level? Adding specific statuses to tasks is an essential part of managing your projects efficiently in zipBoard. Customizing statuses at the task level allows you to track progress and updates more precisely, ensuring every team member knows exactly where each task stands. Follow the steps below to add a status to a task: Step 1: Access the Task List First, navigate to the Task List where you can view all the tasks associated with your project. This is the central place for managing and updating your tasks. Step 2: Select a Task Click on the task you want to update. This will open up the task details, allowing you to make the necessary changes. Step 3: Add a New Status Navigate to the status section within the task details. Here, you‚Äôll see an option to "Add New." Click on this to add a new status. Step 4: Enter Your Desired Status Once you click "Add New," a field will appear where you can type in your desired status. After entering the status, it will be applied to the task, helping you to keep your project organized and up-to-date. By following these simple steps, you can easily customize and manage statuses on a task level, ensuring clear communication and effective project management. Did this answer your question?
