Name: Zipboard Add In For Microsoft Outlook
Article Content: Getting Started with the zipBoard Add-in for Microsoft Outlook - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started with the zipBoard Add-in for Microsoft Outlook The zipBoard Add-in seamlessly integrates with Microsoft Outlook, allowing you to create and manage tasks directly from your email. This guide will help you get started with the zipBoard Add-in, including how to log in, register a new account, and troubleshoot common issues. Prerequisites: Outlook on the web or app: Ensure you are using Outlook on a supported web browser or app. zipBoard account: A zipBoard account is required to use this add-in. If you don't have one, you can sign up or contact our sales team. Step 1: Installing the zipBoard Add-in Before you can start using the zipBoard Add-in, make sure it's installed in your Microsoft Outlook. Open Microsoft Outlook on your computer. Navigate to the Home tab and select Get Add-ins . In the Add-ins window, search for zipBoard . Click Add to install the zipBoard Add-in. Alternatively, if you are using Outlook on the browser, you may get the add-in via this link , and select zipBoard Add-in for Outlook. Step 2: Accessing the zipBoard Add-in Once installed, you can access the zipBoard Add-in directly from your Outlook interface: In the Outlook toolbar, locate the zipBoard icon. Click on the icon to open the zipBoard Add-in pane on the right side of your screen. Step 3: Logging in to the zipBoard Add-in When you first open the zipBoard Add-in, you'll see a login screen like the one below: To start using the add-in: Enter your email and password in the provided fields. Click Login . Don't Have a zipBoard Account? If you're new to zipBoard, you‚Äôll need to create an account to use the add-in: Click on the Register here link below the login form. You‚Äôll be redirected to the registration page where you can create your account. Once registered, return to the add-in and log in with your new credentials. Forgot Your Password? If you‚Äôve forgotten your password: Click on the Forgot password? link. Follow the prompts to reset your password. After resetting, return to the add-in and log in. Step 4: Using the zipBoard Add-in After logging in, you can start managing your tasks directly from Outlook. The zipBoard Add-in allows you to: Convert emails into tasks quickly. Assign priorities and track progress without leaving your inbox. Collaborate with your team by keeping everyone on the same page. Need Help? If you encounter any issues or need assistance, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to our support team: Email: support@zipboard.co Visit our website: https://zipboard.co/ Conclusion The zipBoard Add-in for Microsoft Outlook is a powerful tool that brings task management into your inbox, making it easier to stay on top of your projects. Follow the steps above to get started and streamline your workflow with zipBoard. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Managing Task Types At The Project Level
Article Content: Simplify Task Management with AI-Powered Task Types - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Simplify Task Management with AI-Powered Task Types We're excited to introduce two powerful enhancements to streamline your project workflows: AI-powered task types and customizable default statuses. With AI-driven suggestions tailored to your industry, managing tasks becomes more intuitive and efficient. Now, Super Admins, Admins, and Project Owners can easily set, modify, and delete task statuses, ensuring that your project management adapts perfectly to your team's unique needs. These enhanced and AI-powered task management updates are designed to boost productivity, making task organization smarter, faster, and more flexible than ever before. Watch here! Who Can Add, Set, and Delete Task Types? Super Admin, Admin, and Project Owner have the permissions to: Add new task types at the project level. Set the default task type for a project. Delete project-level task types. Default Task in Project Level The default task type is now user-defined. The task type selected as the default cannot be deleted , while all other task types can be removed. By default, the task is set to "BUG" , but this can be changed. Example : If the default status is set to "Enhancement," this status will be protected from deletion, and others can be deleted as needed. Next Steps: Getting Started with AI-Powered Task Types Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Getting Started And Using Ai Powered Task Types In Zipboard
Article Content: Getting Started with AI-Powered Task Types - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started with AI-Powered Task Types zipBoard‚Äôs AI-powered Task Types feature brings enhanced task organization to your projects by intelligently recommending task types based on your industry and project needs. This guide will walk you through the basics of accessing, enabling, and setting up AI-powered task types in zipBoard. What are AI-Powered Task Types? AI-powered task types use artificial intelligence to suggest predefined categories for tasks based on the nature of your project. Whether you are working in construction, design, or software development, zipBoard's AI tailors these suggestions to fit your industry, streamlining your workflow and improving project organization. Key Benefits: Automates task categorization based on industry standards. Reduces manual effort by recommending relevant task types. Customizable to meet unique project requirements. How to Access and Enable AI-Powered Task Types To start using AI-powered task types in zipBoard, follow these steps: Login to zipBoard : Open your project dashboard in zipBoard. Navigate to Task Types Select Your Industry : Choose the industry your project belongs to (e.g., Architecture, Engineering, Construction, etc.). This will help the AI suggest relevant task types. Save Changes : Click ‚ÄúSave‚Äù to apply the changes. Now, AI-powered task types are activated and ready for use in your project. Next Steps: Using AI-Powered Task Types in zipBoard FAQs Q: What industries are supported for AI-suggested task types? A: zipBoard supports a wide range of industries including Architecture, Engineering, Construction (AEC), Software Development, Marketing, and more. Did this answer your question? Name: Using Ai Powered Task Types In Zipboard
Article Content: Using AI-Powered Task Types in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Using AI-Powered Task Types in zipBoard zipBoard automatically generates task suggestions tailored to your specific industry. These AI-suggested task types are designed to streamline your workflow by offering relevant task categories based on common practices in your field. Here‚Äôs how you can make the most of these intelligent suggestions to enhance task management in your projects: How to Use AI-Powered Task Types Add Recommended Architecture, Engineering, and Construction Types : Select "Add Recommended Architecture, Engineering, and Construction statuses" from the "Bulk Actions (AI-powered)" dropdown. Click Apply to view the suggested task types. To save these suggestions, click "Save all suggested task types" . To remove individual suggestions, click the "x" button beside each status. Alternatively, select "Delete unsaved task types" to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Software Development Types : Select "Add Recommended Software Development statuses" from the dropdown and click Apply . Review the suggestions, save, or remove them as desired. Add Recommended Education and eLearning Types : Select "Add Recommended Education and eLearning types" from the dropdown and click Apply . Manage the suggested task types similarly. Add Recommended Marketing and Advertising Types : Select "Add Recommended Marketing and Advertising types" from the dropdown, click Apply , and review the suggested types. Add Recommended Manufacturing Types : Select "Add Recommended Manufacturing types" from the dropdown, click Apply , and manage the suggestions. Add Recommended Finance and Banking Types : Select "Add Recommended Finance and Banking types" from the dropdown, click Apply , and manage the suggestions. Add Recommended Legal Types : Select "Add Recommended Legal types" from the dropdown and click Apply . This feature is only available at a Project level only. Next Steps: Customizing Your Task Types in zipBoard Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Cleaned Article Content: Using AI-Powered Task Types in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Using AI-Powered Task Types in zipBoard zipBoard automatically generates task suggestions tailored to your specific industry. These AI-suggested task types are designed to streamline your workflow by offering relevant task categories based on common practices in your field. Here‚Äôs how you can make the most of these intelligent suggestions to enhance task management in your projects: How to Use AI-Powered Task Types Add Recommended Architecture, Engineering, and Construction Types : Select "Add Recommended Architecture, Engineering, and Construction statuses" from the "Bulk Actions (AI-powered)" dropdown. Click Apply to view the suggested task types. To save these suggestions, click "Save all suggested task types" . To remove individual suggestions, click the "x" button beside each status. Alternatively, select "Delete unsaved task types" to remove all suggested statuses. Add Recommended Software Development Types : Select "Add Recommended Software Development statuses" from the dropdown and click Apply . Review the suggestions, save, or remove them as desired. Add Recommended Education and eLearning Types : Select "Add Recommended Education and eLearning types" from the dropdown and click Apply . Manage the suggested task types similarly. Add Recommended Marketing and Advertising Types : Select "Add Recommended Marketing and Advertising types" from the dropdown, click Apply , and review the suggested types. Add Recommended Manufacturing Types : Select "Add Recommended Manufacturing types" from the dropdown, click Apply , and manage the suggestions. Add Recommended Finance and Banking Types : Select "Add Recommended Finance and Banking types" from the dropdown, click Apply , and manage the suggestions. Add Recommended Legal Types : Select "Add Recommended Legal types" from the dropdown and click Apply . This feature is only available at a Project level only. Name: Customizing Your Task Types In Zipboard
Article Content: Customizing Your Task Types in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Customizing Your Task Types in zipBoard zipBoard offers flexibility in how you organize and manage your project tasks. With Customizable Task Types , you can adjust default options or create new ones to align with your unique project needs. This guide will walk you through the process of customizing and creating task types, providing examples of how different industries can take advantage of this feature. Why Customize Task Types? Customizing task types allows you to tailor the task categories in zipBoard to fit your project‚Äôs workflow. Whether you‚Äôre working in construction, design, or software development, creating and modifying task types ensures that your project management structure is aligned with the way your team operates. Benefits of Customizing Task Types: Tailor task categories to match specific workflows. Standardize task management across teams and projects. Adapt zipBoard‚Äôs default suggestions to fit your unique project needs. How to Customize Default Task Types Follow these steps to customize the default task types in zipBoard: Login to zipBoard : Open your project dashboard in zipBoard. Navigate to Task Types : From your project dashboard, go to the Task Types section. Click ‚ÄúAdd New Task Type‚Äù : Click the button to Add New Task Type . Name Your Task Type : Enter the name of the new task type, such as ‚ÄúClient Feedback‚Äù or ‚ÄúDesign Approval.‚Äù Save Changes : Once you‚Äôve entered the details, click Save to apply the changes. Set as Default Task Type : After saving, you‚Äôll see a Default dropdown menu. Click the dropdown and select the task type you want to set as the default for your project. This process allows you to customize and standardize task types based on your specific project or industry needs. Examples of Common Custom Task Types by Industry Here are examples of custom task types that can be useful in different industries: Architecture and Engineering (AEC) : RFI (Request for Information) Submittal Review Site Inspection Creative Agencies : Concept Review Client Approval Final Proofing Software Development : Code Review Bug Fix Feature Development eLearning : Course Content Creation Instructional Design Review Assessment Design These task types reflect common workflows within each industry and can help teams stay organized and efficient. Name: Managing Task Types In Your Project
Article Content: Managing Task Types in Your Project - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Managing Task Types in Your Project In zipBoard, efficient task management is critical to ensuring smooth workflows. By managing your task types‚Äîwhether adding, editing, or deleting them‚Äîyou can tailor your project structure to your team‚Äôs specific needs. This guide will walk you through the steps to manage task types and maintain a streamlined workspace. Why Manage Task Types? Here are a few key reasons to actively manage task types: Prevent Duplication : Eliminate redundant task types that clutter your project. Adapt to Project Needs : Adjust task types as your project evolves. Keep Tasks Consistent : Standardize how tasks are categorized across the project for clarity. Deleting Task Types Managing task types effectively also involves knowing when and how to delete unnecessary or redundant task types. zipBoard offers flexible options for deleting task types, either in bulk or individually. 1. Bulk Deletion of Custom Task Types To delete all custom task types except for the default one: Access Task Types : From your project dashboard, go to the Task Types section. Click Bulk Actions (AI Powered) : In the task types settings, select the Bulk Actions dropdown. Choose an Option : Delete All Custom Task Types : This will remove all custom task types, keeping only the default type. Delete All Unsaved Task Types : This will remove any task types that haven‚Äôt been saved to the project. Note: If a task type already exists in the project, it won't be duplicated when custom types are added again. 2. Deleting Task Types Individually To delete a task type individually: Navigate to Task Types : In the Task Types section of your project settings, find the task type you want to delete. Click the ‚ÄúX‚Äù Button : Next to each custom task type, click the ‚ÄúX‚Äù to remove it. 3. Handling Task Types with Associated Tasks When deleting a task type that has tasks associated with it, zipBoard will prompt you to assign a new task type for those tasks. Here‚Äôs how the process works: Delete the Task Type : If the task type you are deleting has associated tasks, a pop-up will appear prompting you to select a replacement task type. Select a New Task Type : Choose a new task type from the list. Apply Changes : Once selected, all tasks associated with the deleted type will be updated to reflect the new type. Note: Task types cannot be edited. If you need to change a task type, it‚Äôs best to delete the old one and replace it with a new, updated version. Did this answer your question? Name: How To Download Pdfs With Annotations And Comments In Zipboard
Article Content: How to Download PDFs with Annotations and Comments in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Download PDFs with Annotations and Comments in zipBoard Collaborating on PDFs becomes challenging when stakeholders need offline access to review annotations and comments, leading to potential miscommunication. To make the process easier, zipBoard now lets you download PDFs with all annotations and comments intact, ensuring feedback is accessible even without logging in. Where Can You Use This Feature? You can now download the annotated PDF to: Share via Email with stakeholders who prefer offline access or cannot log in to zipBoard. Save for Future Reference for use in meetings, presentations, or offline reviews. Note : Comments will only appear in standard PDF readers (such as Chrome or Adobe Acrobat) that support annotated PDFs. Ensure your viewer is compatible to access all feedback. Here‚Äôs how you can use this feature: Step-by-Step Guide to Download PDFs with Annotations 1. Open the Project Log in to your zipBoard account. Navigate to the Project where the PDF you want to download is located. 2. Select the PDF File Within the project, locate and click on the PDF file you want to review . 3. Open the Review Panel After selecting the PDF, click Review to open the file for annotations and comments. 4. Access the Download Option On the Review screen , click on the Settings icon (‚öôÔ∏è) at the top-right corner. 5. Download the PDF In the settings dropdown, select Download PDF . This will generate a PDF that includes all the annotations and comments added during the review process. 6. Open the PDF Using Chrome (or Any PDF Viewer) Once downloaded, open the PDF in Google Chrome or another PDF viewer. Tip: In Chrome, hover your mouse over any annotation to reveal comments. This ensures that all feedback is clearly displayed for review. Why Use This Feature? Seamless collaboration : Share annotated PDFs easily with stakeholders who prefer offline access. Clear feedback : Ensure that reviewers can view all comments without needing to log in to zipBoard. Efficient workflows : Use the downloaded PDFs for meetings, presentations, or offline reviews. Name: Managing Your Billing And Subscription
Article Content: Managing Your Billing and Subscription - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Managing Your Billing and Subscription Overview This article will guide you through managing your billing, updating payment details, switching plans, and canceling your subscription. What Happens After the Free Trial Ends? Once your free trial ends, you‚Äôll automatically move to the plan you initially selected . If you want to switch to a different plan , you can do so at any time ‚Äîno restrictions! How to Switch Plans or Update Payment Details Go to : Manage Organization > Billing in your Account Settings . From there, you can: Change your plan to suit your needs . Add or update payment details to avoid interruptions in service. Canceling Your Subscription Cancel anytime, hassle-free ‚Äîwe won‚Äôt lock you in! Just visit Manage Organization > Billing and follow the steps to cancel your plan. Need More Help? If you have any further questions or run into issues, feel free to contact our support team ( support@zipboard.co). We're here to help! Did this answer your question? Name: How To Use Ai Powered Autotagging For Tasks
Article Content: How to Use AI-Powered Autotagging for Tasks - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Use AI-Powered Autotagging for Tasks Efficient task management requires consistent tagging for easy organization and quick access. However, manually adding tags can be repetitive, especially when managing multiple projects with numerous tasks. Inconsistent tagging can also make it challenging to find specific tasks and track project progress effectively. The new AI-powered auto tagging feature in zipBoard simplifies this process by automatically suggesting tags based on the task title and file name. With just a few clicks, your tasks will be organized with minimal effort‚Äîand you can fully customize the tags to suit your specific project needs. How It Works Select a Project : Start by navigating to the project where you want to add a task. Go to Tasks : In the project dashboard, locate the ‚ÄúTasks‚Äù section. Add a Task : Click on ‚ÄúAdd Task‚Äù to open the task creation window. Enter a Task Title : As you type a descriptive title, the AI will analyze both the title and any associated file name to generate relevant tagging suggestions. Apply Suggested Tags and Customize : The AI will automatically apply relevant tags to the task. If any of the suggested tags don‚Äôt align with your needs, you can easily remove them. You also have the option to add your own custom tags , giving you full control over how each task is labeled and organized. Why Use AI-Powered Autotagging? Save Time : Automate the tagging process, letting the AI handle the details so you can focus on higher-priority tasks. Stay Organized : Consistent, AI-driven tags make it easier to retrieve tasks and maintain clear organization across projects. Reduce Errors : With AI suggestions, the risk of missing or irrelevant tags is minimized, ensuring a smoother workflow and better tracking. Customize Tags to Fit Your Needs : Tailor the tags to fit your project‚Äôs specific requirements by adding, adjusting, or removing tags as necessary. This feature empowers your team to spend less time on administrative tasks and more time on project progress, all while maintaining a well-organized system for tracking and managing work. Name: How To Use Auto Tagging For Files
Article Content: How to Auto-Tag Files - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Auto-Tag Files Managing files within projects can become challenging when they pile up and lack clear organization. Finding the right file in the middle of a busy project is crucial, yet manually tagging each one can be time-consuming. That‚Äôs why zipBoard introduces Auto-Tagging for Files , a feature that automatically applies tags based on file names, simplifying file management in every project. How It Works With Auto-Tagging for Files, zipBoard uses AI to detect keywords in file names as you upload them, assigning relevant tags instantly. Here‚Äôs a quick guide to using this feature: Select a Project : Begin by navigating to the project where you want to manage files. Go to Files : In the project‚Äôs main dashboard, select the ‚ÄúFiles‚Äù section to view your current files or add new ones. Upload Files : When uploading a file, zipBoard‚Äôs AI scans the file name and applies relevant tags automatically, based on keywords it identifies. Customize Tags as Needed : After the tags are applied, you can review and adjust them. If the AI-selected tags don‚Äôt completely fit, simply remove them or add new tags to best suit your organization. Why Use Auto-Tagging for Files? Instant Organization : Tags are applied immediately upon upload, keeping your files organized without the extra effort. Effortless Retrieval : With consistent tags, finding files across projects becomes faster and easier, reducing the need to search through multiple folders. Reduced Tagging Effort : Skip the manual tagging process and let AI handle the initial tagging, while you retain the option to adjust tags as needed. Adaptable to Your Needs : You have full control to add, edit, or remove tags, making it easy to customize file organization to match your project‚Äôs unique requirements. With Auto-Tagging for Files, zipBoard takes care of the initial steps in file organization, ensuring that your team can locate and use files with ease‚Äîsaving valuable time and allowing more focus on the project itself. Name: Getting Started With Zipboard For Aec Professionals
Article Content: Getting Started with zipBoard: For AEC Professionals - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started with zipBoard: For AEC Professionals Managing and reviewing construction documents like blueprints, specifications, and RFIs can be overwhelming without the right tools. With zipBoard , you can collaborate on PDF documents more efficiently, ensuring your team stays aligned, issues are resolved quickly, and projects progress smoothly. This guide walks you through the essential steps to get started with zipBoard for managing construction documents . Step 1: Upload Construction Documents (PDFs) Log in to your zipBoard account and navigate to your project dashboard . Click "Add Files" and select PDF documents from your computer. Project Managers can organize documents into phases or categories (e.g., Blueprints , Specifications , RFIs ) to track progress more effectively. They can also define statuses at the project level (e.g., In Review , Approved , Final ) or across the organization for consistent workflows. üìå Pro Tip : Use descriptive file names (e.g., BuildingA-Blueprint-v3.pdf ) to keep track of document versions. Step 2: Annotate and Review Open a PDF from your project dashboard. Use zipBoard‚Äôs annotation tools to: Mark issues directly on the blueprint. Add comments to highlight questions, approvals, or corrections. Assign tasks to team members for follow-up. üìå Example : Highlight an outdated window spec on a blueprint and comment, "Please confirm updated dimensions." You can reply to comments, accept or reject them, and mark annotations as Complete or Cancelled directly from the document. Additionally, manage your own comments by editing or deleting them as needed to keep feedback organized. Step 3: Version Control Upload new versions of documents to maintain a clean workflow. üìå Pro Tip : Always upload the most recent version to ensure the team works on accurate data. Step 4: Collaborate with Your Team Share the document link with stakeholders via share link! Allow external collaborators (e.g., contractors) to review and comment without requiring a zipBoard account. Set access permissions to control who can view or edit specific files. Step 5: How to Track and Prioritize Feedback from Guests in zipBoard Once feedback starts coming in from collaborators and stakeholders, project managers need to triage and organize it effectively. Triage Feedback : Sort incoming comments based on their relevance, urgency, and impact on the project. Prioritize Actionable Feedback : Focus on addressing feedback that aligns with the project goals and objectives. Learn more about tracking and prioritizing feedback here . Step 6: Generate Reports Use zipBoard‚Äôs reporting tools to compile feedback and unresolved tasks into a shareable report. Share reports during construction meetings to prioritize action items. Step 7: Customize Workflows Set up project-specific workflows (e.g., Review ‚Üí Approval ‚Üí Finalization ) for construction document review. Use task statuses to track document progress at every stage. Benefits of Using zipBoard for Construction Documents Centralized Collaboration : Keep all documents and feedback in one place. Error Reduction : Annotate directly on blueprints to avoid miscommunications. Faster Approvals : Streamlined workflows mean quicker decision-making. Improved Accountability : Assign tasks and track their completion. For additional help, check out our Help Center or reach out to support. Did this answer your question? Name: Getting Started With Zipboard For Learning Designers
Article Content: Getting Started with zipBoard: For Learning Designers - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started with zipBoard: For Learning Designers As a learning designer, managing and collaborating on SCORM packages, instructional videos, and e-learning PDFs can be challenging. zipBoard simplifies this process by providing a central platform for reviewing, annotating, and tracking progress. This guide helps you navigate zipBoard‚Äôs features tailored to learning design workflows. Step 1: Set Up Your Project Log in to zipBoard and click " Create a New Project. " Name your project or specify the type of learning materials you‚Äôll review (e.g., SCORM Modules, Training Videos, PDF Guides). Set statuses at the project level (e.g., Draft, Review, Final) to reflect your workflow. üìå Pro Tip : Organize your project into phases , such as Storyboard Review, SCORM Testing, and Video Feedback. Step 2: Upload Learning Materials Navigate to your project dashboard and click "Add Files." Upload SCORM packages, video files, or PDFs. For SCORM content , zipBoard can host and preview the content directly. Categorize files into phases (e.g., Module 1, Assessments) to streamline navigation. üìå Example : Upload a PDF guide for Module 1 and categorize it under Learner Handouts. Step 3: Annotate and Review Content Open any uploaded file (e.g., a SCORM module, video, or PDF). Use annotation tools to: Mark issues or suggest edits directly on the file. Add timestamps on videos for precise feedback. Highlight text in PDFs to point out errors or suggest revisions. Reply to comments, accept/reject feedback, and mark annotations as Resolved or Cancelled . üìå Pro Tip : Use zipBoard's comment threads to collaborate in real time with stakeholders. Step 4: Track SCORM Package Testing Preview SCORM content directly in zipBoard to test navigation, interactivity, and completion tracking. Report any bugs or inconsistencies by creating tasks linked to specific slides or elements. üìå Example : If a quiz question in a SCORM package doesn‚Äôt load, highlight the issue and tag the developer to fix it. Step 5: Share Learning Materials with Stakeholders From the project dashboard, select the SCORM package, video, or PDF you want to share. Click "Share Link" and customize permissions: Viewer Only : Allow collaborators to view the material without editing or commenting. Commenter : Enable reviewers to add annotations or comments. Share the link with stakeholders via email or integrate it into platforms like Microsoft Teams or Slack. üìå Pro Tip : Use zipBoard‚Äôs guest access feature to involve external reviewers (e.g., SMEs or clients) without requiring them to create an account. Step 6: Track and Prioritize Feedback Once feedback starts coming in, it‚Äôs essential to organize and act on it: Triage feedback based on its urgency, relevance, and impact on learner outcomes. Prioritize actionable feedback that aligns with project goals. Learn more about tracking and prioritizing feedback here . Step 7: Manage Versions and Updates Upload updated versions of SCORM files, videos, or PDFs as feedback is implemented. Step 8: Generate Reports Use zipBoard‚Äôs reporting tools to compile feedback and unresolved tasks into a shareable report. Share reports during construction meetings to prioritize action items. Benefits of Using zipBoard for Learning Design Centralized Review : Host and manage SCORM, videos, and PDFs in one place. Streamlined Feedback : Annotate directly on content for precise and actionable reviews. Version Control : Ensure stakeholders always see the latest iteration of the material. Collaboration Made Easy : Engage with reviewers in real time, even if they‚Äôre external to your team. Did this answer your question? Name: Getting Started With Zipboard For Web Designers
Article Content: Getting Started with zipBoard: For Web Designers - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started with zipBoard: For Web Designers Getting Started with zipBoard: For Web Designers Web design projects often involve multiple stakeholders, feedback cycles, and the need to track changes efficiently. zipBoard simplifies this by providing tools to review and collaborate on live websites or design files in one centralized platform. This guide will walk you through how to use zipBoard effectively for your web design projects. Step 1: Set Up Your Project Log in to your zipBoard account and create a new project. Name your project after your website or client (e.g., ClientABC Website Redesign). Define project-level statuses (e.g., In Progress, Ready for Review, Approved) to reflect your workflow. Step 2: Add Your Website for Review Navigate to the project dashboard and click "Add URL" to add your website or web page. Paste the live URL or staging link you want to review. zipBoard allows real-time feedback on live websites. Organize links into categories (e.g., Desktop Version, Mobile View, Landing Pages) for streamlined reviews. üìå Pro Tip : If your website isn‚Äôt live, you can upload image mockups or design files instead. Step 3: Annotate and Provide Feedback Open the added web page or mockup in zipBoard. Use annotation tools to: Pinpoint specific elements (e.g., incorrect fonts, alignment issues) and suggest changes. Add comments or create tasks for functionality issues (e.g., broken links, slow-loading sections). Reply to feedback, accept/reject suggestions, and mark annotations as Complete or Cancelled directly from the web page. üìå Example : Highlight a misaligned button on the homepage and comment, "Please center-align the button and adjust padding." Step 4: Test Website Responsiveness Use zipBoard to review your website on different screen sizes and devices. Add annotations directly to mobile or tablet views to highlight issues specific to those formats. üìå Pro Tip : Label tasks with tags like Mobile, Desktop, or Tablet to keep them organized. Step 5: Track and Prioritize Feedback Feedback from clients and stakeholders can quickly accumulate. Here‚Äôs how to stay on top of it: Triage Feedback : Organize feedback by urgency, relevance, and its impact on the design goals. Prioritize Actionable Tasks : Address issues that improve user experience or meet client requirements. Learn more about tracking and prioritizing feedback here . Step 6: Share the Website with Stakeholders Share the live website or staging link for review by clicking " Share Link" from the project dashboard. Customize permissions: Commenter: Allow clients to leave feedback on specific sections of the site. Viewer Only: For stakeholders who only need to see the design without adding input. üìå Pro Tip : Use guest access for clients who don‚Äôt have zipBoard accounts, ensuring easy collaboration. Step 7: Manage Versions and Updates Upload updated versions of mockups or update the live website link as changes are made. Benefits of Using zipBoard for Web Design Real-Time Collaboration : Annotate live websites or mockups directly for immediate feedback. Centralized Feedback : Keep all comments, tasks, and updates in one place. Device-Specific Reviews : Ensure designs look great on all screen sizes. Version Tracking : Maintain a history of design iterations for reference. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Getting Started With Zipboard For Technical Writers
Article Content: Getting Started with zipBoard: For Technical Writers - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Getting Started with zipBoard: For Technical Writers As a technical writer, working with PDF documents often involves reviewing, updating, and collaborating on complex content. zipBoard streamlines this process, allowing you to annotate, manage versions, and collaborate efficiently with stakeholders, all within one platform. This guide will help you get started with zipBoard to enhance your workflow when working with PDF documents. Step 1: Set Up Your Project Log in to your zipBoard account and create a new project. Name your project after the document or manual you're working on (e.g., User Manual for Product X). Define project-level statuses (e.g., In Draft, In Review, Final Version) to reflect your document‚Äôs progress. üìå Pro Tip : Break the project down into phases or sections (e.g., Installation Guide, API Reference, Troubleshooting) to stay organized. Step 2: Upload Your PDF Document Navigate to the project dashboard and click " Add Files ." Upload the PDF document you‚Äôre working on. Organize the document into phases or folders for easier navigation, especially for longer manuals. üìå Pro Tip : Use version control by naming your files clearly (e.g., User-Manual-v2.pdf ) to keep track of updates. Step 3: Annotate and Review the Document Open the PDF document and use the annotation tools to: Highlight text for corrections or revisions. Add comments to clarify instructions or provide additional information. Draw shapes or add arrows to show where visual elements need to be adjusted or added. Create tasks directly on the document for sections that need further development or approval. üìå Example : Highlight a confusing instruction and comment, "Please clarify the steps for installing the software." Step 4: Collaborate and Track Feedback Share the document with colleagues, SMEs, or clients by clicking "Share Link." Stakeholders can leave comments and feedback directly on the PDF, and you can respond, accept, or reject suggestions. Track feedback to ensure all issues are addressed. You can prioritize comments based on their urgency or relevance to the content. üìå Pro Tip : Use @mentions to tag specific people for feedback on particular sections or tasks. Step 5: Track and Prioritize Feedback Once feedback starts coming in from various reviewers, it's important to organize it: Triage Feedback : Sort comments based on importance, urgency, and impact on the document. Prioritize Actionable Changes : Focus on suggestions that will improve clarity, accuracy, and completeness. Learn more about tracking and prioritizing feedback here . Step 6: Manage Versions and Updates As revisions are made, upload updated versions of the PDF document to keep everything organized. üìå Example : If a section is restructured, you can upload the new version as User-Manual-v3.pdf . Benefits of Using zipBoard for Technical Writing Real-Time Collaboration : Review and annotate PDFs in real-time with stakeholders. Centralized Feedback : All feedback and comments are in one place for easy access. Version Control : Keep track of document revisions and easily revert to earlier versions if necessary. Task Management : Convert feedback into actionable tasks, ensuring nothing gets missed. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Zipboard Pricing Faq
Article Content: zipBoard Pricing FAQ - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact zipBoard Pricing FAQ 1. What is zipBoard‚Äôs Team Plan, and how does pricing work? Team Plan Overview: Base Number of Content Uploads: 20 Collaborators and Reviewers: Unlimited Managers Included: 1 (additional managers can be added for $25/month each) Billing Preferences: Monthly or Annually (Annual billing saves 16.6%) Pricing: Monthly Cost: $99 per month Additional Manager Cost: $25 per month (per manager) Example Price Breakdown: Base Plan Cost: $99 1 Additional Manager: $25 Total Monthly Cost: $124 The Team Plan is perfect for teams managing up to 20 content pieces with unlimited collaboration and review capabilities. If you need more managers or have specific requirements, we can customize the plan. 2. Can I get a customized monthly plan for my team? Yes, you can add additional managers to the Team Plan. Each additional manager is $25 per month. For instance, if you need one extra manager, your total monthly cost would be $124. For larger teams, please reach out, and we can discuss further customizations based on your specific needs. 3. What is zipBoard's pricing for different numbers of content items? Our pricing varies based on the number of content items you're reviewing and managing. Here's a breakdown: Number of Assets/Content Monthly Pricing (USD) Features Included Up to 50 $99 - $299 Basic support, core collaboration tools, annotations, comments 51 - 150 $299 - $599 Advanced collaboration features, integrations, and project management tools 151 - 350 $1,299 Enhanced support, SSO, advanced reporting 351+ Custom Pricing Tailored features, dedicated support, enterprise integration options For enterprise-wide integration or custom projects, we can design a bespoke pricing model that accounts for usage, integration complexity, and scalability. 4. How can I access zipBoard's full pricing details? You can view the full pricing details on our pricing page , where we have provided information for various plans based on content volume and features. 5. Is there any flexibility in pricing for large volumes or custom needs? Yes, for larger volumes (e.g., over 350 assets) or custom integrations (e.g., embedding zipBoard into your platform), we offer tailored pricing. Please contact us to discuss your specific use case, and we‚Äôll provide a pricing model that meets your needs. 6. How do I contact zipBoard for further pricing inquiries or to customize my plan? You can reach out to us directly via email at support@zipboard.co or through our contact form if you have more specific questions or would like to discuss custom pricing based on your team‚Äôs needs. We're happy to assist! Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Streamlining Your Workflows With Content Manager In Zipboard
Article Content: Streamlining Your Workflows with Content Manager in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Streamlining Your Workflows with Content Manager in zipBoard Contents: What is the Content Manager in zipBoard? Why is the Content Manager Important? How Different Teams use the Content Manager Key Features of the Content Manager Visual Workflow with Phases Tips & Best Practices for Using Content Manager Effectively Why Choose zipBoard for Your Content Management Needs? What is the Content Manager in zipBoard? zipBoard's Content Manager is a powerful tool designed to help you organize, manage, and collaborate on digital assets seamlessly. Tailored for industries like Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC), eLearning, and creative projects, content teams and technical writing teams, it centralizes your resources, ensures version control, and facilitates seamless team collaboration. The result? Streamlined workflows , reduced errors, and successful project outcomes. Whether you're handling architectural drawings, eLearning modules, technical documents, or creative assets, zipBoard‚Äôs Content Manager simplifies asset tracking, updates, and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Why is the Content Manager Important? Centralized Access : Keeps all files in one place. Say goodbye to scattered files‚Äîmanage everything from a single hub. Version Control of Digital Assets: Keep track of changes with a clear file history, avoiding confusion over multiple versions. Enhanced Collaboration : Foster real-time feedback loops and seamless team communication. Streamlined Workflows : Save time by automating repetitive tasks and maintaining consistency across projects. üí° Pro Tip: Pair the Content Manager with zipBoard‚Äôs Kanban board for a holistic project management experience. How Different Teams use the Content Manager AEC : Keep blueprints, RFIs, and submittals updated, allowing project teams and contractors to stay aligned and reduce delays. eLearning : Manage lesson materials, streamline content reviews , and track version histories effortlessly. Creative Teams : Simplify multimedia asset management , organize design files, and automate approval workflows . Content Teams : Manage editorial calendars, ensure version control for articles, blogs, and other content, and collaborate seamlessly with multiple contributors. Technical Writing Teams : Handle complex documents like user manuals, API documentation, and compliance files , ensuring accuracy, real-time feedback, and stakeholder approvals. Learn more : Explore our dedicated article on Effortless Document Management with zipBoard . üìå Related Resources : AEC Document Review Enhancing Document Reviews in Technical Writing with zipBoard Collaborative Document Review Software Review eLearning Courses Better with zipBoard Key Features of the Content Manager The Content Manager integrates seamlessly with zipBoard‚Äôs other tools, providing fields and functionalities such as: Development Phase : Track which stage your asset is in (e.g., Draft, Review, Final). Status : Monitor progress (e.g., Pending, Approved, Rejected). Due Date : Set clear deadlines for reviews and approvals. Assignee : Assign tasks to multiple collaborators for collective accountability. Description : Add detailed notes for context. Tags : Use tags for categorization and easy searchability. New Feature Alert! Assign a single content piece to multiple collaborators ‚Äîa unique functionality not available in zipBoard's Task Manager. Visual Workflow with Phases To create a comprehensive proofing process , the Content Manager allows you to assign and update phases for each content piece: Navigate to the Kanban board or Content Manager. Select the asset. Drag and drop it into the desired phase (e.g., Ideation, In Progress, Completed). This feature simplifies tracking the progress of individual content pieces while providing a visual overview of the entire workflow. Tips & Best Practices for Using Content Manager Effectively Organize with Folders and Tags : Group content logically using folders. Use descriptive tags for quick and easy retrieval. Harness Version Control : Always upload the latest version while retaining previous ones for reference. Assign Clear Roles : Ensure team members know who‚Äôs responsible for reviews , approvals , and final submissions . Integrate with Other Tools : Link with Google Drive, Dropbox , or other cloud storage for centralized access. Automate Workflows : Use automation for repetitive tasks such as reminders , approval notifications , or status updates . Why Choose zipBoard for Your Content Management Needs? Beyond the Content Manager, zipBoard offers: Visual Annotations : Collaborate effectively with markups directly on files. Real-Time Collaboration : Empower teams to give instant feedback across geographies. Dynamic Task Boards : Organize tasks with ease using Kanban and task lists. Seamless Integrations : Sync with tools you already use, like JIRA , for enhanced productivity. Ready to Transform Your Workflows? Elevate your project management and collaboration game with zipBoard‚Äôs Content Manager. Discover the advanced features like dynamic task boards, visual annotations , and real-time collaboration today! Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Back to Top üîù Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: How To Control Client Access In Zipboard File Sharing Made Simple
Article Content: How to Control Client Access When Sharing Files in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Control Client Access When Sharing Files in zipBoard zipBoard‚Äôs enhanced Client Share functionality gives you greater control over what content your clients can access. This feature helps you streamline workflows, improve security, and ensure seamless collaboration across projects. With the new Access Tab , you can easily grant, modify, or revoke client permissions‚Äîwithout disrupting internal collaboration. ‚ö†Ô∏è Client sharing is only available in the Enterprise plan ‚ö†Ô∏è üîë Key Benefits of Enhanced Client Sharing Keep Discussions Separate: Control which comments clients see while keeping internal discussions private. Adjust Client Access in Real Time: Grant, adjust, or revoke permissions as needed throughout the project. Streamline Feedback & Prioritization: Organize external feedback separately to reduce confusion and prioritize changes. Enhance Stakeholder Communication: Ensure the right people see updates, minimizing miscommunication and focusing on high-priority tasks. ‚ùìHow to Use the New Access Control Features The Client tab in the Share File modal has been transformed into a new Access tab for better usability. This update includes: Step 1: Open the Share File Modal Navigate to the file you wish to share and click the Share button. Step 2: Select Clients In the Client tab, choose the clients you want to share the file with. Existing clients will appear with their current permissions pre-selected. Step 3: Set Access Permissions Use the dropdown under the Access tab to select one of the following options: All Comments : Default setting where all Collaborator, Client, and Guest Reviewer comments are visible. Only External Comments : Restricts visibility to Client and Guest Reviewer comments only. Remove Access : Removes a client‚Äôs ability to view a previously shared file. Step 4: Save Changes Click Share to save your changes. Feedback messages will confirm the success or highlight any errors. Error and Success Messages To improve transparency, zipBoard now displays real-time notifications when adjusting client permissions. Error Messages: üî¥ No new client selected ‚Äì You must select at least one new client before sharing. üî¥ All selected clients already have access ‚Äì Clients already assigned cannot be reassigned. Success Messages: üü¢ File successfully shared with client. üü¢ Client can now view all comments. üü¢ Client can now view only external comments. üî¥ Client no longer has access to the file. Integration with Reviewboard Permissions set in the Share modal directly link to the Reviewboard, ensuring seamless client access: Clients with " Only External Comments " access can see replies on external comment threads. Clients with " All Comments " access can view all replies, including internal and external threads. Implementation Workflow Access Dropdown : Existing clients will have the option to "Remove Access" directly from the dropdown. Error Prevention : The "Remove Access" option is hidden for users who haven‚Äôt been assigned the file yet. Review Tracking Linkage : Unassigning clients in the main file modal will automatically reflect in the Client Share modal, ensuring consistency. How Different Teams Use Client Share Files AEC Teams : Securely share blueprints, revisions, and construction documents while controlling client access to sensitive data. eLearning Teams : Share course materials, training modules, and assessments with clients and stakeholders , ensuring they only have access to relevant content. Web Design Teams : Easily collaborate with clients by sharing design mockups and prototypes, enabling real-time feedback. Teams Using Markup Tools: Share annotated documents and designs, ensuring feedback is precise and actionable. Simplify Client Collaboration with zipBoard's Client Collaboration Tools Take control of your client access with zipBoard's enhanced sharing features. Seamlessly manage permissions, streamline feedback, and ensure secure collaboration with dynamic sharing options today! Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Enhance Stakeholder Communication: Ensure the right people see updates, minimizing miscommunication and focusing on high-priority tasks. ‚ùìHow to Use the New Access Control Features The Client tab in the Share File modal has been transformed into a new Access tab for better usability. This update includes: Step 1: Open the Share File Modal Navigate to the file you wish to share and click the Share button. Step 2: Select Clients In the Client tab, choose the clients you want to share the file with. Existing clients will appear with their current permissions pre-selected. Step 3: Set Access Permissions Use the dropdown under the Access tab to select one of the following options: All Comments : Default setting where all Collaborator, Client, and Guest Reviewer comments are visible. Only External Comments : Restricts visibility to Client and Guest Reviewer comments only. Remove Access : Removes a client‚Äôs ability to view a previously shared file. Step 4: Save Changes Click Share to save your changes. Feedback messages will confirm the success or highlight any errors. Error and Success Messages To improve transparency, zipBoard now displays real-time notifications when adjusting client permissions. Error Messages: üî¥ No new client selected ‚Äì You must select at least one new client before sharing. üî¥ All selected clients already have access ‚Äì Clients already assigned cannot be reassigned. Success Messages: üü¢ File successfully shared with client. üü¢ Client can now view all comments. üü¢ Client can now view only external comments. üî¥ Client no longer has access to the file. Integration with Reviewboard Permissions set in the Share modal directly link to the Reviewboard, ensuring seamless client access: Clients with " Only External Comments " access can see replies on external comment threads. Clients with " All Comments " access can view all replies, including internal and external threads. Implementation Workflow Access Dropdown : Existing clients will have the option to "Remove Access" directly from the dropdown. Error Prevention : The "Remove Access" option is hidden for users who haven‚Äôt been assigned the file yet. Review Tracking Linkage : Unassigning clients in the main file modal will automatically reflect in the Client Share modal, ensuring consistency. How Different Teams Use Client Share Files AEC Teams : Securely share blueprints, revisions, and construction documents while controlling client access to sensitive data. eLearning Teams : Share course materials, training modules, and assessments with clients and stakeholders , ensuring they only have access to relevant content. Web Design Teams : Easily collaborate with clients by sharing design mockups and prototypes, enabling real-time feedback. Teams Using Markup Tools: Share annotated documents and designs, ensuring feedback is precise and actionable. Simplify Client Collaboration with zipBoard's Client Collaboration Tools Take control of your client access with zipBoard's enhanced sharing features. Seamlessly manage permissions, streamline feedback, and ensure secure collaboration with dynamic sharing options today! Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Or start your 14-day Free Trial! üìå Related Sources New Client Sharing Controls in zipBoard: Manage External Feedback & Secure File Access Manage Clients‚Äô Feedback and Collaborate Better Working with SMEs and Clients: A Comprehensive Guide to Effective Collaboration for L&D Teams What‚Äôs the difference between Super Admin, Admin, Manager, Collaborator, Client, Guest Collaborator and Reviewer? Name: How To Streamline Your Workflow Using Status Filters In Zipboard
Article Content: How to Streamline Your Workflow Using Status Filters in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Streamline Your Workflow Using Status Filters in zipBoard Managing project tasks can be overwhelming, with multiple moving parts and statuses to track. Whether handling completed tasks, ongoing reviews, or urgent assignments, efficiently filtering statuses can save time and improve project visibility . With zipBoard‚Äôs status filters , you can focus on critical tasks, reduce distractions, and ensure nothing falls through the cracks. Here‚Äôs how to make the most of this powerful feature. üí° Why Status Filters Improve Team Efficiency Without a clear filtering system, managing multiple projects can lead to confusion and delays. zipBoard's status filters help you: ‚úÖ View only the tasks that matter, eliminating clutter . ‚úÖ Improve accuracy in project tracking . ‚úÖ Save time and ensure you stay on top of progress, bottlenecks, and approvals . Effortless Task Management Across Industries Whether you work in construction, design, eLearning, or web development , status filtering helps streamline workflows: üèóÔ∏è AEC Teams: Enhance construction document control. üé® Design & Web Teams: Improve content collaboration. üìö eLearning Teams: Organize and track content development. No matter your industry, zipBoard‚Äôs status filters keep your workflow organized and your team aligned. How to Use Status Filters in zipBoard Access Your Project Dashboard Log in to your zipBoard account and navigate to your project‚Äôs main dashboard. Select the ‚ÄòStatus‚Äô Filter Option In the task management section , locate the filter dropdown menu at the top of the tasks panel. Click on it to reveal the various status options. Choose Your Desired Status ‚úî Pending ‚úî In Progress ‚úî Completed ‚úî Approved You can also create custom statuses to match your workflow. Refine Your View You can combine multiple filters for an even more tailored view. For example, you can filter by task owner or priority in addition to status. Apply the Filter Once you‚Äôve selected the statuses (and other filters, if applicable), click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù to refresh the view. The tasks displayed will now match your criteria. Monitor and Update As you work, the status of tasks may change. You can update the status or adjust filters as necessary to stay aligned with the project‚Äôs progress. üîë The Key Benefits for Your Team and Projects Enhanced Focus: Quickly filter tasks and uploads based on their status, helping you focus on the most important items and track progress with ease. Improved Collaboration: Share filtered views with your team, ensuring everyone is on the same page regarding task statuses. Time Efficiency: Reduce time spent sifting through irrelevant tasks by focusing on those that need attention or are already completed. Ready to Take Your Project Management to the Next Level? Start filtering statuses today to gain better control over your projects. If you haven't tried this feature yet, we encourage you to explore its full potential with a 14-day free trial or book a demo with our team to see how it can streamline your workflows. üëâAdditional Resources Improve Visual Collaboration: Save Time, Stay Organized, and Improve Feedback with Filtering in Reviews and Text Annotation New Update on AI-powered Statuses Take Control of Your Project with Custom Statuses Feature Update: Customizable Task Statuses Did this answer your question? Now that you have your project setup, there‚Äôs a whole world of possibilities open for you to be more productive and get things done. Let‚Äôs get you started on the basics. Name: Quickly Set Up Your Projects With Custom Templates In Zipboard
Article Content: Quickly Set Up Your Projects with Custom Templates in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Quickly Set Up Your Projects with Custom Templates in zipBoard zipBoard‚Äôs Custom Templates feature helps you get up and running fast, eliminating the need for manual setup. üöÄ Setting up projects can be time-consuming, especially with unique workflows for each industry. Whether you're in construction, web design, learning design, or content development, setting up projects from scratch and adjusting phases, tags, and statuses manually slows down your project kick-off and reduces productivity. ‚ùìWhat are the Custom Project Templates in zipBoard? zipBoard‚Äôs Custom Templates streamline collaboration and enhance workflow by providing prebuilt templates for various industries. These templates are applied during the project creation phase, saving you time and ensuring your project is tailored to your industry needs. Available templates: Construction Template Web Design Template Learning Design Template Content Development Template With these templates, your project interface is automatically customized, so you don‚Äôt have to start from scratch. üõ†Ô∏è üí°How It Helps Boost Team Efficiency At zipBoard, we‚Äôre committed to helping you get started quickly. Streamlines project setup : Industry-specific templates save time by automatically applying relevant settings. Enhances collaboration : Get your team aligned and working faster without spending time on customization. Improves workflow : With prebuilt templates, project phases, tags, and statuses are set up to match your industry‚Äôs needs. Increases productivity : Spend more time executing tasks and less time on setup, speeding up project kick-off. How Custom Project Templates Work in zipBoard Here‚Äôs a quick guide to using the Custom Templates feature: Create a New Project : When you initiate a new project, you‚Äôll see a modal that prompts you to either select a template or create a project from scratch. Choose Your Template : You‚Äôll be asked to select one of the following templates based on your industry: Construction Web Design Learning Design Content Development Apply the Template : Once you choose a template, the corresponding phases, tags, and statuses are automatically applied to your project. You can start collaborating with your team right away, without the need to adjust settings manually. Preview the Template : Before starting your project, you can preview the template and get more details about the template setup by clicking on " Read More ." Customization : If you're a free trial user, some customization options, such as changing the status or type, will be limited unless you upgrade your plan. Tailored Benefits for Your Industry Construction : Streamline project management with predefined phases like "Design Ideation" and "Permitting," plus project types like "Change Order" and "RFI." Web Design : Easily track projects with phases like "Wireframing" and "User Validation," and statuses like "Ready for Development." Learning Design : Efficiently create learning materials with phases like "Analysis & Planning" and "Testing," plus document types like "Curriculum Documents." Content Development : Simplify content management with phases like "Draft Development" and "Editing," and types like "White Papers" and "API Documentation." No matter the industry, zipBoard‚Äôs templates ensure your project workflow is optimized from the start. üìà Take the Next Step! Ready to enhance your workflow and streamline collaboration? Try zipBoard‚Äôs Custom Project Templates now with a 14-Day Free Trial and explore how these templates can boost your team‚Äôs productivity. Or, if you want a more hands-on approach, Book a Demo today and see it in action! üíº Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Streamlining File Uploads With Bulk Upload In Zipboard
Article Content: Streamlining Large-Scale File Uploads with Bulk Upload in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Streamlining Large-Scale File Uploads with Bulk Upload in zipBoard Managing thousands of documents within a project can be cumbersome, especially when each file has to be uploaded manually . Project managers and collaborators often find themselves spending unnecessary time uploading files one by one, which slows down the review process and reduces overall efficiency. This manual approach creates a bottleneck, making it difficult for teams to initiate reviews promptly and keep workflows moving smoothly. Introducing zipBoard Bulk Upload: A Smarter Way to Handle Large File Volumes To address this challenge, zipBoard offers a Bulk Upload feature that enables users to upload hundreds or thousands of files simultaneously. Whether you're dealing with blueprints, technical documents, design drafts, or multimedia assets, zipBoard automates the process by treating each file as an individual upload task. This drastically improves efficiency, reducing time spent on repetitive actions and ensuring that document-heavy projects run smoothly. Why zipBoard Bulk Upload in zipBoard Matters for Large Projects The Bulk Upload feature in zipBoard is designed for teams managing high volumes of documents and large-scale projects, providing several key benefits: Eliminates the manual upload bottleneck , allowing for faster project initiation and smoother workflows. Reduces administrative overhead , so teams can focus on reviewing and approving documents instead of tedious file uploads. Enhances collaboration by enabling quick access to uploaded files , ensuring seamless document reviews and stakeholder feedback. Handles thousands of files efficiently , making large-scale file management intuitive and effortless. How to Use Bulk Upload in zipBoard Follow these steps to take advantage of the Bulk Upload feature: Navigate to Your Project : Open the project where you need to upload files. Select the Add Content : Click on the Add Content button and choose the type of file. Choose Files of the Same Format: Select multiple files of the same type from your device. Confirm the Upload: Click "Bulk Add" to initiate the process. Each file will automatically be treated as a separate upload task. This does not support URLs Track Your Uploads: Once uploaded, each file appears individually, allowing for independent review and collaboration. Auto-tag does not work on this feature How Bulk Upload Transforms Workflows Across Industries Different industries can leverage zipBoard‚Äôs Bulk Upload to streamline their workflows: AEC (Architecture, Engineering, and Construction): Quickly upload multiple blueprints, CAD files, or site images for team review. Creative Agencies: Efficiently add multiple design drafts, videos, or images for feedback. Education : Upload multiple course materials, presentations, or assignments in one go. Ready to Scale Your Document Management? Try zipBoard Today! Experience the power of Bulk Upload and streamline your review process. Stay updated with our latest features on the zipBoard Blog . Want to see Bulk Upload in action? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can optimize your workflow. Ready to enhance your collaboration? Start your 14-day Free Trial! Name: Setting Up And Managing The Procore Integration In Zipboard
Article Content: Setting Up and Managing the Procore Integration in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Setting Up and Managing the Procore Integration in zipBoard AEC Teams rely on multiple software solutions to manage their construction workflows effectively. To streamline operations and reduce manual effort, zipBoard offers integrations with various tools, starting with Procore. This integration ensures seamless communication and data consistency across platforms, eliminating the need for manual document transfers. Who Can Use The zipBoard + Procore Integration ? Both Organization Admins and Project Managers can leverage this integration to: Ensure information is consistently synchronized across their software stack. Eliminate manual data transfer between zipBoard and Procore. Manage and streamline project workflows efficiently. Advantages of Procore's Integration with zipBoard Simplifies the process of connecting Procore with zipBoard. Reduces manual effort in transferring project documents and data. How to Set Up the Procore + zipBoard Integration To enable seamless integration between zipBoard and Procore, follow these steps: Step 1: Install zipBoard in Procore Log in to your Procore account. Navigate to the App Marketplace . Search for zipBoard . Click on the zipBoard app, then select Install . Follow the prompts to authorize the app for your Procore organization. Note: You must have the appropriate admin permissions in Procore to install third-party applications. Step 2: Access the Integrations Portal Log in to zipBoard. Navigate to Profile > Manage Integrations . Locate the Procore Integration and click Authenticate . Step 3: Authenticate Procore Clicking ‚Äú Authenticate ‚Äù will open a new tab for authentication. Enter your Procore credentials and authorize zipBoard. Once authentication is successful, the tab will close automatically. Step 4: Configure Project Sync Settings Click on the "Proceed with Sync" button Select a single zipBoard project to sync. Choose multiple Procore projects from which documents will sync. Click ‚ÄòSync Documents‚Äô -> ‚ÄòExplore Project‚Äô Step 5: Managing the Integration Before first sync is completed : Button shows ‚ÄúSync Documents‚Äù . After first sync is completed : Button updates to ‚ÄúManage Integration‚Äù . The ‚ÄòAvailable Integrations‚Äô modal in zipBoard projects will only show active integrations . The authentication process should open in a new tab and close automatically upon successful login. Integration Features and Enhancements The zipBoard Integrations Portal is being enhanced to support Procore and future integrations. This update includes: Streamlined Setup Process ‚Äì A more intuitive way to enable and configure integrations. Flexible Integration Management ‚Äì Allowing users to customize and control integration settings. Project-Level Synchronization ‚Äì Enabling selective sync for relevant projects. User-Friendly Interface Updates ‚Äì Improving accessibility and usability of integration tools. For Version 1 , the sync will be one-way , meaning only new Procore documents will sync automatically with zipBoard. Existing documents will not be synced initially but will be supported in future updates. Troubleshooting & FAQs What happens if authentication fails? Ensure your Procore account has the necessary permissions. Try re-authenticating from the Integrations Portal. Can I sync multiple zipBoard projects at once? For the first sync, only one zipBoard project can be selected per integration. However, you can sync multiple Procore projects to this single zipBoard project. Will old Procore documents be imported? No, the first version of this integration supports one-way sync for new documents only . Support for existing documents will be added in future updates. How do I disable the Procore integration? Navigate to Settings > Integrations , locate Procore , and click Delete . Get Started with the Procore Integration Today! Streamline your project management by connecting zipBoard with Procore. Reduce manual work, improve collaboration, and keep your projects organized effortlessly. Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Name: Review Tracking In Zipboard Ensuring Efficient File Reviews
Article Content: Document & Content Review Tracking in zipBoard: Ensuring Efficient File Reviews - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Document & Content Review Tracking in zipBoard: Ensuring Efficient File Reviews Project managers and designers need to oversee the review process for any given upload or digital asset to ensure all required stakeholders provide their feedback before the deadline. Both project managers and designers share similar goals: Ensuring that required stakeholders share their feedback promptly. Identifying potential blockers that delay the project. Making sure the necessary subject matter experts review files before moving to the next stage of production. Introducing the Document & Content Review Tracking zipBoard is introducing a Document & Content Review Tracking system that visualizes the review stages of each assigned reviewer. This allows for an efficient review cycle by quickly identifying stakeholders who may be delaying the process and enabling appropriate action. Key Features: A Review Status Button in the File Modal allows assigned reviewers to share their individual review status and approval of the digital asset. Dynamic Review Statuses for reviewers in the File Modal UI to reflect predefined review stages, updating as the review progresses. Enhancing Efficiency and Collaboration The Document & Content Review Tracking feature is designed to: Increase file review efficiency by identifying bottlenecks. Create a clear audit trail for managers to track reviews. Step-by-Step Guide to Using the Feature Assigned reviewers access the file and begin their review process. Reviewers update their status based on their progress. Feedback is shared , and if necessary, a new version of the file is uploaded to address concerns. Review statuses remain intact when a new version is uploaded, with communication happening via the ‚ÄòReplies‚Äô tab. The overall status of the file can be updated independently of individual review statuses. Industry-Specific Benefits Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) Helps project managers ensure all required approvals before proceeding with designs or blueprints. Identifies delays in stakeholder feedback and mitigates project timeline risks. Creative Agencies & Marketing Teams Allows for seamless feedback cycles on visual assets, ensuring all necessary revisions before client presentations. Tracks approval from different teams (e.g., content, design, and legal) before publishing materials. Education & eLearning Development Streamlines content review processes for instructional materials, ensuring that subject matter experts provide necessary feedback before course deployment. Get Started Today Ready to streamline your Document & Content Review Tracking process? Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Name: Learning Design Template For Elearning Content Reviews
Article Content: Learning Design Template for eLearning Content Reviews - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Learning Design Template for eLearning Content Reviews Instructional designers, SMEs, and project managers often struggle with scattered feedback, version control issues, and lengthy approval cycles when developing eLearning courses. Keeping multiple stakeholders aligned while ensuring content quality can be a challenge. zipBoard‚Äôs Learning Design Template simplifies eLearning content development with a structured review and approval process‚Äîso you spend less time managing feedback and more time creating impactful training programs. Common Challenges in eLearning Development & How This Template Helps: Issue: SMEs provide scattered feedback via email ‚Üí Solution: Centralized feedback & task tracking. Issue: Version control problems ‚Üí Solution: A structured approval process with clear revision history. Issue: Long review cycles ‚Üí Solution: Defined workflow stages for smoother approvals. Phases Structure your project with clear learning design phases Ensure a seamless content development process by following structured stages that align with industry-standard instructional design models like ADDIE and SAM. From initial planning to final review, keep everyone on the same page. Key Phases & Their Role in eLearning Development Analysis & Planning (Default): Define learning objectives, conduct needs assessments, and outline training scope. Content Development: Create text, visuals, animations, and interactive learning materials. SME Review: Validate instructional accuracy and technical correctness before user testing. Testing: Conduct usability testing with pilot learners to ensure engagement and technical functionality. Refinement: Revise content based on user testing and SME feedback. Implementation: Deploy the final version on an LMS or distribute to learners. üí° Even with pre-configured Phases, you have options to customize to suit your specific workflows. Task Types Organize and manage your course development tasks effortlessly Assign and categorize tasks to ensure smooth collaboration across your instructional design team. Easily track content creation, feedback, and final approval. Common Task Types & When to Use Them: Learning Needs Assessment (Default): Identify learner challenges and training gaps before development. Curriculum Document: Structure the course flow, lesson plans, and learning outcomes. Training Module: Develop self-paced or instructor-led modules with multimedia assets. Storyboard: Map out interactions, visuals, and course sequencing before production. Assessment Plan: Design quizzes, knowledge checks, and evaluation criteria. Prototype: Design quizzes, knowledge checks, and evaluation criteria. üí° Even with pre-configured Task Types, you have options to customize to suit your specific workflows. Statuses Keep track of your learning design progress The status tracking system ensures a streamlined content approval workflow, helping teams finalize learning materials efficiently. Easily monitor where each course element stands with clear status updates. Quickly identify what needs attention and ensure all tasks move forward efficiently. What Each Status Means in Course Development: Design Planning (Default): Define objectives, learning paths, and instructional goals. In Development: Actively building course materials and multimedia elements. SME Review: Experts assess content for accuracy, instructional value, and completeness. Alpha Testing: Internal team tests course flow and interactivity. Beta Testing: Pilot group provides real-world learner feedback before deployment. Ready for Deployment: The final version is approved and ready for launch. üí° Even with pre-configured Statuses, you have options to customize to suit your specific workflows. Views Visualize and manage your course design the way you want Get complete flexibility in how you track and manage your instructional design projects. Whether you prefer a visual workflow or a structured table, the choice is yours. How Different Roles Use These Views: üë©‚Äçüé® Instructional Designers: Use Kanban View to manage course progress. üéì SMEs: Use Table View to review assessments, scripts, and multimedia assets. üìä Project Managers: Use Task & Upload Views to track approvals and content readiness. Integrations Seamlessly connect zipBoard with your favorite tools Keep all stakeholders in sync by integrating zipBoard with the tools your team already uses. Enhance communication, track updates, and streamline feedback collection. How These Integrations Support eLearning Development: Slack : Get real-time notifications on content feedback and approvals. MS Teams : Keep SMEs, IDs, and reviewers aligned with discussions. Outlook : Manage review deadlines and feedback loops via email. Jira & Wrike : Link zipBoard tasks with project management platforms. Zapier : Automate feedback collection and content tracking. APIs: Sync zipBoard with your LMS for seamless content review workflows. Ready to streamline eLearning course development? üìÇ Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog .
