Name: Content Development Template For Content Reviews
Article Content: Content Development Template for Content Reviews - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Content Development Template for Content Reviews Managing content creation across multiple stakeholders‚Äîwriters, editors, subject matter experts, and project managers‚Äîcan be challenging. Disorganized feedback, version control issues, and delayed approvals often slow down production and impact deadlines. zipBoard‚Äôs Content Development Template simplifies content review workflows by providing a structured process for gathering feedback, tracking revisions, and managing approvals. With predefined phases and statuses, your team can enhance collaboration, reduce miscommunication, and ensure high-quality content delivery. Common Content Development Challenges & How This Template Helps: Issue: Feedback is scattered across multiple platforms ‚Üí Solution: Centralized comments & task tracking. Issue: Version control is confusing ‚Üí Solution: A structured approval process with clear revision history. Issue: Long review cycles delay publication ‚Üí Solution: Defined workflow stages for smoother approvals. Phases Organize content creation into logical steps to streamline collaboration and improve quality assurance. Key Phases & What Happens in Each Stage: Research & Discovery (Default): Audience insights, content goals, project requirements. Draft Development: Initial content creation, structure planning, first iteration. Technical Validation: Accuracy checks, compliance review, fact verification. Editing & Refinement: Clarity improvements, tone adjustments, consistency checks. Stakeholder Review: SME feedback, client input, team evaluations. Final Production: Final adjustments, formatting, distribution preparation. üí° Even with pre-configured Phases, you have options to customize them to suit your specific content development workflow. Task Types Ensure all team members know their responsibilities and deadlines with structured task management. Task Types & When to Use Them: White Paper (Default): Publish in-depth reports on industry trends, research, or solutions. API Documentation: Standardize technical guides for developers to integrate systems. Release Notes: Summarize software updates, new features, and bug fixes. Technical Manual: Provide step-by-step instructions for product usage and troubleshooting. Knowledge Base: Centralize FAQs, guides, and support documentation for users. Troubleshooting Guide: Outline solutions for common technical issues and system errors. üí° Even with pre-configured Task Types, you have options to customize them to suit your specific content development workflow. Statuses Stay updated on content production at every stage, from ideation to final publication, with a structured document approval process template. What Do These Statuses Mean in a Content Development Project? Planning (Default): Define content objectives, scope, and key deliverables. Draft: Initial content creation phase before any review process. Peer Review: Internal review by team members to refine accuracy and structure. Technical Review: Verification of technical accuracy by subject matter experts. Editing Phase: Final content polishing for grammar, tone, and formatting. üí° Even with pre-configured Project Statuses, you have options to customize to suit your specific workflows. Views Access different views to organize content, track revisions, and streamline collaboration. How Different Roles Use These Views: Content Creators: Use Kanban View to manage content progress from draft to publication. Project Managers: Use Table View to track content statuses, review cycles, and deadlines. Reviewers & Editors: Use Task & Upload Views to centralize files, revisions, and feedback. Integrations Connect zipBoard with the tools your team already uses to improve collaboration. How Integrations Improve Content Development Workflows: Slack : Receive real-time notifications on content updates and approvals. MS Teams : Collaborate with teams and manage content projects efficiently. Outlook : Organize review requests and reminders via email. Jira : Track content production alongside development tasks. Wrike : Organize content workflows and track project progress. Zapier & APIs: Automate workflows and integrate with content management systems. Ready to Streamline Content Reviews? üìÇ Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Editing & Refinement: Clarity improvements, tone adjustments, consistency checks. Stakeholder Review: SME feedback, client input, team evaluations. Final Production: Final adjustments, formatting, distribution preparation. üí° Even with pre-configured Phases, you have options to customize them to suit your specific content development workflow. Task Types Ensure all team members know their responsibilities and deadlines with structured task management. Task Types & When to Use Them: White Paper (Default): Publish in-depth reports on industry trends, research, or solutions. API Documentation: Standardize technical guides for developers to integrate systems. Release Notes: Summarize software updates, new features, and bug fixes. Technical Manual: Provide step-by-step instructions for product usage and troubleshooting. Knowledge Base: Centralize FAQs, guides, and support documentation for users. Troubleshooting Guide: Outline solutions for common technical issues and system errors. üí° Even with pre-configured Task Types, you have options to customize them to suit your specific content development workflow. Statuses Stay updated on content production at every stage, from ideation to final publication, with a structured document approval process template. What Do These Statuses Mean in a Content Development Project? Planning (Default): Define content objectives, scope, and key deliverables. Draft: Initial content creation phase before any review process. Peer Review: Internal review by team members to refine accuracy and structure. Technical Review: Verification of technical accuracy by subject matter experts. Editing Phase: Final content polishing for grammar, tone, and formatting. üí° Even with pre-configured Project Statuses, you have options to customize to suit your specific workflows. Views Access different views to organize content, track revisions, and streamline collaboration. How Different Roles Use These Views: Content Creators: Use Kanban View to manage content progress from draft to publication. Project Managers: Use Table View to track content statuses, review cycles, and deadlines. Reviewers & Editors: Use Task & Upload Views to centralize files, revisions, and feedback. Integrations Connect zipBoard with the tools your team already uses to improve collaboration. How Integrations Improve Content Development Workflows: Slack : Receive real-time notifications on content updates and approvals. MS Teams : Collaborate with teams and manage content projects efficiently. Outlook : Organize review requests and reminders via email. Jira : Track content production alongside development tasks. Wrike : Organize content workflows and track project progress. Zapier & APIs: Automate workflows and integrate with content management systems. Ready to Streamline Content Reviews? üìÇ Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Name: How To Use The Procore Zipboard Integration To Improve Collaboration
Article Content: Get the Most Out of the zipBoard + Procore Integration: Markup, Share, and Collaborate Without Downloading PDFs - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Get the Most Out of the zipBoard + Procore Integration: Markup, Share, and Collaborate Without Downloading PDFs Tired of downloading PDFs, sending endless emails, and losing track of feedback on Procore docs? Once your Procore files are synced to zipBoard , you can streamline reviews, markups, and communication in one place‚Äîwithout needing Procore licenses for everyone. What You Can Do in zipBoard with Procore Docs ‚úÖ Markup synced PDFs ‚Äì Visually highlight changes or issues with comments, shapes, and annotations. ‚úÖ Comment and collaborate in real time ‚Äì Keep discussions centralized and accessible to all team members. ‚úÖ Assign feedback as tasks to team members ‚Äì Turn comments into actionable tasks for improved accountability. ‚úÖ Share with internal & external stakeholders ‚Äì No license needed to view, comment, or collaborate in zipBoard. ‚úÖ Keep track of revisions and approvals ‚Äì Ensure all stakeholders are aligned with the latest updates. ‚úÖ Link RFIs and punch list items directly to drawings and documents ‚Äì Create contextual references and reduce miscommunication. ‚úÖ Automate RFI workflows ‚Äì Collaborate and resolve RFIs quickly without relying on fragmented email threads. ‚úÖ Stamp , sign , and download finalized documents‚Äì Add official stamps or signatures and export approved submittals or other documents for record-keeping or sharing. Optimizing Your Workflow with Procore + zipBoard RFI Collaboration Instead of long email threads, use zipBoard to gather feedback from multiple stakeholders on RFI documents. Mark up PDFs and assign tasks directly from the comments , ensuring clarity and accountability. RFIs can be tracked and linked directly to relevant drawings, making it easier to follow the discussion and action items in one place. Submittal Feedback Streamline submittal reviews by using zipBoard‚Äôs annotation tools to approve or request changes. All feedback remains centralized, making follow-ups easier. Once finalized, you can stamp , sign , and download the approved submittal for submission or records. Drawings Review When reviewing drawings, use zipBoard‚Äôs task assignment feature to highlight required updates. Track the progress of these tasks to ensure timely completion. You can also link punch list items and RFIs to specific drawing elements, providing visual context and reducing the back-and-forth. Punch List Management Use zipBoard to mark punch list items directly on project documents. Collaborators can add comments, assign issues, and track progress all in one place. By connecting punch list items to drawings, teams can resolve field issues faster with better traceability. Maximizing Efficiency with Best Practices Use shareable guest links for external reviewers ‚Äì Get feedback without requiring extra user accounts. Use version control to track updates ‚Äì Keep a clear record of revisions and changes. Use comments vs. tasks for different types of feedback ‚Äì Comments work well for discussions, while tasks help drive action. Pro Tips for Maximizing Your Document Review & Workflow Set up projects or tags for synced docs ‚Äì Organize your documents efficiently to streamline navigation. Set review deadlines and use zipBoard notifications ‚Äì Keep projects on track by ensuring timely feedback. Integrate zipBoard into your weekly review or coordination meetings by using it to track project progress, review feedback, and assign tasks in real time. Share annotated files, update statuses, and ensure everyone stays aligned‚Äîmaking zipBoard an essential part of your team‚Äôs workflow. FAQs How do I know when new documents are synced? zipBoard automatically syncs documents from Procore. You can check for the latest updates in your project dashboard in zipBoard. Can I tag someone in a comment? Yes! Simply @mention a team member in a comment to notify them directly. What happens when a document version changes in Procore? When a document is updated in Procore, zipBoard will reflect the latest version, ensuring you always work with the most up-to-date files. Need More Control Over Your Procore Integration? Take full advantage of zipBoard‚Äôs integration with Procore by customizing your settings for maximum efficiency. Whether you're syncing select projects, adjusting permissions, or tracking document changes, zipBoard keeps your workflow smooth and organized. Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Or start your 15-day Free Trial ! ‚úÖ¬†READ MORE... üëà Managing and Customizing Your zipBoard+ Procore Integration Settings üëà¬†Setting Up and Managing the Procore Integration in zipBoard Did this answer your question? Name: How To Share Pdfs Without Login For Seamless Collaboration
Article Content: How to Share PDFs Without Login or Signup (No Software Needed) - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Share PDFs Without Login or Signup (No Software Needed) Collaborating on PDFs shouldn‚Äôt require extra logins or complicated workflows. But for many teams‚Äîespecially in AEC, eLearning, and design‚Äîgetting feedback means chasing people through clunky systems or long email threads. With zipBoard, you can share any PDF for review‚Äîno login, no install, no friction. Effortless Guest Review with zipBoard zipBoard eliminates this hassle by allowing seamless PDF sharing without requiring recipients to log in. Users can share a secure link with external reviewers, enabling them to view and comment on PDFs directly. This feature ensures a frictionless experience while maintaining control over access and feedback. Why This Feature Matters Based on feedback from project managers, designers, and teams across industries, zipBoard developed this solution to remove unnecessary roadblocks in collaboration. By enabling guest review, we empower teams to collect feedback faster and keep projects moving without bottlenecks. Share PDFs Without Login in 5 Simple Steps Upload Your PDF : Add your document to zipBoard as part of your review project. Generate a Shareable Link : Use zipBoard‚Äôs sharing settings to create a guest review link. Set Permissions: Choose from the following options: View All Boards/Reviews (View Only): Guests can view existing reviews and comments but can only add text comments (not annotations). Add New Boards/Reviews (Add New Feedback Only): Guests create new reviews but don‚Äôt see existing ones. View All Boards/Reviews + Add New Boards/Reviews: Guests can view, annotate, and add comments. Share the Link: Email, chat, or embed it anywhere. Gather Feedback Effortlessly: No login required, no setup needed. üëâ TRY HERE üëà Feature zipBoard Adobe Bluebeam Dropbox Share without login ‚úÖ ‚ùå ‚ùå ‚ùå Annotate in browser ‚úÖ ‚úÖ ‚ùå (desktop) ‚ùå Track guest feedback ‚úÖ ‚ùå ‚ùå ‚ùå No install needed ‚úÖ ‚ùå ‚ùå ‚úÖ Want simple sharing that works across teams? Try zipBoard‚Äôs free trial How Different Industries Benefit from PDF Review Sharing AEC (Architecture, Engineering, and Construction) : Share blueprints and drawings with external consultants without requiring accounts. Creative Agencies : Collect feedback from clients on design drafts without onboarding them to a new platform. Learning & Design : Distribute course materials for review by students and faculty without additional logins. Product Development: Collaborate on technical documents with external partners while maintaining version control. üöÄ Start Collaborating Smarter‚ÄîNo Logins, No Hassles Make PDF collaboration seamless‚Äîshare, review, and collect feedback without login hassles! ‚úî Share PDFs instantly without signups ‚úî Annotate, comment, and approve in real-time ‚úî Keep feedback organized and projects moving üîπ Start Your 15-Day Free Trial üîπ Book a Personalized Demo üîπ Read: How to Draw on a PDF in zipBoard üîπ Explore the Full PDF Markup Guide Did this answer your question? Name: Managing Your Procore Zipboard Integration Project Sync Permissions And What S Next
Article Content: Managing Your Procore + zipBoard Integration: Project Sync, Permissions, and What‚Äôs Next - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Managing Your Procore + zipBoard Integration: Project Sync, Permissions, and What‚Äôs Next Once you've set up the Procore integration with zipBoard , it's important to know how to manage and customize your settings to fit your workflow. This guide walks you through key integration management features, project-level syncing, authentication updates, and upcoming enhancements. Managing Your Integration Understanding the "Manage Integration" Button The Manage Integration button in zipBoard provides quick access to your integration settings. From here, you can: View the current status of your Procore connection Modify document control workflows Re-authenticate or disable the integration if needed Selective Project-Level Sync Not every project needs the same level of document review. With selective sync, you can choose which Procore projects to connect with zipBoard‚Äîhelping you reduce noise, keep teams focused, and ensure only relevant files flow into your review workflows: Choose which Procore projects to integrate with zipBoard Limit syncing to only relevant documents (like submittals, as-builts, or drawing packages) to reduce clutter and confusion., reducing clutter Adjust settings at any time based on project needs Changing, Re-Authenticating, or Disabling the Integration Changing Integration Settings If your team structure or project requirements change, you can update your integration settings by: Navigating to the Manage Integration panel Selecting the Procore account or project you want to modify Adjusting sync preferences accordingly Re-Authenticating the Integration If your integration encounters an authentication issue, you may need to reconnect zipBoard to Procore: Click Manage Integration Select Re-Authenticate Follow the authentication prompts to restore the connection Disabling the Integration If you need to temporarily or permanently disconnect Procore from zipBoard: Go to Manage Integration Click Disable Integration Confirm your action‚Äîthis will stop document syncing but retain previously imported files UI Improvements and Enhancements We‚Äôve made several updates to improve your experience managing integrations: Streamlined Navigation ‚Äì Easier access to project settings Improved Sync Logs ‚Äì Track document syncing history for better transparency Customizable Permissions ‚Äì Control who can manage integration settings What's Coming Next? We‚Äôre building features that make the integration even more powerful: Existing Docs Sync ‚Äì Bring over previously uploaded drawing sets, submittals, specs from Procore into zipBoard Two-Way Sync ‚Äì Keep your Procore and zipBoard records always aligned Enhanced Automation ‚Äì Create issues automatically from document changes or status updates Ready to Get Started with the Procore Integration? Collaboration shouldn‚Äôt require downloads, email chains, or duplicate markups. With zipBoard + Procore, reviews are streamlined, organized, and accessible to your entire project team. Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. Name: How To Set Up A Website Feedback Workflow
Article Content: How to Set Up a Website Feedback Workflow - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Set Up a Website Feedback Workflow Managing feedback during a website project can get messy fast ‚Äî emails, screenshots, random comments everywhere. With zipBoard, you can set up a structured, centralized website feedback workflow that streamlines everything from the first draft to final approval. In this guide, we‚Äôll walk you through how to build a simple, repeatable feedback process using zipBoard. TL;DR: Website Feedback Workflow in 6 Steps ‚Ä¢ Create project ‚Üí Define phases ‚Üí Invite users ‚Ä¢ Collect feedback ‚Üí Convert to tasks ‚Üí Finalize & approve ‚Ä¢ All visual, no logins needed for clients. Step 1: Create a New Project in zipBoard From your zipBoard dashboard, click + New Project . Give your project a clear name (e.g., Client Website Redesign ). Choose whether you want to upload design files (like images or PDFs) or review a live website URL. Tip: If you‚Äôre reviewing a live website, just paste the URL ‚Äî no need to install anything! Step 2: Define Your Review Phases In your project settings, create Phases such as: Wireframe Review UI Design Feedback Staging Site QA Final Approval Phases help you organize feedback and tasks depending on the project stage. Pro Tip: You can customize phase names based on your team's or client‚Äôs terminology. CTA: Don‚Äôt want to create projects and define review phases from scratch? Try our Project Templates for Web Design Step 3: Add Your Team, Clients, and Stakeholders Invite internal users (designers, developers, QA) with full access. Invite clients or external users as Guests ‚Äî no signup required! Set roles and permissions so only the right people see and comment where needed. Why it matters: Clear roles avoid overwhelming clients with technical discussions. Step 4: Collect Feedback on your Website Visually Reviewers click directly on the website, image, or PDF to leave visual, contextual feedback. They can annotate areas with: Comments Drawings Highlights Stamps Example: Instead of saying "the homepage hero image is wrong," a reviewer clicks exactly on it and comments. Step 5: Turn Website Comments into Tasks Automatically Each comment can instantly become a Task . Assign tasks to team members with deadlines. Monitor progress using Kanban View or Table View inside zipBoard. Bonus: You can filter tasks by status (New, In Progress, Completed) for better visibility. Step 6: Iterate, Approve, and Finalize Use the Feedback ‚Üí Tasks ‚Üí Approval flow for each phase. Get real-time notifications when feedback is added or tasks are updated. Finalize approvals before moving to the next phase or deployment. Efficiency tip: Automate reports to keep everyone updated without extra meetings. Best Practices for Website Feedback Workflows**:** Upload homepage wireframes ‚Üí Review and comment Share staging website ‚Üí Clients annotate and suggest changes Assign fixes to dev team ‚Üí Track with tasks Final QA review ‚Üí Approve Launch website üöÄ Why Set Up a Feedback Workflow in zipBoard? Centralized feedback in one dashboard Visual annotations make communication crystal clear Clients and stakeholders don‚Äôt need technical tools or logins Tasks, feedback, and approvals linked automatically Faster handoff from design to development What Makes a Great Website Feedback Tool? Easy visual annotations Centralized feedback (no more scattered emails) Easy review and approval workflow set up Works across devices and browsers Task tracking built-in Simple for anyone to use How zipBoard Simplifies Website Feedback Management Add comments directly on websites or screenshots Turn feedback into tasks with assignees and due dates Review and revert to older versions easily Share with clients and control access Integrate with Jira, Slack, MS Teams, and more FAQs: Website Feedback Workflows Q: How do I collect website feedback from clients? Use a tool like zipBoard that allows visual annotations without requiring clients to sign in. Q: Can I turn comments into tasks automatically? Yes. With zipBoard, every comment can become a task with an assignee and due date. Q: What‚Äôs the best way to manage website feedback? Create a feedback workflow with defined phases, visual comments, centralized task tracking, and version control. Next Steps: üëâ Ready to streamline your next website review? Name: How To Invite Clients Users To Review A Website No Login Needed
Article Content: How to Invite Clients & Users to Review a Website (No Login Needed) - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Invite Clients & Users to Review a Website (No Login Needed) When clients and stakeholders have to sign up, create passwords, or learn a new tool just to leave feedback, it slows everything down. With zipBoard, you can invite clients and users to review your website without requiring them to log in. This makes collecting client feedback and user feedback seamless, fast, and friction-free. How It Works: Collect Website Feedback Without Forcing a Login zipBoard allows you to: Send a public review link for any website project Let clients, users, and external stakeholders add comments directly on the website Keep feedback organized and tied to specific screens or issues Control access (optional) with link expiration or passwords if needed How to Invite Clients and Users to Review a Website in zipBoard Follow these simple steps: For Clients Open Your Project In zipBoard, go to your dashboard and select the project that contains the website you want reviewed. Open the Share File Modal Navigate to the file you wish to share and click the Share button. Select Clients In the Client tab, choose the clients you want to share the file with. Existing clients will appear with their current permissions pre-selected. Set Access Permissions Use the dropdown under the Access tab to select one of the following options: All Comments : Default setting where all Collaborator, Client, and Guest Reviewer comments are visible. Only External Comments : Restricts visibility to Client and Guest Reviewer comments only. Remove Access : Removes a client‚Äôs ability to view a previously shared file. Save Changes Click Share to save your changes. Feedback messages will confirm the success or highlight any errors. For Users Open the file you want to share in zipBoard. Click the "Share File" button on the review page . In the " Share Review with Guest " modal, configure the permissions based on what level of access you want to grant. ‚úî View Only ‚Äì Guests can only see the file but cannot add feedback . ‚úî Commenting Enabled ‚Äì Guests can add comments but not annotations . ‚úî Full Feedback Access ‚Äì Guests can add comments, annotations, and mark changes . Copy the generated share link and send it to your guest reviewers. 3. Send the Link to Your Clients or Users Share the link via: Email Slack Microsoft Teams Project Management Tools Embed in a client portal No signup required ‚Äî they can start reviewing instantly! What Clients and Users Can Do with the Link Once they open the public review link, they can: ‚úÖ Navigate the website ‚úÖ Click and annotate directly on live pages ‚úÖ Leave text comments, visual markups, or pinned notes ‚úÖ View or reply to other comments (depending on settings) ‚úÖ Upload attachments if needed (optional) Best Practices for Getting Great Feedback Be clear on what kind of feedback you‚Äôre looking for (design issues, bugs, content review, etc.) Set deadlines to encourage quick responses Provide instructions if needed ("Click anywhere on the page to leave a comment.") Why Use zipBoard for Client and User Website Feedback? No signups or account creation needed Visual feedback tied to exact page locations Comments automatically organized into tasks Keep internal notes hidden from external users Integrated with tools like Jira, Slack, MS Teams üöÄ Start collecting client and user feedback faster ‚Äî without signup barriers. Create your website review hub with zipBoard today! Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Why Designers Need a Website Visual Feedback Tool: Improve Design Reviews & Client Collaboration Website Feedback Done Right: How to Involve Stakeholders at Every Stage of Web Design & Development Want a hands-on experience? Name: How To Annotate A Live Website
Article Content: How to Annotate a Live Website - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Annotate a Live Website Giving feedback on live websites often turns into a tangled mess‚Äîvague emails, scattered screenshots, and miscommunication that slows down progress. It‚Äôs hard to be clear, and even harder to keep everyone aligned. Website annotation lets you leave visual, contextual comments directly on the site‚Äîno guesswork, no back-and-forth. Whether you're reviewing designs, logging bugs, or requesting edits, this method keeps feedback accurate and actionable. In this guide, we‚Äôll walk you through how to quickly annotate a live website using zipBoard for clearer collaboration and faster reviews. Jump here What Does It Mean to Annotate a Website? Annotating a website means adding comments, highlights, or drawings directly onto a live web page. Instead of describing an issue like ‚Äúthe button on the second section,‚Äù you can simply click on the button itself and leave a note right there. This is especially useful for: Designers collecting feedback from clients Developers reviewing design QA Content creators updating site copy Project managers coordinating revisions Why Annotate a Website? Leaving visual feedback in a website review process helps: Make feedback clear and actionable: No more vague or confusing comments. Save time: Team members can instantly see what needs fixing. Improve collaboration: Designers, developers, and clients stay on the same page. Speed up approvals: Easy reviews mean faster project sign-offs. How to Annotate a Live Website in zipBoard (Step-by-Step) Here‚Äôs how you can start annotating a website using a visual feedback tool like zipBoard: Create a Free Account on zipBoard: Start your free trial ‚Äî no credit card required. Select the Web Design Template or Start a New Project Choose the Web Design Template for a ready-to-go setup, or Click Start New Project to manually set up your review workflow Add Content: Add your website‚Äôs live URL or staging URL to create a review project. Open the Website in zipBoard‚Äôs Review Environment: zipBoard loads the live website inside its visual review tool. Annotate Directly on the Page Click anywhere to leave a comment Draw shapes (arrows, rectangles) to highlight areas Add markup notes for specific design or content changes Assign Tasks (Optional): Convert annotations into tasks for your team to work on ‚Äî no extra tools needed. Share the Review Link : Invite clients, teammates, or developers to leave feedback ‚Äî no signup needed for guests! Track and Manage Feedback : Use zipBoard‚Äôs task board or table view to manage all feedback and revisions in one place. Best Practices for Annotating a Website Be specific: Clear, detailed comments help teams act faster. Use visual markups: Draw arrows or highlight areas when possible. Organize feedback: Categorize comments (e.g., design, bugs, content) for smoother workflows. Stay concise: Keep feedback easy to read and actionable. FAQs How do I annotate a website easily? Use a visual feedback tool like zipBoard, which lets you click directly on any live web page and leave comments, drawings, and tasks without needing complex software. Can I give feedback on a website without screenshots? Yes! Tools like zipBoard allow real-time feedback directly on live or staging websites ‚Äî no screenshots or long emails needed. What's the best tool to annotate a live website? Visual feedback platforms like zipBoard are specifically built for live website reviews, design feedback, and team collaboration. Final Tip: Want to streamline your feedback process? Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Name: Quickly Navigate To The Right Annotation In Pdf Reviews
Article Content: Quickly Navigate to the Right Annotation in PDF Reviews - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Quickly Navigate to the Right Annotation in PDF Reviews Reviewing PDFs often means digging through multiple files just to find the right comment. With zipBoard‚Äôs annotation focus feature , you no longer need to shuffle between documents or waste time scrolling. Now you can: View all comments in one central task list , across multiple PDFs. Search, filter, and prioritize feedback without opening each file. And when you‚Äôre ready, launch the PDF to see the annotation exactly where it belongs ‚Äî with all surrounding context. What‚Äôs New Centralized review workflow ‚Äì Navigate issues from the task list directly into the right spot in the PDF. Precision focus ‚Äì Each task carries a unique URL parameter, ensuring the correct annotation is highlighted every time. Cross-browser reliability ‚Äì Works smoothly in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. Multi-tab safe ‚Äì No data conflicts, even if you‚Äôre reviewing multiple PDFs at once. How It Works Create an annotation in the PDF Review Board. A linked task appears in your project‚Äôs task list ‚Äî searchable and filterable . From that task, click Review / View Annotation . The PDF Review Board opens and highlights the exact annotation, with all nearby context visible. Why It Matters In traditional PDF review tools, you‚Äôre forced to open each document to hunt for the right comment. With zipBoard, you manage comments in one place ‚Äî like a dashboard for your reviews. This makes it easy to search, filter, and assign tasks, and then instantly jump into the document view only when you need the full context. The new URL-based focus parameter makes that jump seamless and reliable. No more losing track of which annotation you were supposed to review. Name: Creating And Managing Project Custom Templates In Zipboard
Article Content: Creating and Managing Project Custom Templates in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Creating and Managing Project Custom Templates in zipBoard Overview What is Project Templating & Exporting in zipBoard? The Project Templating & Exporting feature allows teams to save and reuse project structures that are frequently used. Instead of setting up every new project from scratch, you can export an existing setup and turn it into a template for future use. Who can use this feature? This feature is available only for Enterprise plan organizations . To access it, users must have the appropriate organization-level permissions (Owner, Super Admin, or Admin) and the ability to create projects. What are the benefits? Faster project setup ‚Äì no need to rebuild structures for every new project. Consistency ‚Äì standardized phases, statuses, and structures across all projects. Error reduction ‚Äì fewer mistakes from manual setup. Flexibility ‚Äì easily modify, chain, or delete templates as needs evolve. 1. Access and Permissions Templating is available only to Enterprise plan organizations. To use it, you must: Have organization edit permissions (Owner, Super Admin, Admin). Be able to create projects within the organization. If you do not have the correct role or permissions, you will not see: The Create Project button. Export options in project card , table view , or project settings . 2. Creating and Exporting Templates From Kanban View Go to your project explorer in kanban view. Click Export on the project card. Save the exported template for reuse. Use the template to create a new project, and verify it matches the original. From Table View Switch to table view in the project explorer. Click Export next to the desired project. Follow the same process to reuse the template. 3. Selecting a Template When Creating a Project Click Create Project In the Template Selection modal, choose: A pre-made template from zipBoard. A custom template created by your organization. Proceed to create your project with the selected structure. Different industries can benefit from templates in unique ways: Construction Team Phases: Planning & Permits, Foundation, Electrical, Finishing Statuses: Pending Approval, In Progress, Inspection, Completed Tags: Compliance, Contractor, Safety Benefit: Maintain strict workflows and compliance across builds. Creative Agency Phases: Discovery, Concept Development, Production, Review Statuses: Draft, Feedback, Revision, Approved Tags: Client Name, Campaign, Priority Types: Design, Content, Asset Benefit: Ensures consistent structure across multiple campaigns. E-learning Phases: Scripting, Storyboarding, Development, Deployment Statuses: Draft, Under Review, Ready for LMS Tags: Module, Subject, Assessment Types: Lesson, Quiz, Resource Benefit: Speeds up course creation while keeping modules consistent. Web Projects Phases: Requirements, Design, Development, Testing, Launch Statuses: Backlog, In Progress, QA, Live Tags: Frontend, Backend, Bug, Feature Types: Page, Feature, Bug Benefit: Creates a repeatable structure for smooth collaboration across design, dev, and QA. 4. Managing Templates (Modify, Chain, Delete) Chaining Exports You can create new templates from projects that were themselves created from templates: Export Project A to create Template B . Modify Template B‚Äôs (phases, statuses , or types) Export the updated Template B to create Template C with new settings. Deleting Templates Open the Template Management section. Select the template you no longer need. Click Delete . The template will be removed from your organization‚Äôs list. 5 FAQ & Troubleshooting 1. Can templates include reviewers, roles, or only structure? 2. If I change a template, do existing projects update too? 3. Is there a limit on the number of templates an organization can store? 4. Can non-admins use templates once created? 5. What happens if you try to delete a template being used by a live project? Why We Built It Before this feature, creating multiple projects with similar structures required repetitive manual setup. Now, teams can: Save time by reusing standardized project structures . Maintain consistency across all projects. Reduce errors from manual setup. Experience Project Templating and Exporting Request a Demo to see it in action. Start your 14-day Free Trial and standardize your project creation process. Check our Release Notes for more updates. Name: If I Change A Template Do Existing Projects Update Too
Article Content: If I change a template, do existing projects update too? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact If I change a template, do existing projects update too? Overview One common question about template management is whether changes to a template affect existing projects. Answer No ‚Äî updating or modifying a template will not change existing projects . Existing projects remain as they are. Only new projects created from the updated template will reflect the changes. Example Create Template A and use it to build Project 1. Modify Template A by changing phases. Project 1 stays the same. Any new projects created from Template A will have the updated structure. Best Practice If you need existing projects to match a new workflow, adjust them manually or create a new project using the updated template. Did this answer your question? Name: What Happens If You Try To Delete A Template Being Used By A Live Project
Article Content: What happens if you try to delete a template being used by a live project? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What happens if you try to delete a template being used by a live project? A common concern is whether deleting a template will affect active projects. Answer Deleting a template does not impact projects that were already created using it. Existing projects remain safe and unchanged. The template is simply removed from the library for future use. Example Template A is used to create Project 1 and Project 2. You delete Template A. Project 1 and Project 2 continue to function normally. Template A is no longer available for creating new projects. Best Practice Before deleting a template, check if it‚Äôs still relevant for future projects. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Communicating With Team Members
Article Content: What communication routes I can opt while using zipBoard, to keep the team in sync? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What communication routes I can opt while using zipBoard, to keep the team in sync? zipBoard is all about communicating; so you have multiple options for that: If you want a generic message to be broadcasted to all the collaborators then you can either add it as a comment. If you want any collaborator to be notified for the message you are sending then you can mention the collaborator name using "@Collaborator Name" or can email to the specific collaborator using email collaborator option. If you need to knock out a chat while you are on review board you can create a comment or task; where you can also mention anyone using "@Collaborator Name". 4. You can add a message to collaborators/collaborators and client from "message tab" Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Can Non Admins Use Templates Once Created
Article Content: Can non-admins use templates once created? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can non-admins use templates once created? Different roles in zipBoard have different levels of access and permissions. Answer Yes , non-admins can use templates to create new projects, as long as they have permission to create projects. No , non-admins cannot create, modify, or delete templates. Only admins, super admins, or organization owners can do this. Why This Matters This ensures that project structures stay consistent and controlled, while still allowing project creators to work efficiently. Did this answer your question? Name: Is There A Limit On The Number Of Templates An Organization Can Store
Article Content: Is there a limit on the number of templates an organization can store? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Is there a limit on the number of templates an organization can store? Organizations often create multiple templates to handle different workflows. Answer There is no strict limit on how many templates you can create and store in zipBoard. Best Practice Keep templates organized. Delete outdated or unused templates. Maintain only the most relevant templates to avoid confusion. Why This Matters A lean template library ensures faster project setup and reduces errors from using outdated templates. Did this answer your question? Name: Creating Tasks From Pdf Annotations
Article Content: Creating Tasks from PDF Annotations - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Creating Tasks from PDF Annotations Important: This article applies only to PDF document reviews. Annotation behavior and task creation rules differ for other asset types such as websites, images, videos, or SCORM content. Understanding the Basics Before diving deeper into PDF annotations, it is helpful to understand these few keywords: What is an Annotation? An annotation is a visual mark, comment, or highlight placed directly onto a document. Think of it as a "digital sticky note" used to point out specific areas that need attention. What is a Task? A task is an actionable work item. Unlike a simple comment, a task can be assigned to a team member, given a deadline, tracked through a status (such as "Open" or "Resolved"), and organized in your project‚Äôs Kanban board or list. What is a PDF Annotation? Specifically for PDF files, annotations allow you to interact with the static layers of the document, marking up text, circling layout issues, or pointing to specific images within the PDF. Turn Feedback into Action Automatically In zipBoard, certain PDF annotations automatically trigger a task. This bridge allows you to mark a mistake and turn it into a work item for your team in one single motion. In the zipBoard PDF viewer, specific annotation tools are designed to do more than just mark up a document, they automatically generate a Task . This allows you to turn feedback into actionable items the moment you identify a change, without extra steps. Which PDF Annotations Create Tasks? Use the table below to see which tools trigger task creation and which are for visual reference only. Category Tool Creates a Task Markups Highlight, Underline, Strikeout, Squiggly, Note ‚úÖ Yes Shapes Rectangle, Ellipse, Arc, Polygon, Cloud ‚úÖ Yes Lines Line, Polyline, Arrow ‚úÖ Yes Free Hand Free Hand, Free Hand Highlight ‚úÖ Yes Text Free Text ‚ùå No Inserts Signature, Rubber Stamp, Image ‚ùå No Fill & Sign Checkmarks, Dots, Crosses, Signatures ‚ùå No How it Works Select an Annotation Tool : Choose any tool in the annotate and shapes tool bar. Mark the Document: Apply the annotation to the specific area of the PDF. Click Save Task Generation : As soon as the annotation is placed, a task panel opens where you can: Assign an owner Set priority Add context or instructions No extra clicks. No manual task creation. When to Use Visual-Only Annotations Some feedback doesn‚Äôt need to be tracked as work. Use non-task annotations when you want to: Visual-Only Feedback: Use Free Text or Stamps if you want to leave a permanent label or label on the page without cluttering your task list. Precision: Use the Arrow or Rectangle tools for specific UI/layout feedback to ensure the task is clearly linked to the correct PDF element. Form Filling: Please note that Fill and Sign tools (like Ticks and Dots) are intended for document completion and do not create tracked tasks. Looking for task creation rules for other content types? Read more guides on PDF Document here: How to Review and Get Feedback on PDF Documents PDF Annotation Tools Overview How to Add / Upload PDF File Annotation behavior varies by asset type. Refer to these relevant guides for websites, images, or learning content. How do I share my website, PDF file, HTML / SCORM file, images or video for commenting? How can I use zipBoard for eLearning projects? How to Use zipBoard‚Äôs Review Tools to Annotate and Comment on Digital Content? How to Upload and Review Image Files with zipBoard? Name: What Is The Watcher Feature For And How Do I Use It
Article Content: Stay Updated with the Watcher Feature in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Stay Updated with the Watcher Feature in zipBoard In collaborative projects, team members often need updates on tasks they‚Äôre not directly assigned to. Constantly checking for changes or relying on manual updates can be inefficient, leading to missed information and delays. The Solution: Watcher Feature in zipBoard We‚Äôve just launched the Watcher List feature in zipBoard! Now, you can effortlessly keep track of tasks you're interested in‚Äîeven if you‚Äôre not directly assigned to them. This ensures that you stay informed without cluttering your inbox or being added as an assignee unnecessarily. How Does It Work? By adding a teammate as a Watcher , they will receive all notifications related to that task. This is perfect for project managers, reviewers, or anyone who needs real-time updates on progress. How to Add a Watcher to a Task Open the task where you want to add a watcher. Click on the Watchers tab. Type your teammate‚Äôs name in the text box and select them from the dropdown. Done! The selected user(s) will now receive updates about the task. üí° Tip: You can add multiple watchers to the same task to ensure key stakeholders stay informed. New: Watcher List Feature With our latest update, you can now filter and view all tasks you‚Äôre watching in one place! How to Access Your Watcher List Go to your Task List . Click on Filter . Under Tasks Related to Me , select Tasks I Am Watching . This makes it even easier to track progress on tasks that matter to you! Who Benefits from This Feature? The Watcher feature is useful across various industries, including: AEC (Architecture, Engineering, and Construction): Keep clients and stakeholders updated without assigning unnecessary tasks. Creative Agencies: Ensure designers and reviewers stay in sync with project changes. Education & eLearning: Track curriculum development tasks without overwhelming contributors. Try It Today! Want to see it in action? üîπ Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows. üîπ Or start your 15-day Free Trial! For the latest updates, check out our zipBoard Blog . Name: I Have Been Invited As A Collaborator But Unable To See The Project On My Dashboard What S Wrong There
Article Content: I have been invited as a collaborator but unable to see the project on my dashboard. What‚Äôs wrong there? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I have been invited as a collaborator but unable to see the project on my dashboard. What‚Äôs wrong there? Make sure the email address, you are invited with is the same as the one with which you are trying to access it. Other possible reason might be that the owner has archived the project, or might have exceeded the number of projects limit. Also, might be for some reason either the project is deleted or you may have been removed as a collaborator for the project. The exact email address¬†can be checked at the 'Edit Profile' page. To access the edit profile page, navigate to the drop-down adjacent to your profile image and choose the edit profile option. Did this answer your question? Name: How Do I Add New Tasks
Article Content: How do I add New Tasks? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I add New Tasks? Tasks can be created by all collaborators/managers/owners on a project by selecting 'Tasks' from the project menu bar. Now click the "Add Task" button on the top right to add a generic task. Add Task during Review- Start a review session and when in Browse mode, take screenshots of pages where you want to add new tasks. Then once you‚Äôre in Review mode, make the necessary annotations and add comments. Once you add a task, a dialogue box will show up. Here, you can edit the task - change its priority, type, and status. You can also add a description to the task. Did this answer your question? Name: How Is A Task Different From A Comment
Article Content: How is a Task Different from a Comment? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How is a Task Different from a Comment? A task is an actionable item. It‚Äôs usually an issue that needs to be resolved, and it can be assigned to a collaborator. On the other hand, a comment is exactly what the name says. If you want to leave a remark or talk to other collaborators, you use a comment. If you want a specific issue to be fixed, you use a task. Did this answer your question? Name: How Do I Edit A Task
Article Content: How do I Edit a Task? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I Edit a Task? Click on the ‚Äúpencil‚Äù icon on the task, either on the Review Board or on the Task Manager. You will see a dialog box open up. Here, you can make the necessary edits to the task. Change it‚Äôs priority, type, and status with toggleable switches. You can also add a description to the task and assign it to a collaborator. Bulk Edit Select the boxes beside the tasks you want to include in the bulk edit and select the Edit button at the top of the task list. Did this answer your question? Name: What Is Zipboard
Article Content: What is zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is zipBoard? zipBoard is a bug tracking and visual feedback tool which lets software teams take screenshots and assign tasks while browsing their web-based (web-apps, websites and E-learning) products. It makes collaboration among agile teams easier. You can either use zipBoard when iterating over a new product or adding features to an existing one. It makes communication easier amongst web developers, designers, project managers and QA. A visual platform to stay updated on your web projects. It‚Äôs an online whiteboard on top of your website to discuss, comment, annotate, share feedback and assign tasks. No more emails, spreadsheets, skype calls to track issues for your web projects. If you have been struggling with reproducing or explaining bugs with traditional bug tracking systems like JIRA, you can annotate and collaborate over screenshots of your web project with zipBoard so that the issues can be easily reproduced after seeing the issue in a screenshot. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Does Zipboard Integrate With Jira
Article Content: Does zipBoard integrate with JIRA? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Does zipBoard integrate with JIRA? Yes, it does. JIRA is a popular software development tool used by agile teams.¬†Integrating your zipBoard project with a JIRA project automatically adds and updates all the issues created in zipBoard to the mapped JIRA project. Thus, you need not change the workflow you are already following. zipBoard just makes the process easier by making the feedback visual rather than lines of text. Find the guide below to set up integration with Jira https://help.zipboard.co/article/63-how-do-i-integrate-zipboard-with-jira Why you should integrate zipBoard with Jira? Name: How Do I Integrate Zipboard With Jira
Article Content: How do I Integrate zipBoard with JIRA? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I Integrate zipBoard with JIRA? Integrate with JIRA project and issues, and instantly add your annotated screenshots and bug reports created in zipBoard Using JIRA integration requires a subscription to zipBoard's Team plan or above. Visit Pricing . Connecting to your JIRA account To integrate JIRA with zipBoard you need to be a Project Owner in zipBoard and an Administrator in JIRA. 1. Go to Manage org and select integration 2. There are 2 types of Jira applications: Jira cloud and Jira server, and you need to follow a different login process for both. (i) For Jira cloud, before proceeding, make sure to go to this link and create an API Token for yourself. Click the ' Create API token ' button. The following popup appears. Give it a Label of your choice and click on ' Create ' and Copy the generated token to your clipboard. Choose Jira cloud integration and add Jira site and accept Now Enable Webhook: Enter Email and token and click on save (ii) For the Jira server, simply click on Server and enter your Jira URL, Username and Password, then click 'Connect' . if you get an "Unable to Authenticate error", look here for troubleshooting. Mapping your zipBoard project issues to JIRA project Once the connection is made, a list of all the projects associated with this JIRA account will load. Now, choose the JIRA Project to which the issues created in zipBoard will correspond. Then Map how you want Bugs and Enhancements in zipBoard to show up in JIRA. Enable the integration by clicking on the 'Save' button. Creating an issue in JIRA from zipBoard Once you hit save, all issues now created in zipBoard by any of the collaborators will automatically get added to the corresponding JIRA project. And the link of the created JIRA issue will show up in the zipBoard task as well. Uninstalling the JIRA integration To uninstall the JIRA integration from your zipBoard project, simply click on delete in the project settings next to JIRA integration. To delete from the Organization level, click on the delete button Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: How Do I Remove Zipboards Integration With Jira
Article Content: How do I Remove zipBoard's Integration with JIRA? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I Remove zipBoard's Integration with JIRA? Removing JIRA integration with zipBoard is just a click away. You can unlink individual tasks by clicking on the delete icon available alongside JIRA issue ID. If you want that the whole project should be unlinked from JIRA; this can be done by clicking on the delete icon available under JIRA integration in the project settings Did this answer your question? Name: How Do I View The Associated Jira Issues Directly
Article Content: How Do I view the Associated JIRA Issues Directly? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Do I view the Associated JIRA Issues Directly? With zipBoard it‚Äôs really easy to switch between JIRA issues and zipBoard Tasks. While you are working with zipBoard Task‚Äôs just click on the JIRA issue link listed there to navigate to the corresponding JIRA issue. Conversely, while working on JIRA; to view the details of the linked zipBoard task just click on the zipBoard task URL provided with the description You can also access the linked JIRA project from the zipBoard project settings tab. Name: Im Getting The Unable To Authenticate Error What Should I Do
Article Content: I'm getting the "Unable to authenticate error" when integrating with JIRA. What should I do? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I'm getting the "Unable to authenticate error" when integrating with JIRA. What should I do? The JIRA integration authentication issue can happen due to several reasons. A few quick things to check: You have entered the correct JIRA URL, username and password. The JIRA credentials used,¬†correspond to a JIRA Admin account. The JIRA username field has actual JIRA username, not the JIRA email address. If you are using JIRA cloud using G-suite, then make sure that you are using the Atlassian cloud password and not the G-suite Password. This article on Atlassian's site can help you find your Atlassian password: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/API-call-into-Jira-Cloud-using-Gapps/qaq-p/644910 Check that your JIRA instance is not behind a firewall. If you are still unable to authenticate, reach out to us at support@zipboard.co and we will help you troubleshoot. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Does Zipboard Integrate With Slack
Article Content: Does zipBoard Integrate with Slack? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Does zipBoard Integrate with Slack? Yes, it does. Slack is a real-time messaging, archiving, and search for modern teams. Integrating your zipBoard project with Slack delivers all the updates about that project and your collaborators in a single slack channel. Read here for what all you can do with Slack integration: https://help.zipboard.co/article/192-what-can-i-do-with-slack-integration or, watch this video: Find the guide below to set up integration with slack https://help.zipboard.co/article/70-how-do-i-integrate-zipboard-with-slack Did this answer your question? Name: What Is Zipboard For
Article Content: What is zipBoard for? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What is zipBoard for? zipBoard is a powerful collaboration tool designed to streamline issue tracking for web projects and eLearning projects , and many more! It enables teams to visually communicate and work together more effectively without relying on lengthy emails or written messages. Key Benefits of Using zipBoard Visual Collaboration Collaborate with your team using annotated screenshots, just like working face-to-face. Reduce the need for lengthy explanations‚Äîcommunicate directly through images and annotations. Simplified Communication Replace long email threads and chat messages with a single platform for collaboration. Quickly share issues and feedback with your team in real-time. Visual Bug Tracking If traditional tools like JIRA make it hard to reproduce or explain bugs, zipBoard offers an easier alternative. Annotate issues directly on screenshots, ensuring bugs can be easily identified and reproduced. With zipBoard, teams can save time, reduce confusion, and focus on resolving issues more efficiently by seeing exactly what needs attention. Did this answer your question? Name: How Do I Integrate Zipboard With Slack
Article Content: How do I Integrate zipBoard with Slack? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How do I Integrate zipBoard with Slack? To integrate Slack with zipBoard you need to be a Project Owner in zipBoard. To check out the entire process, you can either watch this video or follow the instructions here to ensure that you properly integrate Slack to zipBoard. 1. Go to 'Settings' by clicking on the 3 dots menu that is present in the Project card. 2. And select ‚ÄúAdd to Slack‚Äù option 3. Select your team 4. Select the Channel where all the collaborators will be notified about the changes on the board and Click on ‚ÄúAuthorize‚Äù 5. Now, that the integration is complete, check out this guide to see how you can use Slack to directly add tasks to your zipBoard project and much more. Did this answer your question? Name: What Is The Difference Between Owner Manager Collaborator And Client
Article Content: What‚Äôs the difference between Super Admin, Admin, Manager, Collaborator, Client, Guest Collaborator and Reviewer? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What‚Äôs the difference between Super Admin, Admin, Manager, Collaborator, Client, Guest Collaborator and Reviewer? Welcome to our Help Center, your go-to resource for understanding and mastering your role within the organization's platform. Whether you're an Org Admin with overarching control or a Collaborator focused on content contribution, these guides are designed to empower you with the knowledge and skills you need for effective navigation and seamless collaboration. Let's breakdown all the possible roles in zipBoard so you can decide what will work best for your team: Internal Roles Internal Role Super Admin Admin Manager Collaborator Add/remove reviewer X X X X Add/remove client X X Add/removecollaborator X X Add/remove manager X X Add/remove admin X Delete own projects X X X Deleteany project X X Add projects X X X Archive own projects X X X Archive all projects X X Access reports X X Add Integrations X X External Roles External Role Guest link* Require sign up / login View all boards/reviews Add new boards/reviews Client View comments X Add comments X Create an account X Convert comments to tasks X X X *You can choose to activate one or more guest link settings. Org Admin/Super Admin: For a Complete Comprehensive Guide for Owners/Admin Overall ownership of the organization. Adding users to the organization. Creating tags. Visibility and control over the entire organization. Customization of organization settings. Access to project reports. Admin: Similar permissions as the super admin, excluding billing and member management. Managers : Creation and management of projects. Adding collaborators to projects. Customization of projects. Integration management. Access to project reports. Collaborators/Members: For a Complete Comprehensive Guide for Collaborators Content contribution. Task assignment and management. Review feedback. Task organization. Clients (Enterprise Only): External stakeholders responsible for content review and approval. Communication with the project team. Feedback conversion into tasks. Guest Reviewers: For a Complete Comprehensive Guide for Guest Reviewers/Clients and Stakeholders External stakeholders for content review. Limited access based on shared links. Feedback provision. Feedback conversion into tasks (by clients or internal team). Additional Information: Removing Users: Need to remove someone from your organization? Find step-by-step instructions in our article on removing users. Name: Can I Be A Part Of Multiple Projects And Teams From One Zipboard Account
Article Content: Can I be a part of multiple projects and teams from one zipBoard account? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can I be a part of multiple projects and teams from one zipBoard account? Yes, you can be a part of multiple projects and teams using one account (email address). All projects under an organization will show up together, and you still have the space to manage your personal projects. But this option is available just for enterprise accounts . Name: Who Is Zipboard For
Article Content: Who is zipBoard for? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Who is zipBoard for? zipBoard is a great tool for anyone who‚Äôs involved in the design and development process of a web-based product - PDF files, elearning courses, websites, web apps. zipBoard lets teams collect feedback and integrate to the internal task management and issue tracking process. zipBoard simplifies feedback collection and issue tracking process for teams. Teams working with clients or remote distributed environment can benefit significantly with zipBoard's contextual annotated feedback features and task management features. Some of the people who we think are going to find zipBoard extremely useful are web developers, product managers, UX designers, graphics designers, project managers, Quality Assurance teams, Solution architects and their respective clients. Name: What Plan Is Right For Me
Article Content: Which Plan is Right for me? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Which Plan is Right for me? We request you to sign up for our 14-day free trial. It will help you understand how zipBoard can help you make your workflow more efficient. Moreover, you can invite your team members so that they can have a feel of our visual review and bug taking tool. Within that period, you can definitely see how zipBoard will be an asset for you and can choose between any of our pricing plans . If you are still unsure, no problem. You can definitely talk to us and we will help you out. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Name: Can I Change My Plan
Article Content: Can I Change my Plan? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Can I Change my Plan? Absolutely, you can change plans anytime! Upgrades are immediate, but downgrades come into effect at the end of the current billing cycle. To change your plan click on upgrade. Click here to know more about the plans. If you are unsure of which plan is the best for you, you can talk to us and we can definitely help you out! Did this answer your question? Name: Ive Been Added To A Project What Next
Article Content: I've been added to a project. What's next? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact I've been added to a project. What's next? Once you're added to a project, you become a collaborator . As a collaborator, you can take the following actions: Add New Content You have the option to upload different file types. Simply select the appropriate board and upload the desired file or URL. After your content is added, you'll be ready to Start a Review . Start Reviewing Existing Content If content has already been uploaded by another team member, select any of the files to start a review. Click Start Review , and zipBoard will open the file in a new browser tab where you can access the Review Board . Note: If this is your first time reviewing, you'll be prompted to install the zipBoard browser extension. Learn more about the zipBoard extension here . For more comprehensive guidance on reviewing tasks, please visit this help article . Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Name: Ive Created A Task What Next
Article Content: What Information is Available/Can be Populated in a Task Once it is Created? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What Information is Available/Can be Populated in a Task Once it is Created? Once a task is created, a dialog box will show up. This is what it looks like: You can do multiple operations as indicated here to populate the task information. Download this Screen. View this task on Reviewboard. Edit the task title. Assign this task to a Collaborator. Dropdown for assigning/updating task status: Open, Waiting on client, In Progress, Defer, Resolved/Fixed, QA Verified, Won't Fix, Duplicate, User error or Reopen Dropdown for assigning/updating task type: Bug, Enhancement, Task or Feature. Dropdown for assigning/updating task priority: Low, Medium, High or Critical. .Due Date by when this issue to be completed Dropdown for assigning/updating phase. Duplicate to link duplicate issues to this issue Add/View task tags. Add/edit task description. Attach new/View attached files to the task. Add/View Replies See task activity feed. Add/View task watchers. Add/View Integrations Reported By: Show issue reported name Time: Shows Estimated time to solve the issue and logged time: how much time spent to solve the issue Access different information about the task and screen: Created by, Creation and last update dates, screen resolution, Browser, and OS Details, File/URL name, Project, Screen, Ref file. Name: What Information Is Availablecan Be Populated In A Task Once It Is Created
Article Content: What Information is Available/Can be Populated in a Task Once it is Created? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact What Information is Available/Can be Populated in a Task Once it is Created? Once a task is created, a dialog box will show up. This is what it looks like: You can do multiple operations as indicated here to populate the task information. Download this Screen. View this task on Reviewboard. Edit the task title. Assign this task to a Collaborator. Dropdown for assigning/updating task status: Open, Waiting on client, In Progress, Defer, Resolved/Fixed, QA Verified, Won't Fix, Duplicate, User error or Reopen Dropdown for assigning/updating task type: Bug, Enhancement, Task or Feature. Dropdown for assigning/updating task priority: Low, Medium, High or Critical. .Due Date by when this issue to be completed Dropdown for assigning/updating phase. Duplicate to link duplicate issues to this issue Add/View task tags. Add/edit task description. Attach new/View attached files to the task. Add/View Replies See task activity feed. Add/View task watchers. Add/View Integrations Reported By: Show issue reported name Time: Shows Estimated time to solve the issue and logged time: how much time spent to solve the issue Access different information about the task and screen: Created by, Creation and last update dates, screen resolution, Browser, and OS Details, File/URL name, Project, Screen, Ref file. Name: How To Update Your File Version Without Losing The Previous Versions
Article Content: How to Add a New File Version? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Add a New File Version? üìåAs of August 2024, we've made some updates. Please refer to this link instead . Simply add the new version file as a new file to the project and start reviewing it. Thus, zipBoard maintains your every version as a separate file, so that you can easily track the tasks or comments for each version individually at any point of time. You can add the version reference while naming your files, this adds clarity. For detailed steps, you can check here . Did this answer your question? Name: How Can I Archive Restore My Zipboard Project
Article Content: How Can I Archive or Restore my zipBoard project? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Can I Archive or Restore my zipBoard project? That‚Äôs just a click away. Click options icon for the corresponding project and hit archive from the dropdown list. Whenever you need to access your project in the future, click your archived project and you‚Äôll see restore option. Just click restore and you are good to go. NOTE:¬†Archive/Restore project feature is available only for team and enterprise plan users. But if you have exceeded your limit for the number of projects and you still wish to restore one of your archived projects, then you have two options : Either archive any of your active projects or Simply upgrade your plan. Name: My Mails Are Not Delivered What Should I Do
Article Content: My mails are not delivered. What should I do? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact My mails are not delivered. What should I do? This would happen if your mail server is bouncing zipBoard mails. To avoid that contact your IT department to whitelist emails from zipBoard. Don‚Äôt forget to check the spam folder. Also, once you check your email preferences, from the profile dropdown by selecting the edit profile option. If it's not set to send instantly, you need to select 'Send Instantly' from the email preferences dropdown and hit the 'Save' button. If either of the above is not the case then you can contact us at support@zipboard.co Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. But now I want to update them to tasks, can I do it? Sure, you can update your comments to tasks. Just click on the "add to task" icon and validate. Now, your comments will show up as tasks. Name: I Need To Share My Zipboard Project With My Stakeholders But Don T Want To Add Them As Collaborators Is There A Way To Do That
Article Content: Streamlining External Stakeholder Feedback for Digital Content Reviews - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Streamlining External Stakeholder Feedback for Digital Content Reviews üìå For new updates, please refer to the Different Share Link Options Collecting feedback from external stakeholders can be a task while building digital content like websites , e-learning courses, videos and other documents.¬†zipBoard‚Äôs guest sharing features let external stakeholders view content and share reviews while browsing the content without having to login. Once you set up the link, your reviewers can quickly share reviews using the screenshot, screen recording and annotation options in the reviewboard. See instructions on how to set up a link: Simply click the 'Share File' button on the review page and allow for 'Add New Boards' permission to let your stake holders add new screenshots and comment to your project.The default link that is generated to share, is a view only link(where the viewer cannot add comments but can view all the existing screens). To share the link either copy paste the link or simply add email ID. To see a comprehensive article on how to set up different share links for different access settings, read here . Article Content: How Can I Import Data to zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Can I Import Data to zipBoard? zipBoard doesn't have a generic import tool, but you can add URL or can upload ZIP, PDF, video, MP3, and image files as the content to be reviewed with zipBoard. Name: Exporting Data From Zipboard
Article Content: How Can I Export Data from zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How Can I Export Data from zipBoard? Data can be exported from zipBoard by either downloading or integrating with third-party apps. For more information about integrations, read here . The following data can be downloaded from zipBoard. All tasks in a project in a CSV format. You can either download all tasks from the download button in the ‚ÄúTask manager‚Äù tab or do a custom download based on the filters selected in the table. You may also download required tasks by clicking ‚ÄúDownload selected‚Äù from the task manager or you may "Download All". Screenshots created for a task. You can access the download option by hovering over the image in each task. Download image associated with a task by clicking on the download icon above. ZIP/PDF/Image/video files that have been uploaded to a project. Download the file by clicking on the download icon above. Download External Feedback from clients, and guests. If you have any questions, please email us at support@zipboard.co Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Contact Us Contact Us Last updated on April 9, 2024 Related Articles How Can I Import Data to zipBoard? Name: Getting Started With Zipboard
Article Content: Help Scout - Log In Help Scout Please login to view the requested page Log In Remember me for 30 days Log In or Sign in with Google Loading‚Ä¶ Forgot your password? Sign in with Help Scout credentials 2025 Fall Seasonal Release Collecting and Connecting Dots See What Shipped Help Scout requires JavaScript Follow these steps to enable it in your browser Google Chrome (Windows & Mac) Find the three vertical dot option in the top-right corner of your browser, and open the Settings section from there. Click the "Security and Privacy" link in the left-hand sidebar. Click the "Site Settings" option. Click the "JavaScript" option. Select "Sites can use JavaScript." Firefox (Windows & Mac) In your browser, type "about:config" in the address bar and click enter. A warning message will display on your browser; click "Accept the Risk and Continue" button to proceed. Enter "javascript.enabled" in the search box. Locate the option labeled "javascript.enabled" on the search result and select toggle to turn on JavaScript. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Microsoft Edge On the More menu (‚Ä¶), select Settings. Click the "Site permissions" option in the left-hand sidebar. Select the "JavaScript" option. Toggle the "Allow (recommended)" option to enable it. Restart your browser for the changes to take effect. Internet Explorer 11+ is required Upgrade For a faster, more secure browsing experience, we highly recommend installing Google Chrome or Firefox . Looking for a better way to talk with customers? Try Help Scout Close cross-small
