Name: Projects
Cleaned Article Content: API for Project - zipBoard Help API for Project Welcome to the¬†zipBoard platform REST API reference. This API is essential for connecting remotely with zipBoard, regardless of whether you are building an application, scripting interactions with zipBoard or building some other integration. This page documents the REST resources available in the¬†zipBoard platform, along with the expected HTTP response codes and sample requests for interacting with projects in¬†zipBoard. Before you start working with the API, you will need to generate an API key and also get an idea of the URI Structure that needs to be followed. Please follow this article for more information on that. Get Projects GET https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/projects Returns a full representation of the project. A project JSON consists of the issue key, a collection of fields, a link to the workflow transition sub-resource, and (optionally) the HTML rendered values of any fields that support it For projects to be visible, the user must be logged in and authenticated. If no user is logged in, then the project data will not be visible. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: id: String id of the project to return for the project Body Params Required: orgid: String org id of the project¬†to return for the¬†project Optional: projectid: String id of the project to return for the¬†project Role: String role to return for the¬†project (owner, manager, reviewer) owner: Boolean true to return project where user is owner Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'GET', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/projects`, body: {}, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Successfully retrieved projects.", "data": [ { "_id": "hoPjX5nfZomWKPsihw", "title": "project 1", "description": "", "createdOn": "2019-01-17T11:37:56.942Z", "ownerId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "orgId": -1, "screenCount": 3, "taskCount": 2, "isEnabled": true, "projectId": "P00001", "collaborators": [ { "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil", "role": "Owner" } ], "feeds": [ { "id": "b67c2b151780a616f2990bd0", "text": "created 'project 1'.", "createdAt": "2019-01-17T11:37:57.060Z", "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil" }, { "id": "7187e34c272e99b149bb3e9b", "text": "Inserted url: http://google.com", "createdAt": "2019-01-17T11:38:08.089Z", "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil" }, { "id": "b37aa5dd69b5cb6cb7586c96", "text": " created a new task:'<img/src=x onerror=alert(1)>'.", "createdAt": "2019-01-18T05:22:14.574Z", "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil", "linkUrl": "/project/hoPjX5nfZomWKPsiw/-1/tasks/-1/30db1560d34b063ac5d19645" } ], "lastUpdated": "2019-01-18T05:22:14.847Z" } ] } Create Projects POST https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/projects Creates a new project for the user. Returns the project data of the newly created project. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: None Body Params Required: title: String Title for the project Optional: orgid: String org id where you want to create the project description String Description for the project projectid String Custom project id for the project Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'POST', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/projects`, body: { title: "text for title of project", orgid: '' //id of the org to be fetched from org api }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 201, "_id": "ai6h7kXa4qseu6mom", "message": "Project successfully created!", "data": [ { "_id": "ai6h7kXa4qseu6mom", "title": "text for title of project", "description": null, "createdOn": "2019-01-24T05:43:04.983Z", "ownerId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "orgId": -1, "screenCount": 0, "taskCount": 1, "isEnabled": true, "projectId": "P00003", "collaborators": [ { "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil", "role": "Owner" } ], "feeds": [ { "id": { "_str": "61de98d288444b9913ad4edb" }, "text": "created 'text for title of project'.", "createdAt": "2019-01-24T05:43:04.983Z", "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil" } ] } ] } Update Projects PUT https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/projects/:id Updates the existing project for the user, data required (projectId). To update a project, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô (if he/she is a current project owner). Returns the updated project data. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token // the key which we generate from the user URL Params Required: id: String id of the project to be updated Body Params Required: At least one is required from optional Body Params. Optional: title String Title for the project description String description for the project projectid String Custom project¬†id for the project(P-0000001) collabemail [String] email id of the collaborator in array Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'PUT', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/projects/ai6h7kXa4qseu6mom`, body: { title: "Project-1", projectid: 'P-0000001' collabemail: ['abc@gmail.com', 'xyz@gmail.com'] }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Project successfully updated.", "data": [{ "_id": "ai6h7kXa4qseu6mom", "title": "Project-1", "description": null, "createdOn": "2019-01-24T05:43:04.983Z", "ownerId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "orgId": -1, "screenCount": 0, "taskCount": 1, "isEnabled": true, "projectId": "P0003", "collaborators": [{ "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil", "role": "Owner" }], "feeds": [{ "id": "61de98d288444b9913ad4edb", "text": "created 'text for title of project'.", "createdAt": "2019-01-24T05:43:04.983Z", "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil" }] }] } Delete Projects DEL https://app.zipboard.co /api/v1/projects/:id Deletes the existing project for the user, data required (projectId). To delete the project role of the current user should be Owner or Manager (if he/she is a current project owner). Return project data of deleted project. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: id: String id of the project to be deleted Optional: None Body Params Required: None Optional: None Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'DELETE', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/projects/KnrhKgqLozPqrSSbm`, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Project successfully deleted." } If you have any questions, you can check out our Forum . Name: Files
Cleaned Article Content:
API for Files (URL) - zipBoard Help API for Files (URL) Welcome to the zipBoard platform REST API reference. This API is essential for connecting remotely with zipBoard, regardless of whether you are building an application, scripting interactions with zipBoard or building some other integration. This page documents the REST resources available in the zipBoard platform, along with the expected HTTP response codes and sample requests for interacting with files in zipBoard. Before you start working with the API, you will need to generate an API key and also get an idea of the URI Structure that needs to be followed. Please follow this article for more information on that. Get Files GET https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/files Returns all files visible to the currently logged in user. For files to be visible, the user must be logged in and authenticated. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: id: String id of the file to return the file Body Params Required: None Optional: projectid String project id to return files for that project Owner Boolean true to return files created by authenticated user Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'GET', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/files`, body: { }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Succesfully retrieved files.", "data": [ { "createdByTransform": true, "_id": "9JBNNSuGKLvGsvuhE", "ownerId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "projectId": "hoPjX5nfZomWKPsiw", "fileDescription": "", "filePath": "http://google.com", "uploadedAt": "2019-01-17T11:38:07.913Z", "isValid": true, "displayName": "google.com", "original": { "name": "google.com", "updatedAt": "2019-01-17T11:38:07.913Z", "size": 1, "type": "url" }, "collectionName": "files" } ] } Create Files POST https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/files/ Creates a new file for the project, data required (name, url, projectId). To add a file to the project role of the current user should be Owner or Manager or reviewer or should be current project owner. Returns the data of the newly created file. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: None Body Params Required: name String name of the file (string) projectid String project id where u want to store the file url String URL for the file which user want to be(string) Optional: description String Description for the file Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'POST', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/files`, body: { name:"BING", projectid:"hoPjX5nfZomWKPsiw", url: "bing.com" }, });
Response { "_id": "Qfid4zJH3SC8LGibN", "message": "File successfully created!", "reviewurl": "http://localhost:3000/hoPjX5nfZomWKPsiw/Qfid4zJH3SC8LGibN/reviewboard", "data": [ { "createdByTransform": true, "_id": "Qfid4zJH3SC8LGibN", "ownerId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "projectId": "hoPjX5nfZomWKPsiw", "fileDescription": null, "filePath": "bing.com", "uploadedAt": "2019-01-24T09:25:54.437Z", "isValid": true, "displayName": "BING", "original": { "name": "BING", "updatedAt": "2019-01-24T09:25:54.437Z", "size": 1, "type": "url" }, "collectionName": "files" } ] } Update Files PUT https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/files/:id Updates the existing file for the user, data required (file id). To update file the role of current user should be Owner or Manager or reviewer or should be current project owner. Returns the data of the updated file. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: id: String id for the file which needed to be updated Optional: None Body Params Required: At least one is required from optional Body Params (name, description or url). Optional: name String name of the file description String description of the file url String URL for the file to be reviewed Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'PUT', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/files/Qfid4zJH3SC8LGibN`, body: { name:"New_changed_name", }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "File data successfully updated.", "data": [ { "createdByTransform": true, "_id": "Qfid4zJH3SC8LGibN", "ownerId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "projectId": "hoPjX5nfZomWKPsiw", "fileDescription": null, "filePath": "bing.com", "uploadedAt": "2019-01-24T09:25:54.437Z", "isValid": true, "displayName": "New_changed_name", "original": { "name": "BING", "updatedAt": "2019-01-24T09:25:54.437Z", "size": 1, "type": "url" }, "collectionName": "files" } ] } Delete File DEL https://app.zipboard.co /api/v1/files/:id Deletes the existing file for the user, data required (file id). To delete a file, the project role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô or ‚ÄòReviewer‚Äô or should be the current project owner. Return success message on file delete. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: id: String id for the file which needed to be deleted Optional: None Body Params Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'PUT', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/files/pGvKbRrvC5Ncs7NeT`, body: { }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Succesfully retrieved files.", "data": [ { "createdByTransform": true, "_id": "pGvKbRrvC5Ncs7NeT", "ownerId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "projectId": "wwTyZFHpdXz3vXeWF", "fileDescription": null, "filePath": "google.com", "uploadedAt": "2019-01-14T10:36:59.892Z", "isValid": true, "displayName": "file___1001", "original": { "name": "file___1001", "updatedAt": "2019-01-14T10:36:59.892Z", "size": 1, "type": "url" }, "collectionName": "files" } ] } If you have any questions, you can check out our Forum . Name: Tasks
Cleaned Article Content: API for Issues (Task) - zipBoard Help API for Issues (Task) Welcome to the¬†zipBoard platform REST API reference. This API is essential for connecting remotely with zipBoard, regardless of whether you are building an application, scripting interactions with zipBoard or building some other integration. This page documents the REST resources available in the¬†zipBoard platform, along with the expected HTTP response codes and sample requests for interacting with zipBoard¬†Tasks. Before you start working with the API, you will need to generate an API key and also get an idea of the URI Structure that needs to be followed. Please follow this article for more information on that. Get Tasks GET https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/ To get the corresponding tasks related to the project of files. For tasks to be visible, the user must be logged in and authenticated. If no user is logged in, the tasks will not be visible. To get corresponding tasks related to the project of files. Task Status values (Open, Waiting on Client, In Progress, Defer, Resolved/Fixed, QA Verify, Won‚Äôt Fix, Duplicate, Reopen). Task Priority values (Critical, High, Medium, Low). Task Type values (Bug, Enhancement, Feature, Task). HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: id: String id of the task to fetch Body Prams Required: At least one is required, either projectid or fileid. Optional: projectid String id of the project whose task to fetch fileid String id of the file¬†whose task to fetch status String fetch task by status priority String fetch task by¬†priority type String fetch task by¬†type Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'GET', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/isssues/tasks`, body: { projectid:"rC9Ym63SgYKurDuWk" }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Successfully retrieved tasks.", "data": [ { "_id": "9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3", "browsername": "Chrome 79.0.3945.130", "commentCreatedAt": "2020-02-17T07:53:28.223Z", "commentId": "9QPkEqjACxBcqhqL3", "commentText": "task 123", "commentType": "comment", "fileId": -1, "file_name": "", "osName": "Windows NT 4.0", "phaseId": "", "phase_name": "", "project_id": "3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9", "project_title": "Project 1", "screenId": -1, "screenResolution": "", "screenTitle": "", "taskAssignedToId": "", "taskAssignedToName": "Unassigned", "taskDescription": "", "taskId": "T0010001", "taskPriority": "Low", "taskStatus": "Open", "taskType": "Bug", "taskUrl": "http://localhost:3000/project/3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9/-1/tasks/-1", "type": "TASK", "updatedAt": "2020-02-18T09:25:24.347Z", "userId": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "userName": "Nippun", "taskFeed": [ { "taskFeedId": "01cb61a8618f1a481e6c928e", "taskFeedCreatedAt": "2020-02-17T07:53:28.223Z", "taskFeedCreatedBy": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "taskFeedText": "Nippun created the task" } ] } ] } Create¬†Tasks POST https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/ Creates new tasks for the user, data required (title, projectid). To add a task to the project, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô or ‚ÄòReviewer‚Äô in the project. Returns the data of the newly created task. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: None Body Prams Required: projectid String id of the project where task should be created title String Title of the task Optional: type String task type priority String task priority status String task status description String task description Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'POST', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks`, body: { projectid: "rC9Ym63SgYKurDuWk", title: "Task-002" }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 201, "message": "New Task Created", "data": [ { "_id": "5zRC8WepFQ9TkHhhA", "commentType": "comment", "commentCreatedAt": "2020-02-18T09:46:39.345Z", "updatedAt": "2020-02-18T09:46:39.345Z", "commentText": "Task-003", "commentLeft": "", "commentTop": "", "userId": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "userName": "Nippun", "taskId": "T0010003", "taskDescription": "", "taskType": "Bug", "taskStatus": "Open", "taskPriority": "Low", "taskAssignedToId": "", "taskAssignedToName": "Unassigned", "browsername": "", "osName": "", "phaseId": "", "phase_name": "", "fileId": "-1", "screenId": "-1", "screenResolution": "", "type": "TASK", "project_title": "Project 1", "project_id": "3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9", "commentId": "5zRC8WepFQ9TkHhhA", "taskUrl": "http://localhost:3000/NaN3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9/-1/tasks/-1/5zRC8WepFQ9TkHhhA", "taskFeed": [ { "taskFeedId": "4b7790a2aad95d925786a093", "taskFeedCreatedAt": "2020-02-18T09:46:39.345Z", "taskFeedCreatedBy": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "taskFeedText": "Nippun created the task" } ] } ] } Update¬†Task PUT https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/:id Updates the existing task for the user, data required (project id). To update the task, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô or ‚ÄòReviewer‚Äô. Returns the updated task message. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: id: String id of the task to be updated(string) Body Prams Required: At least one is required from optional Body Params. Optional: title String task title type String task type priority String task priority status String task status description String task description Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'PUT', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/1a9615b1d57d3e12e555c561`, body: { title: "task-003", }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Task successfully updated.", "data": [ { "_id": "5zRC8WepFQ9TkHhhA", "commentType": "comment", "commentCreatedAt": "2020-02-18T09:46:39.345Z", "updatedAt": "2020-02-18T09:47:15.855Z", "commentText": "Task-004", "commentLeft": "", "commentTop": "", "userId": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "userName": "Nippun", "taskId": "T0010003", "taskDescription": "", "taskType": "Bug", "taskStatus": "Open", "taskPriority": "Low", "taskAssignedToId": "", "taskAssignedToName": "Unassigned", "browsername": "", "osName": "", "phaseId": "", "phase_name": "", "fileId": "-1", "screenId": "-1", "screenResolution": "", "type": "TASK", "project_title": "Project 1", "project_id": "3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9", "commentId": "5zRC8WepFQ9TkHhhA", "taskUrl": "http://localhost:3000/NaN3y55wtEkJqvN5AKD9/-1/tasks/-1/5zRC8WepFQ9TkHhhA", "taskFeed": [ { "taskFeedId": "4b7790a2aad95d925786a093", "taskFeedCreatedAt": "2020-02-18T09:46:39.345Z", "taskFeedCreatedBy": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "taskFeedText": "Nippun created the task" }, { "taskFeedId": "1134ab7208a15df483aa3a38", "taskFeedCreatedAt": "2020-02-18T09:47:15.855Z", "taskFeedCreatedBy": "PLGMkdHJsgk5ZcFCY", "taskFeedText": " Nippun updated updated the task title." } ] } ] } Delete Task DELETE https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/:id Deletes the existing tasks for the user, data required (issues id for the task). To delete a task, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô or ‚Äòtask creator‚Äô. Returns the project data of the deleted project. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: id: String id of the task to be deleted Optional: none Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'DELETE', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/tasks/6a965c2c258bf7d41596fdc2` }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Task successfully deleted" } If you have any questions, you can check out our Forum . Cleaned Article Content: API for Issues (Feedback) - zipBoard Help API for Issues (Feedback) Welcome to the¬†zipBoard platform REST API reference. This API is essential for connecting remotely with zipBoard, regardless of whether you are building an application, scripting interactions with zipBoard or building some other integration. This page documents the REST resources available in the¬†zipBoard platform, along with the expected HTTP response codes and sample requests for interacting with feedbacks in zipBoard. Before you start working with the API, you will need to generate an API key and also get an idea of the URI Structure that needs to be followed. Please follow this article for more information on that. Get Feedback GET https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/comments/ To get the corresponding feedback related to the project of files. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: id: String id of the feedback for comments. Body Params Required: At least one of the following is required: projectid, fileid. Optional: projectid String id of the project whose feedback are to be fetched fileid String id of the file whose feedback are to be fetched Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'GET', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/isssues/comments`, body: { projectid:"rC9Ym63SgYKurDuWk" }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "data": [ { "_id": "15c604bfc3f3603c8a2a02f7", "screenId": -1, "fileId": -1, "commentId": "15c604bfc3f3603c8a2a02f7", "commentType": "comment", "commentCreatedAt": "2019-01-25T05:51:35.501Z", "updatedAt": "2019-01-25T05:51:35.501Z", "commentText": "Feedback-001", "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil", "commentCategory": "Open Comment", "browsername": "Chrome 71.0.3578.98", "osName": "Windows 8.1", "phaseId": "", "phase_name": "", "type": "DISCUSSION", "project_title": "XYZ", "project_id": "rC9Ym63SgYKurDuWk" } ] } Create Feedback POST https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/comments Creates new feedback for the user, data required (title, project id). To add feedback to the project, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô or ‚ÄòReviewer‚Äô in the project. Returns the data of newly created feedback. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: None Body Params Required: projectid String id of the project where we want to create the feedback Optional: title String task title description String task description Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'POST', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/comments`, body: { projectid: "rC9Ym63SgYKurDuWk", title: "Feedback-002" }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "New FeedBack Created", "data": { "_id": "95b0e31447d7b2eda92f0a97", "commentId": "95b0e31447d7b2eda92f0a97", "commentType": "comment", "commentCreatedAt": "2019-01-25T06:07:58.929Z", "updatedAt": "2019-01-25T06:07:58.929Z", "commentText": "Feedback-002", "commentLeft": "", "commentTop": "", "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil", "taskId": "T00002", "taskDescription": "", "taskUrl": "http://localhost:3000/NaNrC9Ym63SgYKurDuWk/-1/comments/-1/95b0e31447d7b2eda92f0a97", "browsername": "", "osName": "", "phaseId": "", "phase_name": "", "fileId": "-1", "screenId": "-1", "screenResolution": "", "type": "DISCUSSION", "project_title": "XYZ", "project_id": "rC9Ym63SgYKurDuWk", "taskFeed": [ { "taskFeedId": "98ae8c0ab3e67259767b276d", "taskFeedCreatedAt": "2019-01-25T06:07:58.929Z", "taskFeedCreatedBy": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "taskFeedText": "Rahil created the task" } ] } } Update Feedback PUT https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/comments/:id Updates the existing feedback for the user, data required (project _id). To update feedback, the role of the current user should be Owner or Manager or reviewer. Returns the updated feedback message. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: id: String id of the feedback to be updated (string) Optional: Body Params Required: title String feedback title (string) Optional: description String feedback description (string) Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'PUT', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/comments/d53d9871b9810d5757c90a2e`, body: { title: "task-003", }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "FeedBack successfully updated.", "data": [ { "_id": "d53d9871b9810d5757c90a2e", "screenId": -1, "fileId": -1, "commentId": "d53d9871b9810d5757c90a2e", "commentType": "comment", "commentCreatedAt": "2019-01-25T09:59:36.635Z", "updatedAt": "2019-01-25T10:00:18.252Z", "commentText": "Feedback-1", "userId": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "userName": "Rahil", "commentCategory": "Open Comment", "browsername": "Chrome 71.0.3578.98", "osName": "Windows 8.1", "phaseId": "", "phase_name": "", "type": "DISCUSSION", "project_title": "project 1", "project_id": "hoPjX5nfZomWKPsiw", "taskDescription": null, "taskFeed": [ { "taskFeedId": "6408abe8981730a67924f919", "taskFeedCreatedAt": "2019-01-25T10:00:18.252Z", "taskFeedCreatedBy": "N6dRgcj2RkAwBu948", "taskFeedText": " Rahil updated updated the task title." } ] } ] } Delete¬†Feedback DEL https://app.zipboard.co /api/v1/issues/comments/:id Deletes the existing feedbacks from the user, data required (issues id for the task). To delete feedbacks, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager‚Äô or ‚Äòtask creator‚Äô. Returns the deleted feedback message. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: id: String id of the feedback to be deleted (string) Optional: None Body Params { } Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'DELETE', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/issues/comments/4a51b3e911d200be2db711c2`, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Feedback Successfully deleted" } If you have any questions, you can check out our Forum . Name: Review Links
Cleaned Article Content: API for Review Links - zipBoard Help API for Review Links Welcome to the¬†zipBoard platform REST API reference. This API is essential for connecting remotely with zipBoard, regardless of whether you are building an application, scripting interactions with zipBoard or building some other integration. This page documents the REST resources available in the¬†zipBoard platform, along with the expected HTTP response codes and sample requests for interacting with zipBoard Review Links. Before you start working with the API, you will need to generate an API key and also get an idea of the URI Structure that needs to be followed. Please follow this article for more information on that. Get¬†Review Links GET https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/shareurl To get the corresponding review link for projects and files, for your collaborators and guest collaborators. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: None Body Prams Required: At least one is required from optional Body Params. Optional: projectid String id of the project to get review links of that project fileid String id of the project to get review links of that project Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'GET', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/shareurl`, body: { projectid: ‚ÄúhoPjX5nfZomWKPsiw‚Äù }, }) Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Successfully retrieved short url.", "data": [ { "fileId": "9JBNNSuGKLvGsvuhE", "linkAccess": "view", "linkTokenId": "69170a8348122074b6a6e554", "shareLink": "http://localhost:3000/s/fA47X", "loginRequired": false, "users": [], "message": "In this url user can view previous tasks and boards." }, { "fileName": "google.com", "fileId": "9JBNNSuGKLvGsvuhE", "linkAccess": "reviewboard", "shareLink": "http://localhost:3000//hoPjX5nfZomWKPsiw/9JBNNSuGKLvGsvuhE/reviewboard", "loginRequired": true, "message": "Url accessible to internal collaborators only;" } ] } Delete Review Link DEL https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/shareurl/:id Deletes the existing shareurls for the file or project, data required (tokenId for shareurl). To delete sharelink the project role of the current user should be Owner or Manager or reviewer or should be current project owner. Return success message on link delete. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: id: String linkTokenId to delete a Review Link Optional: None Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'DELETE', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/shareurl/661251867f163dcd55344c08`, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 200, "message": "Short url successfully deleted." } Create¬†Review Link POST https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/shareurl/ Creates new shareurl for the file, data required (projectId, fileid, type, secure). To add a sharelink to the project, the role of the current user should be ‚ÄòOwner‚Äô or ‚ÄòManager or ‚ÄòReviewer‚Äô or should be the current project owner. Returns the newly created sharelink. HEADERS Content-Type application/json Authorization Authorization token URL Params Required: None Optional: None Body Prams Required: projectid String id of the project fileid String id of the file type String type of link (view&comment,¬†fresh,¬†viewonly) secure Boolean true to allow user to signup before review Optional: None Request var http = require('http'); Http.request({ method: 'POST', url: `https://app.zipboard.co/api/v1/shareurl`, body: { "projectid": "h7JGWE5Rcd3coiFkY", "fileid":"Nzjv8Zj3CYki83s8E", "type":"viewonly", "secure":false }, }); Response { "status": "Success", "status code": 201, "data": [ { "fileId": "Nzjv8Zj3CYki83s8E", "projectId": "h7JGWE5Rcd3coiFkY", "linkAccess": "shareviewonly", "linkTokenId": "73b1c69413bb3371c0529666", "shareLink": "http://localhost:3000/s/2Sp43", "loginRequired": false, "clicks": 0, "message": "In this url user can view previous tasks and boards." } ] } If you have any questions, please contact our support team at support@zipboard.co. Name: How To Annotate A Recorded Video Using Zipboard
Article Content: How to Annotate a Recorded Video Using zipBoard? - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Annotate a Recorded Video Using zipBoard? üìå For new updates, please read this help article. After you have successfully recorded the screen, you can follow these easy steps to annotate the video: Select the video that you wish to review. 2.Click on the play button to start playing the video. 3. Pause the video at the frame in which you want to annotate the video and click on the comment tool to start annotating! Here's a short video demonstrating the video review process: You can also check out this article on getting feedback on videos for additional details. Did this answer your question? Name: How To Create And Annotate Quickly On Screenshots
Article Content: How to Create and Annotate Quickly on Screenshots - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact How to Create and Annotate Quickly on Screenshots Working with screenshots has now been simplified thanks to our new Screenshot and Annotate feature. You may also watch videos at the bottom! Screenshot and Annotate Feature To get started, open up any of your uploaded content through zipBoard to launch the review process. Using the toolbar on the left, click on the camera icon towards the bottom and you will see a few options appear. Select "Screenshot and Annotate" from the options given. In this mode, you will be able to mark up the image freely with the annotations in the left side toolbar and when you're done you can exit out of the review screen by clicking on the X in the top right corner. Cleaned Article Content: How to Create and Annotate Quickly on Screenshots - zipBoard Help How to Create and Annotate Quickly on Screenshots Working with screenshots has now been simplified thanks to our new Screenshot and Annotate feature. You may also watch videos at the bottom! Screenshot and Annotate Feature To get started, open up any of your uploaded content through zipBoard to launch the review process. Using the toolbar on the left, click on the camera icon towards the bottom and you will see a few options appear. Select "Screenshot and Annotate" from the options given. In this mode, you will be able to mark up the image freely with the annotations in the left side toolbar and when you're done you can exit out of the review screen by clicking on the X in the top right corner. Name: Streamlining Aec Collaboration With Zipboard
Article Content: Streamlining PDF Collaboration with our Latest Tools! - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Streamlining PDF Collaboration with our Latest Tools! Welcome to the future of collaboration with zipBoard! We're committed to empowering users with the latest tools and features designed to enhance your workflow. In the past, users faced challenges with document navigation and annotation, which could slow down productivity and collaboration. Recognizing these issues, we've implemented significant updates to address these pain points. üéâ With our latest update, we're introducing an array of powerful annotation tools to improve your document review and collaboration experience. In this guide, we'll walk you through everything you need to know to leverage these tools effectively and maximize your productivity. Let's dive in and unlock the full potential of collaborative annotation with zipBoard! ‚úÖ Try it here! Panels: With zipBoard's panels, navigating documents is now a breeze. Users can easily click through pages, eliminating the need for extensive scrolling. The panel also offers zoom functionality for improved visibility and includes a thumbnail view for quick navigation, which is particularly useful in time-sensitive projects. Outlines within the thumbnail view further enhance access to specific document sections, making your workflow more efficient and streamlined. View Controls: zipBoard's view controls offer teams a multitude of options to tailor their viewing experience according to their preferences and project requirements. Page Transition - Seamlessly switch between continuous scrolling or page-by-page navigation, catering to different workflow preferences. Page Orientation - Rotate pages clockwise or counter-clockwise for enhanced viewing control, particularly useful for documents with varied orientations. Page Layout - Choose from single-page, double-page, or cover-facing layouts to optimize viewing setup, improving clarity and comprehension for individuals. Zooming Options: zipBoard offers teams convenient ways to adjust their view for enhanced collaboration and review. Numeric Zoom - Easily adjust the zoom level by selecting preset percentages or fit-to-width/fit-to-page options for optimal visibility. Marquee Zoom - Select a specific area within the document by dragging a marquee selection tool. Upon release, zipBoard automatically zooms in on the selected area for detailed inspection. Quick Controls: Alternatively, utilize intuitive plus and minus buttons for swift zoom adjustments, ensuring seamless collaboration during document review. Mark Up Tools View Tab This tab allows users to view the document without making any annotations, providing a clear and unobstructed view for reference or review. Annotate Tab Within this tab, users can access various basic annotation tools to mark up the document effectively. Highlight: This tool allows users to apply a translucent color overlay to emphasize specific text or elements within the document. Free Text: Users can add text directly onto the document, providing additional context or comments. Rectangle: This tool enables users to draw rectangular shapes around specific areas of interest within the document. Free Hand: Represented by a pencil icon, this tool allows users to draw freehand lines or annotations directly onto the document. Free Hand Highlight: Similar to the free hand tool, this option allows users to draw highlighted areas freely on the document. New Additions: Underline: Users can underline text to indicate emphasis or importance within the document. Strikeout: This tool allows users to draw a line through text to indicate deletion or removal. Squiggly: Similar to underline and strikeout, this tool adds a wavy line to text for additional emphasis or to indicate a suggestion for change. Note: Represented by a callout box. Hyperlinks Customization Options: Upon selecting any of the annotation tools, users can customize various aspects such as color, opacity, stroke thickness, and text styles to tailor the annotations according to their preferences or project requirements. Additional Controls: On the far right of the interface, users will find undo buttons and an eraser icon, providing options to correct or remove annotations as needed. Shapes Tab Designed with AEC teams in mind, this tab introduces essential tools for precise document annotation and markup. Ellipse: Create elliptical shapes to highlight specific areas or elements within documents. Arc: Add curved lines or arcs to draw attention to curved features or sections within drawings or designs. Polygon: Draw polygons to outline specific areas or shapes within architectural or engineering plans. Cloud: Just like polygon but with spiral line. Line: Draw straight lines to connect points or delineate boundaries within drawings or schematics. Polyline: Create complex, multi-segmented lines to outline intricate features or paths within designs. Arrow: Add arrows to indicate directions, flows, or points of interest within architectural or engineering drawings, enhancing clarity and communication. Insert Tab An enhanced feature set designed to provide teams or individuals with expanded document customization options. Old Player Features: Signature: Quickly add digital signatures to documents for approval. Stamp: Utilize predefined stamps for common annotations or create custom stamps for specific needs. New Additions: Insert Image: Effortlessly incorporate images into your documents to enhance visual communication. Callout: Highlight key points or provide additional context with callout annotations. Fill and Sign A suite of tools designed to streamline document completion and authentication. Cross (or X): Use the cross tool to mark items as incorrect, highlight errors, or indicate items for removal within documents. Tick (or Check): Employ the tick tool to confirm or approve items, validate completed tasks, or indicate correctness within documents. Dot: Utilize the dot tool to indicate points of interest, highlight specific areas, or mark items for attention within documents. Calendar Stamp: Seamlessly add date and time stamps to documents for record-keeping, tracking changes, or establishing document timelines. Additional Tools Search: Seamlessly locate specific keywords within documents, facilitating efficient navigation and information retrieval. Comment Tab: Access all comments made within the document, enabling users to search, sort, and filter comments based on various criteria. Users can reply to comments, approve them directly from the document, and manage their own comments by editing or deleting them. Settings Tab: Customize your viewing experience with options such as Full Screen mode, Print functionality, Dark Mode for reduced eye strain, and Language preferences. Just a note, language does not translate the document, but only the words in the player. zipBoard provides an intuitive platform for document collaboration, catering to users across diverse industries. Offering precise annotation tools, comprehensive comment management, and customizable settings, zipBoard streamlines workflows and enhances communication. Users report completing reviews up to 50% faster with zipBoard, helping teams avoid costly mistakes and project delays, and facilitating a smoother transition from reviews to the next project stage. Did this answer your question? Thanks for the feedback There was a problem submitting your feedback. Please try again later. Yes No Still need help? Name: Enhancing Pdf Collaboration How To Draw On A Pdf In Zipboard
Article Content: Enhancing PDF Collaboration: How to Draw on a PDF in zipBoard - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Enhancing PDF Collaboration: How to Draw on a PDF in zipBoard Teams in AEC, Education, and Design need a cloud-based solution that simplifies feedback, approvals, and document revisions. zipBoard makes PDF markup intuitive and collaborative. Traditional PDF markup is slow, manual, and disconnected. - Multiple email threads. Constant back-and-forth slows projects down. - Version chaos. Which file is the latest? Who made what change? - No real-time collaboration. Feedback gets lost, delaying approvals. Jump: How to Draw on a PDF in zipBoard Seamless PDF Annotation with zipBoard zipBoard transforms PDF markup with a centralized, collaborative workspace where users can draw, annotate, and review documents effortlessly. Whether you‚Äôre working on blueprints, eLearning content, or design approvals , zipBoard provides an intuitive PDF annotator for effective document collaboration. Want to see zipBoard‚Äôs drawing tools in action? üîπ Try the Live Demo and experience real-time PDF markup & collaboration with our drawing and annotation tools! How zipBoard‚Äôs PDF Markup Tool Streamlines Your Workflow? Unlike traditional PDF markup tools, zipBoard: Enables real-time collaboration ‚ÄîMultiple users can annotate PDFs simultaneously, reducing approval cycles. Eliminates version confusion with an integrated version control system. Simplifies approvals and feedback loops across various industries. Works across industries - AEC, L&D, UX/UI, and technical documentation teams use zipBoard to speed up feedback. Supports guest reviewers - Clients and external stakeholders can comment without creating an account Integrates seamlessly - Works with Document management systems, task management systems using native integrations and custom APIs. Why Teams Love zipBoard‚Äôs PDF Markup Tools Real-Time Collaboration Multiple users can draw & annotate simultaneously‚Äîno back-and-forth emails. Advanced Drawing & Markup Tools Precision markups with pen, polygon, arc, cloud, arrow & measurement tools. Approval & Review Workflows Digitally sign PDFs and use status stamps (Approved, Needs Revision, etc.). No Software Installation Needed Access entirely in your browser‚Äîno downloads required. How to Draw on a PDF in zipBoard Step 1: Upload Your PDF Sign up for a free trial and create a project. Click "Add Content" and select your PDF to begin markup. Alternative Method: Connect your Document Storage system to import files directly. Step 2: Open the PDF in the Annotation Viewer Click on the uploaded file to launch the markup tool , where you can access drawing and annotation features. Step 3: Use the Drawing and Annotation Tools zipBoard‚Äôs PDF markup tool offers a comprehensive set of annotation tools tailored for different use cases‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre reviewing blueprints, eLearning content, or compliance documents . Freehand Drawing & Shapes Pen Tool ‚Äì Draw sketches or handwritten notes. Polygon, Polyline & Arc Tools ‚Äì Ideal for architectural & engineering markups. Cloud Tool ‚Äì Highlight changes in blueprints and design approvals (used extensively in AEC & construction). Text & Annotation Tools Text Tool ‚Äì Add clear comments directly on the document. Sticky Notes ‚Äì Provide contextual feedback without cluttering the document. Hyperlinks ‚Äì Link to external resources or reference documents. Precision Markup Tools for Architects, Engineers & Designers Arrow, Line & Measurement Tools ‚Äì Add precise markups & dimensions. Highlight & Strikeout ‚Äì Mark important sections or request deletions. Color Customization ‚Äì Change text, stroke thickness, opacity, and colors for better organization. Approval & Review Features Signatures ‚Äì Digitally sign PDFs for quick approvals. Stamps & Status Indicators ‚Äì Use predefined or custom approval stamps (Approved, Pending, Needs Revision, etc.) Step 4: Collaborate with Your Team @Mention teammates to notify them about specific changes. Assign tasks, set deadlines, and track document approvals. Add external reviewers or clients ‚Äîno signup required. Organize feedback efficiently using Kanban or Table view . Step 5: Track Changes & Manage Versions View all annotations in a structured comment panel . Keep track of document iterations with built-in document version control . Document version control lets you access past iterations in case changes need to be reversed. Export marked-up PDFs ‚ÄîDownload or print PDFs with or without annotations, depending on your needs. Generate automated reports ‚ÄîCompile feedback and annotations into structured reports for easy review. üëâ READ: Streamlining PDF Collaboration with our Latest Tools! How Different Industries Benefit from Drawing on PDFs using zipBoard Contractors & engineers often struggle with scattered feedback on blueprints. How zipBoard Helps: ‚úÖ Annotate blueprints for contractor approvals and design changes in real-time. ‚úÖ Keep all comments & markups centralized ‚Äîno more messy email chains. SME‚Äôs need a quick way to provide feedback on digital courses & content. How zipBoard Helps: ‚úÖ Annotate digital courses for easy expert feedback. ‚úÖ Use predefined stamps like "Reviewed" or "Needs Revision" for efficiency. UX/UI designers struggle with scattered feedback across multiple PDFs . How zipBoard Helps: ‚úÖ Centralized PDF review for wireframes & design approvals. ‚úÖ Mention team members directly inside the document. Technical Documentation ‚Äì Mark up manuals, schematics, and reports while ensuring compliance. How zipBoard Stacks Up Against Other PDF Tools Unlike Adobe , zipBoard lets you add unlimited reviewers with no hassle. Bluebeam requires software downloads, while zipBoard is entirely web-based for instant access. Dropbox stores files but lacks real-time markup and version control, which zipBoard seamlessly integrates for smooth collaboration. Feature zipBoard Adobe Acrobat Bluebeam Dropbox Real-Time Collaboration ‚úÖ Yes ‚ùå No ‚ùå No ‚ùå No Unlimited Guest Reviewers ‚úÖ Yes ‚ùå No ‚ùå No ‚ùå No Cloud-Based Access ‚úÖ Yes ‚úÖ Yes ‚ùå No ‚úÖ Yes Task & Feedback Tracking ‚úÖ Yes ‚ùå No ‚ùå No ‚ùå No Secure External Sharing ‚úÖ Yes ‚úÖ Yes ‚úÖ Yes ‚ùå Limited Web-Based (No Installation Needed) ‚úÖ Yes ‚ùå No ‚ùå No ‚úÖ Yes What Happens After PDF Collaboration? After your team has reviewed the PDF in zipBoard: Export the PDF ‚ÄîDownload it with or without annotations. Generate Reports ‚ÄîCompile all feedback into structured reports. Track Changes‚ÄîAccess previous versions with built-in document version control. Sync with Project Tools ‚ÄîPush approvals to Slack, Jira, or MS Teams for seamless workflow. Ready to Simplify PDF Collaboration? ‚úî Instantly collect & track feedback‚Äîwithout messy email threads! ‚úî Invite unlimited guest reviewers‚Äîno sign-up required. ‚úî Real-time collaboration & markup‚Äîno software downloads. üîπ Start a Free Trial Now ‚Üí No credit card required! üîπ Book a Live Demo ‚Üí Get a customized walkthrough. üîπ Read More on Our Blog ‚Üí Explore our latest PDF collaboration feature Did this answer your question? Name: Web Design Template For Design Feedback Qa
Article Content: Web Design Template for Design Feedback & QA - zipBoard Help Toggle Navigation Home zipBoard Users Knowledge Base APIs Contact Contact Web Design Template for Design Feedback & QA Managing web design feedback across multiple stakeholders‚Äîdesigners, developers, and project managers, can become overwhelming. Disorganized revisions, unclear feedback, and delayed approvals often slow down projects and impact launch timelines. zipBoard‚Äôs Web Design Feedback Template simplifies the design review process by providing a structured workflow for collecting stakeholder feedback, tracking revisions, and managing approvals. With predefined phases and statuses, your team can streamline collaboration, reduce miscommunication, and launch websites with confidence. Common Web Design Challenges & How This Template Helps: Issue: Stakeholder feedback is scattered across emails ‚Üí Solution: Centralized feedback & visual annotations. Issue: Slow approval process ‚Üí Solution: Structured design iterations & organized sign-offs. Issue: Too many revision cycles ‚Üí Solution: Clear task tracking to minimize misunderstandings. Phases Ensure a seamless review process by organizing your workflow into structured phases. Keep track of design progress, feedback, and approvals efficiently. Key Phases & What Happens in Each Stage: Research & Discovery (Default): Project goals, client requirements, competitor analysis. Wireframing: Low-fidelity layouts, website structure, navigation planning. Prototyping: Interactive design models, user interaction visualization, functionality preview. User Validation: Usability testing, stakeholder feedback, user experience refinement. Client Review: Stakeholder approvals, design adjustments, final refinements. Final Approval: Design sign-off, preparation for development, handoff to dev team. üí° Even with pre-configured Phases, you have the flexibility to customize them based on your web design workflow. Types Assign and track tasks to ensure a smooth design iteration process and effective feedback resolution. Task Types & When to Use Them: Design Brief (Default): Define project objectives, target audience, and key requirements. Sitemap: Structure website navigation for an intuitive user experience. Wireframe: Establish page layouts and content placement for user flow. Information Architecture: Organize content hierarchy and site structure for clarity. Prototype: Develop interactive mockups to simulate user interactions. Brand Guidelines: Standardize typography, color schemes, and design elements for consistency. Project Statuses Track each stage of the design review process and keep everyone aligned on project status. What Do These Statuses Mean in a Web Design Project? Project Initiation (Default): Define project scope, deliverables, and timelines. Wireframing: Develop and review structural layouts for the website. Development: Transition approved designs into front-end and back-end development. Testing & Review: Conduct user testing and gather feedback for refinements. Refinement Phase: Implement necessary changes based on feedback and final QA. Ready for Development: Approved designs are finalized and handed off for coding. Views Get a complete overview of your design workflow with flexible viewing options. How Different Roles Use These Views: Designers: Use Kanban View to manage design iterations and revisions. Project Managers: Use Table View to track feedback, revisions, and approvals. Stakeholders & Clients: Use Task & Upload Views to review design files and provide annotations. Integrations Enhance collaboration and streamline workflows with powerful integrations. How Integrations Improve Web Design Workflows: Slack : Get real-time notifications on design feedback and approvals. MS Teams : Communicate seamlessly with designers, developers, SMEs, and stakeholders. Outlook : Manage feedback requests and deadlines through email. Jira : Connect design reviews with development sprints. Wrike : Track web design tasks and manage workflows. Zapier & APIs: Automate processes and connect zipBoard with design software. Ready to Simplify Web Design Reviews? üìÇ Check out our latest updates on the zipBoard Blog . Want a hands-on experience? Request a Demo and explore how zipBoard can streamline your workflows.
